original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: imaṃ vivasvate yogaṃ proktavān aham avyayam /
analyzed: imam vivasvate yogam proktavān aham avyayam
translated: To Vivasvan I declared this imperishable yoga.

original: vivasvān manave prāha manur ikṣvākave 'bravīt ////
analyzed: vivasvān manave prāha manuḥ ikṣvākave bravīt
translated: Vivasvan expounded it to Manu, and Manu to Ikshvaku.

original: śrīdharaḥ /
translated: Sridhar.

original: āvirbhāvatirobhāvāv āviṣkartuṃ svayaṃ hariḥ /
analyzed: āvirbhāva tirobhāvau āviṣkartum svayam hariḥ
translated: Hari himself, to reveal manifestation and withdrawal,

original: tattvaṃ padavivekārthaṃ karmayogaṃ praśaṃsati //
analyzed: tattvam pada viveka artham karmayogam praśaṃsati
translated: praises karma-yoga for the purpose of discriminating the stages of reality.

original: evaṃ tāvad adhyāyadvayena karmayogopāyakajñānayogo mokṣasādhanatvenoktaḥ /
analyzed: evam tāvat adhyāya dvayena karmayoga upāyaka jñānayogaḥ mokṣa sādhana tvena uktaḥ
translated: Thus far, by two chapters, karma-yoga and jnana-yoga, the means, have been stated as the means to liberation.

original: tad evaṃ brahmārpaṇādiguṇavidhānena tattvaṃ padārthavivekādinā ca prapañciṣyan prathamaṃ tāvat parasparāprāptatvena stuvan bhagavān uvāca
analyzed: tat evam brahma arpaṇa ādi guṇa vidhānena tattvam padārtha viveka ādinā ca prapañciṣyan prathamam tāvat paraspara aprāptatvena stuvan bhagavān uvāca
translated: Thus, intending to elaborate on reality by prescribing the qualities beginning with Brahma-arpana and by discriminating the stages of reality, the Lord first praises them as mutually unattainable, and said:

original: imam iti tribhiḥ /
analyzed: imam iti tribhiḥ
translated: This - with three (verses).

original: avyayaphalatvād avyayam /
analyzed: avyaya phala tvāt avyayam
translated: Imperishable, because of its imperishable result.

original: imaṃ yogaṃ purāham vivasvata ādityāya kathitavān /🔽sa ca svaputrāya manave śrāddhadevāya /
analyzed: imam yogam purā aham vivasvate ādityāya kathitavān  sa ca sva putrāya manave śrāddhadevāya
translated: To Vivasvan, the sun, I declared this yoga in the past.🔽And he expounded it to his son, Manu, the deity of the ancestral offerings.

original: sa ca manuḥ svaputrāyekṣvākave 'bravīt ////
analyzed: sa ca manuḥ sva putrāya ikṣvākave bravīt
translated: And that Manu told it to his son, Ikshvaku.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: yadyapi pūrvam upeyatvena jñānayogas tadupāyatvena ca karmayoga iti dvau yogau
analyzed: yadi api pūrvam upeya tvena jñāna yogaḥ tad upāya tvena ca karma yogaḥ iti dvau yogau
translated: Although earlier two yogas were mentioned - the yoga of knowledge as the goal and the yoga of action as its means,

original: kathitau tathāpi ekaṃ sāṅkhyaṃ ca yogaṃ ca paśyati sa paśyati Gītā / ity anayā
analyzed: kathitau tathā api ekam sāṅkhyam ca yogam ca paśyati sa paśyati gītāḥ iti anayā
translated: nevertheless, in the sense expressed by the verse He who sees the same reality in all things, he sees. (5.18),

original: diśā sādhyasādhanayoḥ phalaikyād aikyam upacarya sādhanabhūtaṃ karmayogaṃ sādhyabhūtaṃ
analyzed: diśā sādhya sādhanayoḥ phala aikyāt aikyam upacarya sādhana bhūtam karmayogam sādhya bhūtam
translated: the goal and the means are considered to be one due to the oneness of the result. The Lord praises the yoga of action, which is the means,

original: ca jñānayogam anekavidhaguṇavidhānāya stauti vaṃśakathanena bhagavān /
analyzed: ca jñāna yogam anekavidha guṇa vidhānāya stauti vaṃśa kathanena bhagavān
translated: and the yoga of knowledge, which is the goal, by narrating the genealogy, in order to prescribe its many qualities.

original: imam adhyāyadvayenoktaṃ yogaṃ jñānaniṣṭhālakṣaṇaṃ karmaniṣṭhopāyalabhyaṃ vivasvate
analyzed: imam adhyāya dvayena uktam yogam jñāna niṣṭhā lakṣaṇam karma niṣṭhā upāya labhyam vivasvate
translated: This yoga, characterized by the stage of knowledge, which is attainable by the means of the stage of action, was spoken by the Sun

original: sarvakṣatriyavaṃśabījabhūtāyādityāya proktavān prakarṣeṇa sarvasandehocchedādirūpeṇoktavān🔽ahaṃ bhagavān vāsudevaḥ sarvajagatparipālakaḥ sargādikāle rājñāṃ balādhānena tadadhīnaṃ
analyzed: sarva kṣatriya vaṃśa bīja bhūtāya ādityāya proktavān prakarṣeṇa sarva sandeha uccheda ādi rūpeṇa uktavān  aham bhagavān vāsudevaḥ sarva jagat paripālakaḥ sarga ādi kāle rājñām bala ādhānena tad adhīnam
translated: to Vivasvan, the seed of all the Kshatriya dynasties, in this chapter. It was spoken in the highest sense, by completely removing all doubts.

original: sarvaṃ jagat pālayitum /
analyzed: sarvam jagat pālayitum
translated: I, the Lord Vāsudeva, the protector of the entire world, in order to protect the entire world, which is under the control of kings by the bestowal of power at the time of creation and so on,🔽spoke this yoga.

original: katham anena balādhānam iti viśeṣeṇena darśayati avyayam avyayavedamūlatvād avyayaphalatvāc ca na vyeti svaphalād ity avyayam avyabhicāriphalam
analyzed: katham anena bala ādhānam iti darśayati avyayam avyaya veda mūla tvāt avyaya phala tvāt ca na vyeti sva phalāt iti avyayam avyabhicāri phalam
translated: How is this strength attained by him? This is shown by the word 'avyayam'. It is 'avyayam' because it is based on the Vedas which are eternal and because it has eternal results. It does not perish from its own fruits, therefore it is 'avyayam', having infallible results.

original: tathā caitādṛśena balādhānaṃ śakyam iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca etādṛśena bala ādhānam śakyam iti bhāvaḥ
translated: And it is thought that such strength can be attained in this way.

original: sa ca mama śiṣyo vivasvān manave vaivasvatāya svaputrāya prāha /
analyzed: sa ca mama śiṣyaḥ vivasvān manave vaivasvatāya sva putrāya prāha
translated: And that Sun, my disciple, told Manu Vaivasvata, his own son.

original: sa ca manur ikṣvākave svaputrāyādirājāyābravīt /
analyzed: sa ca manuḥ ikṣvākave sva putrāya ādirājāya abravīt
translated: And that Manu told Ikshvaku, his own son, the first king.

original: yadyapi prati manvantaraṃ svāyambhuvādisādhāraṇo 'yaṃ bhāgavadupdeśas tathāpi sāmpratikavaivasvatamanvantarābhiprāyeṇādityam ārabhya sampradāyo
analyzed: yadi api prati manvantaram svāyambhuva ādi sādhāraṇaḥ yam bhāgavat updeśaḥ tathā api sāmpratika vaivasvata manvantara abhiprāyeṇa ādityam ārabhya sampradāyaḥ
translated: Although this teaching of the Bhagavata is common to all Manus, beginning with the self-existent one, for each Manu-period, still the tradition beginning with the Sun is based on the intention of the present Vaivasvata Manu.

original: gaṇitaḥ ////
analyzed: gaṇitaḥ
translated: It is calculated.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: turye svāvirbhāvahetor nityatvaṃ janmakarmaṇoḥ /
analyzed: turye sva āvirbhāva hetoḥ nitya tvam janma karmaṇoḥ
translated: In the fourth, the eternality of birth and deeds, which are the cause of His manifestation,

original: svasyoktiṃ brahmayajñādijñānotkarṣaprapañcam //
analyzed: svasya uktim brahmayajña ādi jñāna utkarṣa prapañcam
translated: And the elaboration of the excellence of knowledge such as the Brahma-sacrifice, which is His own, are stated.

original: adhyāyadvayenoktaṃ niṣkāmakarmasādhyaṃ jñānayogaṃ stauti imam iti ////
analyzed: adhyāya dvayena uktam niṣkāma karma sādhyam jñāna yogam stauti imam iti
translated: In two chapters, he praises the knowledge-yoga, which is accomplished by selfless action, with the words 'imam' etc.

original: baladevaḥ /
analyzed: baladevaḥ
translated: Balarama.

original: turye svābhivyaktihetuṃ svalīlā
translated: In the fourth, the cause of His own manifestation is His own pastimes.

original: nityatvaṃ satkarmasu jñānayogam /🔽jñānasyāpi prāy yanmāhātmyam uccaiḥ
analyzed: nitya tvam sat karmasu jñāna yogam  jñānasya api yat māhātmyam uccais
translated: The eternal nature of good actions and the yoga of knowledge,

original: prākhyad devo devakīnandano 'sau //
analyzed: prākhyat devaḥ devakīnandana sau
translated: And the greatness of knowledge itself, the god, the delighter of Devaki, has proclaimed loudly.

original: pūrvādhyāyābhyām uktaṃ jñānayogaṃ karmayogaṃ caikaphalatvād ekīkṛtya tadvaṃśaṃ kīrtayan stauti imam iti /
analyzed: pūrva adhyāyābhyām uktam jñāna yogam karma yogam ca eka phala tvāt ekīkṛtya tad vaṃśam kīrtayan stauti imam iti
translated: Having combined the knowledge yoga and action yoga, which are spoken of in the previous two chapters, as having the same result, he praises it by narrating its lineage, saying this and so on.

original: imaṃ tvāṃ sūryāyāhaṃ proktavān /
analyzed: imam tvām sūryāya aham proktavān
translated: This - I have spoken to you, Surya.

original: avyayaṃ nityaṃ vedārtahtvān naveyeti svaphalādityavyabhicāriphalatvāc ca /
analyzed: avyayam nityam veda ārta htvāt sva phalāt iti avyabhicāri phala tvāt ca
translated: Imperishable - eternal, because it is the meaning of the Vedas, and not to be known because it is not subject to the results of its own actions, such as the sun.

original: sa ca macchiṣyo vivasvān svaputrāya manave vaivasvatāya prāha /
analyzed: sa ca mad śiṣyaḥ vivasvān sva putrāya manave vaivasvatāya prāha
translated: And that Vivasvan, my disciple, spoke to his son Manu Vaivasvata.

original: sa ca manur ikṣvākave svaputrāyābravīt ////
analyzed: sa ca manuḥ ikṣvākave sva putrāya abravīt
translated: And that Manu spoke to his son Ikshvaku.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: evaṃ paramparāprāptam imaṃ rājarṣayo viduḥ /
analyzed: evam paramparā prāptam imam rājarṣayaḥ viduḥ
translated: The royal sages know this, which has come down through a succession of teachers.

original: sa kāleneha mahatā yogo naṣṭaḥ parantapa ////
analyzed: sa kālena iha mahatā yogaḥ naṣṭaḥ parantapa
translated: But, O scorcher of enemies, this yoga has been lost in this world through the passage of time.

original: śrīdharaḥ / evam iti /
translated: Sridhar: Thus and so on.

original: evaṃ rājānaś ca te ṛṣayaś ceti /
analyzed: evam rājānaḥ ca te ṛṣayaḥ ca iti
translated: Thus, they are both kings and sages.

original: anye 'pi rājarṣayo nimipramukhāḥ /
analyzed: anye pi rāja ṛṣayaḥ nimi pramukhāḥ
translated: Other royal sages, headed by Nimi,

original: svapitrādibhir ikṣvākupramukhaiḥ protkam imaṃ yogam vidur jānanti sma /
analyzed: sva pitṛ ādibhiḥ ikṣvāku pramukhaiḥ protkam imam yogam viduḥ jānanti sma
translated: know, have known, this yoga, which has been passed down by their own fathers and so on, headed by Ikshvaku.

original: adyatanānām ajñāne kāraṇam āha he parantapa śatrupātana /
analyzed: adyatanānām ajñāne kāraṇam āha he parantapa śatru pātana
translated: The cause of the ignorance of the present people, O scorcher of enemies, O destroyer of enemies,

original: sa yogaḥ kālavaśād iha loke naṣṭo vicchinnaḥ ////
analyzed: sa yogaḥ kāla vaśāt iha loke naṣṭaḥ vicchinnaḥ
translated: That Yoga, due to the influence of time, has disappeared in this world, has been interrupted...

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: evam ādityam ārabhya guruśiṣyaparamparayā prāptam imaṃ yogaṃ rājānaś ca ta ṛṣayaś
analyzed: evam ādityam ārabhya guru śiṣya paramparayā prāptam imam yogam rājānaḥ ca te ṛṣayaḥ
translated: Thus, beginning with the sun, this Yoga, which has been transmitted through the lineage of teachers and disciples, has been known by the royal sages, who are both kings and sages,

original: ceti rājarṣayaḥ prabhutve sati sūkṣmārthanirīkṣaṇakṣamā nimipramukhāḥ svapitrādiproktaṃ viduḥ /
analyzed: ca iti rājarṣayaḥ prabhu tve sati sūkṣma artha nirīkṣaṇa kṣamāḥ nimi pramukhāḥ sva pitṛ ādi proktam viduḥ
translated: who are capable of examining subtle meanings while having authority, such as Nimi and others, as taught by their own fathers and ancestors.

original: tasmād anādivedamūlatvenānantaphalatvenānādiguruśiṣyaparamparāprāptatvena ca kṛtrimatvaśaṅkānāspadatvān mahāprabhāvo 'yaṃ yoga iti
analyzed: tasmāt anādi veda mūla tvena ananta phala tvena anādi guru śiṣya paramparā prāptatvena ca kṛtrima tva śaṅkā anāspada tvāt mahā prabhāvaḥ yam yogaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, this Yoga, being free from the possibility of being artificial due to being based on the Vedas without beginning, having infinite fruits, and being transmitted through the lineage of teachers and disciples without beginning, is of great power.

original: śraddhātiśayāya stūyate /
analyzed: śraddhā atiśayāya stūyate
translated: It is praised for the purpose of excessive faith.

original: sa evaṃ mahāprayojano 'pi yogaḥ kālena mahatā dīrgheṇa dharmahrāsakareṇehedānīm
analyzed: saḥ evam mahā prayojanaḥ yogaḥ kālena mahatā dīrgheṇa dharma hrāsa kareṇa iha idānīm
translated: Although this Yoga has such great purpose, due to time, which is long and causes the decrease of Dharma,

original: āvayor vyavahārakāle dvāparānte durbalān ajitendriyān anadhikāriṇaḥ prāpya kāmakrodhādibhir
analyzed: āvayoḥ vyavahāra kāle dvāpara ante durbalān ajita indriyān anadhikāriṇaḥ prāpya kāma krodha ādibhiḥ
translated: nowadays, at the time of our interaction, at the end of Dvapara, having reached the unqualified ones with weak senses and uncontrolled senses, being overwhelmed by desire, anger, etc.,

original: abhibhūyamāno naṣṭo vicchinnasampradāyo jātaḥ /
analyzed: abhibhūyamānaḥ naṣṭaḥ vicchinna sampradāyaḥ jātaḥ
translated: it has disappeared, has become interrupted in its tradition.

original: taṃ vinā puruṣārthāprāpter aho daurbhāgyaṃ lokasyeti śocati bhagavān /
analyzed: tam vinā puruṣa artha aprāpteḥ aho daurbhāgyam lokasya iti śocati bhagavān
translated: Without Him, the world does not attain its goal. Oh, what misfortune for the world! Thus the Lord grieves.

original: he parantapa /
analyzed: he parantapa
translated: O scorcher of foes!

original: paraṃ kāmakrodhādirūpaṃ śatrugaṇaṃ śauryeṇa balavatā vivekena tapasā ca bhānur iva tāpayatīti parantapaḥ śatrutāpano jitendriya ity arthaḥ
analyzed: param kāma krodha ādi rūpam śatru gaṇam śauryeṇa balavatā vivekena tapasā ca bhānuḥ iva tāpayati iti parantapaḥ śatru tāpanaḥ jita indriyaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The sun scorches the enemy hosts in the form of lust, anger, etc., with its valour, strength, discrimination, and austerity. Thus, the scorcher of foes, the one who burns enemies, is the one who has conquered the senses.

original: urvaśyupekṣaṇādyadbhutakarmadarśanāt /
analyzed: urvaśī upekṣaṇa ādi adbhuta karma darśanāt
translated: By seeing His wonderful deeds like ignoring Urvasi, etc.

original: tasmāt tvaṃ jitendriyatvād atrādhikārīti sūcayati ////
analyzed: tasmāt tvam jita indriya tvāt atra adhikārī iti sūcayati
translated: Therefore, He indicates that you are qualified for this [knowledge] because you have conquered the senses.

original: viśvanāthaḥ / Nothing /
analyzed: viśvanāthaḥ nothing
translated: Visvanatha: Nothing.

original: baladevaḥ / evaṃ vivasvantam ārabhya guruśiṣyaparamparayā prāptam iimaṃ yogaṃ rājarṣayaḥ svapitrādibhir ikṣvākuprabhṛtibhir upadiṣṭaṃ viduḥ
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam vivasvantam ārabhya guru śiṣya paramparayā prāptam yogam rājarṣayaḥ sva pitṛ ādibhiḥ ikṣvāku prabhṛtibhiḥ upadiṣṭam viduḥ
translated: Balarama: Thus, the royal sages know this yoga, which was obtained through the guru-disciple lineage starting from Vivasvan, and was taught by their fathers and others like Ikshvaku.

original: iha loke naṣṭo vicchinnasampradāyaḥ ////
analyzed: iha loke naṣṭaḥ vicchinna sampradāyaḥ
translated: In this world, it has been lost and the tradition has been broken.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: sa evāyaṃ mayā te 'dya yogaḥ proktaḥ purātanaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva ayam mayā te dya yogaḥ proktaḥ purātanaḥ
translated: That very ancient yoga is now declared to you by Me,

original: bhakto 'si me sakhā ceti rahasyaṃ hy etad uttamam ////
analyzed: bhaktaḥ si me sakhā ca iti rahasyam hi etat uttamam
translated: because you are My devotee and friend. This is the supreme secret.

original: śrīdharaḥ / sa evāyam iti /
analyzed: śrīdharaḥ saḥ eva ayam iti
translated: Sridhar: That very same...

original: sa evāyaṃ yogo 'dya vicchinne sampradāye sati punaś ca te tubhyam uktaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva ayam yogaḥ vicchinne sampradāye sati punar ca te tubhyam uktaḥ
translated: That very same Yoga, which was formerly taught by me, has now, when the tradition has been broken, been again taught by me to you.

original: yatas tvaṃ mama bhakto 'si sakhā ca /
analyzed: yatas tvam mama bhaktā si sakhā ca
translated: Because you are my devotee and friend.

original: anyasmai mayā nocyate /
analyzed: anyasmai mayā na ucyate
translated: It is not taught to anyone else.

original: hi yasmād etad uttamaṃ rahasyam ////
analyzed: hi yasmāt etat uttamam rahasyam
translated: For, indeed, this is the highest secret.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: ya evaṃ pūrvam upadiṣṭo 'py adhikāryabhāvād vicchinnasampradāyo 'bhūt /
analyzed: yaḥ evam pūrvam upadiṣṭaḥ pi adhikārī abhāvāt vicchinna sampradāyaḥ bhūt
translated: Although this [Yoga] was formerly taught, it became a broken tradition due to the absence of qualified recipients.

original: yaṃ vinā ca puruṣārtho na labhyate /
analyzed: yam vinā ca puruṣa arthaḥ na labhyate
translated: And without it, human goals cannot be attained.

original: sa evāyaṃ purātano 'nādiguruparamparāgato yogo 'dya sampradāyavicchedakāle mayātisnigdhena te tubhyaṃ prakarṣeṇoktaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva ayam purātanaḥ nādi guru paramparā gataḥ yogaḥ sampradāya viccheda kāle mayā ati snigdhena te tubhyam prakarṣeṇa uktaḥ
translated: That very ancient Yoga, which has come down through an unbroken line of beginningless gurus, has now been emphatically taught by me, who am extremely affectionate towards you, at a time when the tradition has been broken.

original: na tv anyasmai kasmaicit /
analyzed: na tu anyasmai kasmaicid
translated: But not to anyone else at all.

original: kasmāt / bhakto 'si me sakhā ceti /
analyzed: kasmāt bhaktaḥ si me sakhā ca iti
translated: Why? Because you are my devotee and friend.

original: itiśabdo hetau /
analyzed: iti śabdaḥ hetau
translated: The word 'iti' is in the sense of reason.

original: yasmāt tvaṃ mama bhaktaḥ śaraṇāgatatve saty atyantaprītimān sakhā ca samānavayāḥ snigdhasahāyo 'si sarvadā bhavasi atas tubhyam ukta ity
analyzed: yasmāt tvam mama bhaktaḥ śaraṇa āgata tve sati atyanta prītimān sakhā ca samāna vayāḥ snigdha sahāyaḥ si sarvadā bhavasi atas tubhyam uktaḥ iti
translated: Because you are my devotee, full of extreme love upon surrendering, and a friend, a loving companion of the same age, you always are. Therefore, it is said to you.

original: arthaḥ anyasmai kuto nocyate tatrāha /
analyzed: arthaḥ anyasmai kutas na ucyate tatra āha
translated: The meaning is: Why is it not taught to anyone else? In that regard, he says:

original: hi yasmād etaj jñānam uttamaṃ rahasyam atigopyam ////
analyzed: hi yasmāt etat jñānam uttamam rahasyam ati gopyam
translated: because this knowledge is the best, the secret, the most confidential.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: tvāṃ praty evāsya proktatve hetuḥ /
analyzed: tvām prati eva asya prokta tve hetuḥ
translated: The reason for its being spoken to you alone is:

original: bhakto dāsaḥ sakhā ceti bhāvadvayam /
analyzed: bhaktaḥ dāsaḥ sakhā ca iti bhāva dvayam
translated: The two states of devotion, servitude, and friendship.

original: anyas tu arvācīnaṃ praty eva avaktavyatve hetū rahasyam iti ////🔽baladevaḥ / sa eva tadānupūrvikavacanavācyo yogo mayā tvatsakhenātisnigdhena te
analyzed: anyaḥ tu arvācīnam prati eva avaktavya tve hetuḥ rahasyam iti  baladevaḥ saḥ eva tad ānupūrvika vacana vācyaḥ yogaḥ mayā tvad sakhena ati snigdhena te
translated: But another says that the reason for not speaking to anyone else is that it is a secret.🔽Balarama. That very yoga, which is to be expressed by the words of one who has attained perfection, was spoken by me, your very affectionate friend,

original: tubhyaṃ matsakhāyeti snigdhāya proktas tvaṃ me bhaktaḥ prapannaḥ sakhā cāsīti hetor
analyzed: tubhyam mad sakhāya iti snigdhāya proktaḥ tvam me bhaktaḥ prapannaḥ sakhā ca asi iti hetoḥ
translated: to you, my friend, for the reason that you were my devotee and surrendered friend,

original: na tv anyasmai kasmaicit /
analyzed: na tu anyasmai kasmaicid
translated: but not to anyone else.

original: tatra hetuḥ rahasyam iti /🔽hi yasmād uttamaṃ rahasyam iti gopyam etat ////
analyzed: tatra hetuḥ rahasyam iti  hi yasmāt uttamam rahasyam iti gopyam etat
translated: The reason for that is stated as secret.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Because it is the best, the secret, this should be kept confidential.

original: arjuna uvāca
analyzed: arjunaḥ uvāca
translated: Arjuna said:

original: aparaṃ bhavato janma paraṃ janma vivasvataḥ /
analyzed: aparam bhavataḥ janma param janma vivasvataḥ
translated: Your birth is later, and Vivasvata's birth is earlier.

original: katham etad vijānīyāṃ tvam ādau proktavān iti ////
analyzed: katham etat vijānīyām tvam ādau proktavān iti
translated: How should I know this, that you spoke it in the beginning?

original: śrīdharaḥ / bhagavato vivasvantaṃ prati yogopadeśāsambhavaṃ paśyann arjuna uvāca aparam iti /
translated: Sridhara. Seeing the impossibility of the Lord's teaching of yoga to Vivasvata, Arjuna said Aparam etc.

original: aparam arvācīnaṃ tava janma /
analyzed: aparam arvācīnam tava janma
translated: Aparam means your later birth.

original: paraṃ prāk kālīnaṃ vivasvato janma /
analyzed: param prāk kālīnam vivasvataḥ janma
translated: The other, earlier, is the birth of Vivasvan.

original: tasmāt tavādhunātanatvāt cirantanāya vivasvate tvam ādau yogaṃ proktavān iti etat katham ahaṃ jānīyāṃ jñātuṃ śaknuyām ////
analyzed: tasmāt tava adhunātana tvāt cirantanāya vivasvate tvam ādau yogam proktavān iti etat katham aham jānīyām jñātum śaknuyām
translated: Therefore, since you are of the present, how can I know, how can I understand, that you first taught Yoga to the ancient Vivasvan?

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: yā bhagavati vāsudeve manuṣyatvenāsarvajñatvānityatvāśaṅkā mūrkhāṇāṃ tām apanetum anuvadann arjuna āśaṅkate aparam iti /
analyzed: yā bhagavati vāsudeve manuṣya tvena asarvajña tva anitya tva āśaṅkā mūrkhāṇām tām apanetum anuvadan arjunaḥ āśaṅkate aparam iti
translated: To remove the doubt of fools regarding the Lord Vasudeva, that He is not omniscient and not eternal due to being human, Arjuna, following the doubt, says another etc.

original: aparam alpakālīnam idānantanaṃ vasudevagṛhe bhavato janma śarīragrahaṇaṃ vihīnaṃ ca manuṣyatvāt /
analyzed: aparam alpa kālīnam idānantanam vasudeva gṛhe bhavataḥ janma śarīra grahaṇam vihīnam ca manuṣya tvāt
translated: Another, short-lived, present birth in the house of Vasudeva, inferior due to being human.

original: paraṃ bahukālīnaṃ sargādibhavam utkṛṣṭaṃ ca devatvāt /
analyzed: param bahu kālīnam sarga ādi bhavam utkṛṣṭam ca deva tvāt
translated: The other, long-lived, excellent due to being divine, superior due to being divine.

original: vivasvato janma /
analyzed: vivasvataḥ janma
translated: The birth of Vivasvan.

original: atrātmano janmābhāvasya prāgvyutpāditatvād dehābhiprāyeṇaivārjunasya praśnaḥ /
analyzed: atra ātmanaḥ janma abhāvasya prāc vyutpādita tvāt deha abhiprāyeṇa eva arjunasya praśnaḥ
translated: Here, since the absence of birth of the Self has been explained before, Arjuna's question is only with reference to the body.

original: ataḥ katham etad vijānīyām aviruddhārthatayā /
analyzed: atas katham etat vijānīyām a viruddha artha tayā
translated: Therefore, how can I know this as non-contradictory?

original: etac chabdārtham eva vivṛṇoti /
analyzed: etat śabda artham eva vivṛṇoti
translated: He explains the meaning of the word this itself.

original: tvam ādau yogaṃ proktavān iti /
analyzed: tvam ādau yogam proktavān iti
translated: You first taught Yoga.

original: tvam idānīṃtano manuṣyo 'sarvajñaḥ sargādau pūrvatanāya sarvajñāyādityāya proktavān iti viruddhārtham etad iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tvam idānīṃtanaḥ sarvajñaḥ sarga ādau pūrvatanāya sarvajñāya ādityāya proktavān iti viruddha artham etat iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is contradictory to say that you, who are a human being now, who are not omniscient, spoke to the sun, who was the first one at the beginning of creation, and who is omniscient.

original: atrāyaṃ nirgalito 'rthaḥ /
analyzed: atra ayam nirgalitaḥ rthaḥ
translated: The meaning that emerges from this is as follows.

original: etad dehānavacchinnasya tava dehāntarāvacchedena vādityaṃ pratyupadeṣṭṛtvam etaddehena vā /
analyzed: etat deha anavacchinnasya tava deha antara avacchedena vā ādityam pratyupadeṣṭṛ tvam etad dehena vā
translated: Either you, who are not limited by this body, spoke to the sun as one limited by another body, or by this very body.

original: nādyaḥ /
analyzed: na ādyaḥ
translated: Not the first.

original: janmāntarānubhūtasyāsarvajñena smartum aśakyatvāt /
analyzed: janma antara anubhūtasya a sarvajñena smartum aśakya tvāt
translated: Because what was experienced in another birth cannot be remembered by one who is not omniscient.

original: anyathā mamāpi janmāntarānubhūtasmaraṇaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: anyathā mama api janma antara anubhūta smaraṇa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Otherwise, I too would remember what was experienced in another birth.

original: tava mama ca manuṣyatvenāsarvajñatvāviśeṣāt /
analyzed: tava mama ca manuṣya tvena a sarvajña tva aviśeṣāt
translated: Because there is no difference between you and me in being human and not being omniscient.

original: tad uktam abhiyuktaiḥ janmāntarānubhūtaṃ ca na smaryate iti /
analyzed: tat uktam abhiyuktaiḥ janma antara anubhūtam ca na smaryate iti
translated: This has been stated by the learned: What was experienced in another birth is not remembered.

original: nāpi dvitīyaḥ sargādāv idānīṃtanasya dehasyāsadbhāvāt /
analyzed: nā api dvitīyaḥ sarga ādau idānīṃtanasya dehasya asadbhāvāt
translated: Nor is the second, because the present body does not exist at the beginning of creation.

original: tad evaṃ dehāntareṇa sargādau sadbhāvānupappattir ity asarvajñatvānityatvābhyāṃ dvāv arjunasya pūrvapakṣau ////
analyzed: tat evam deha antareṇa sarga ādau sadbhāva anupappattiḥ iti asarvajña tva anitya tvābhyām dvau arjunasya pūrvapakṣau
translated: Thus, it is not possible for you to exist in another body at the beginning of creation. Therefore, Arjuna's two prima facie views are that (the Lord) is not omniscient and is not eternal.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: uktam artham asambhavaṃ pṛcchati aparam idānīntanam /
analyzed: uktam artham asambhavam pṛcchati aparam idānīntanam
translated: He asks about the meaning stated, which is impossible: Another (means) present.

original: paraṃ purātanam ataḥ katham etat pratyemīti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: param purātanam atas katham etat pratyemi iti bhāvaḥ
translated: How can I believe this?

original: baladevaḥ / kṛṣṇasya sanātanatve sārvajñe ca śaṅkamānān anabhijñān nirākartum arjuna uvāca aparam iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ kṛṣṇasya sanātana tve sārvajñe ca śaṅkamānān anabhijñān nirākartum arjunaḥ uvāca aparam iti
translated: [The Lord says:] To remove the doubts of those who are not fully aware and who are skeptical about Kṛṣṇa's eternality and omniscience, Arjuna said, The other....

original: aparam arvācīnaṃ paraṃ parācīnaṃ tasmād ādhunikas tvaṃ prācīnāya vivasvate yogam uktavān ity etat katham ahaṃ vijānīyāṃ pratīyām /
analyzed: aparam arvācīnam param parācīnam tasmāt ādhunikaḥ tvam prācīnāya vivasvate yogam uktavān iti etat katham aham vijānīyām pratīyām
translated: The other is the modern, the ancient is the past. How can I understand this, that you have taught yoga to the ancient Vivasvān?

original: ayam arthaḥ /
analyzed: ayam arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: na khalu sarveśvaratvena kṛṣṇam arjuno na vetti tasya narākhyatadavatāratvena tādrūpyāt /
analyzed: na khalu sarva īśvara tvena kṛṣṇam arjunaḥ na vetti tasya nara ākhya tad avatāra tvena tādrūpyāt
translated: Arjuna certainly does not know Kṛṣṇa as the Lord of all, because of his similarity to that incarnation named Nara.

original: paraṃ dhāma paraṃ dhāma ity ādi tadukteś ca /
analyzed: param dhāma param dhāma iti ādi tad ukteḥ ca
translated: And because it is said, The supreme abode, the supreme abode... and so on.

original: na tv atatsarvajñaviṣayām ajñaśaṅkām apākartum aparam ity ādi pṛcchati /
analyzed: na tu a tad sarvajña viṣayām ajña śaṅkām apākartum aparam iti ādi pṛcchati
translated: But he asks, The other... and so on, to remove the doubts of the ignorant about the object of that non-omniscience.

original: sarveśvaraḥ sa yathā svatattvaṃ vetti na tathānyaḥ /
analyzed: sarva īśvaraḥ sa yathā sva tattvam vetti na tathā anyaḥ
translated: The Lord of all does not know His own nature in the same way as others do.

original: tatas tanmukhāmbujād eva tadrūpatajjanmādi parkāśanīyaṃ lokamaṅgalāya /
analyzed: tatas tad mukha ambujāt eva tad rūpa tad janma ādi parka aśanīyam loka maṅgalāya
translated: Therefore, for the welfare of the world, that form, birth, etc. should be revealed only from His lotus face.

original: tadarthaṃ svamahimānaṃ pravadan vikatthanatayā sa nākṣepyaḥ /
analyzed: tad artham sva mahimānam pravadan vikatthana tayā sa nā ākṣepyaḥ
translated: For that purpose, He should not be accused as boasting by proclaiming His own glory.

original: kintu stavanīya eva kṛpālutayā /
analyzed: kintu stavanīyaḥ eva kṛpālu tayā
translated: But you are indeed praiseworthy, out of compassion.

original: tac ca manuṣākṛtiparabrahmaṇas tava rūpaṃ janmādi ca lokavilakṣaṇaṃ
analyzed: tat ca manuṣa ākṛti para brahmaṇaḥ tava rūpam janma ādi ca loka vilakṣaṇam
translated: And that form of yours, which is the Supreme Brahman in human form, and your birth, etc., are unlike those of the world.

original: kiṃvidhaṃ kimarthakaṃ kiṃkālam iti vijñasyāpy ājñavat praśno 'yam ajñaśaṅkānirāsakaprativacanārthaḥ ////
analyzed: kiṃvidham kimarthakam kiṃkālam iti vijñasya api ājña vat praśnaḥ yam ajña śaṅkā nirāsaka prativacana arthaḥ
translated: What kind, for what purpose, and at what time? This question is like a command for one who knows, but it is for the purpose of giving a reply that removes the doubt of the ignorant.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: bahūni me vyatītāni janmāni tava cārjuna /
analyzed: bahūni me vyatītāni janmāni tava ca arjuna
translated: Many births of Mine and yours have passed away, O Arjuna.

original: tāny ahaṃ veda sarvāṇi na tvaṃ vettha parantapa ////
analyzed: tāni aham veda sarvāṇi na tvam vettha parantapa
translated: I know all of them, but you do not know, O scorcher of enemies.

original: śrīdharaḥ / rūpāntareṇopadiṣṭavān ity abhiprāyeṇottaraṃ śrībhagavān uvāca bahūnīti /
analyzed: uvāca   iti
translated: Śrīdhara: With the intention that He has taught through another form, the Blessed Lord replies, Many, etc.

original: tāny ahaṃ veda vedmi /
analyzed: tāni aham veda vedmi
translated: I know them.

original: aluptavidyāśaktitvāt /
analyzed: a lupta vidyā śakti tvāt
translated: Because His power of knowledge is unimpaired.

original: tvaṃ tu na vettha na vetsi avidyāvṛttatvāt ////
analyzed: tvam tu na vettha na vetsi avidyā vṛtta tvāt
translated: But you do not know, you do not know, because you are covered by ignorance.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusūdana:

original: tatra sarvajñatvena prathamasya parihāram āha bahūnīti /
analyzed: tatra sarvajña tvena prathamasya parihāram āha bahūni iti
translated: There, He says that the first is answered by His omniscience: Many, etc.

original: janmāni līlādehagrahaṇāni lokadṛṣṭyabhiprāyeṇādityasyodayavan me mama bahūni vyatītāni tava cājñāninaḥ karmārjitāni dehagrahaṇāni /
analyzed: janmāni līlā deha grahaṇāni loka dṛṣṭi abhiprāyeṇa ādityasya udaya vat me mama bahūni vyatītāni tava ca ajñāninaḥ karma arjitāni deha grahaṇāni
translated: Births are the taking of playful bodies. From the point of view of the world's perception, many of My births have passed away, and many births have been taken by you, the ignorant one, earned through karma.

original: tava cety upalakṣaṇam itareṣām api jīvānāṃ /
analyzed: tava ca iti upalakṣaṇam itareṣām api jīvānām
translated: And of yours is only by way of illustration; it is also of the other living beings.

original: jīvaikyābhiprāyeṇa vā /
analyzed: jīva aikya abhiprāyeṇa vā
translated: Or, with the intention of the oneness of the individual souls.

original: he 'rjuna /
analyzed: he rjuna
translated: O Arjuna!

original: ślokenārjunavṛkṣanāmnā sambodhayann āvṛtajñānatvaṃ sūcayati /
analyzed: ślokena arjuna vṛkṣa nāmnā sambodhayan āvṛta jñāna tvam sūcayati
translated: By addressing him with the name of Arjuna-tree, He indicates the covering of knowledge.

original: tāni janmāny ahaṃ sarvajñaḥ sarvaśaktir īśvaro veda jānāmi sarvāṇi madīyāni tvadīyāny anyadīyāni ca /
analyzed: tāni janmāni aham sarvajñaḥ sarva śaktiḥ īśvaraḥ veda jānāmi sarvāṇi madīyāni tvadīyāni anyadīyāni ca
translated: I, the omniscient, omnipotent God, know all those births of yours, mine, and of others.

original: na tvam ajño jīvas tirobhūtajñānaśaktir vettha na jānāsi svīyāny api kiṃ punaḥ parakīyāṇi /
analyzed: na tvam ajñaḥ jīvaḥ tirobhūta jñāna śaktiḥ vettha na jānāsi svīyāni api kim punar parakīyāṇi
translated: You, the individual soul, are not ignorant; your knowledge and power are only covered. You do not know even your own, let alone others'.

original: he parantapa /
analyzed: he parantapa
translated: O scorcher of enemies!

original: paraṃ śatruṃ bhedadṛṣṭyā parikalpya hantuṃ pravṛtto 'sīti viparītadarśitatvād bhrānto 'sīti sūcayati /
analyzed: param śatrum bheda dṛṣṭyā parikalpya hantum pravṛttaḥ si iti viparīta darśita tvāt bhrāntaḥ si iti sūcayati
translated: You have conceived the enemy as separate and have engaged in killing him. Thus, due to your perverted vision, you are deluded. This is what is indicated.

original: tad anena sambodhanadvayenāvaraṇavikṣepau dvāv apy ajñānadharmau darśitau ////
analyzed: tat anena sambodhana dvayena āvaraṇa vikṣepau dvau api ajñāna dharmau darśitau
translated: Thus, by these two salutations, both obscuration and distraction, which are qualities of ignorance, are shown.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: avatārāntareṇopadiṣṭavān ity abhiprāyeṇāha bahūnīti /
analyzed: avatāra antareṇa upadiṣṭavān iti abhiprāyeṇa āha bahūni iti
translated: With the intention that He has taught through another incarnation, He says many times.

original: tava ceti yadā yadaiva mamāvatāras tadā matpārṣadatvāt tavāpy āvirbhāvo 'bhūd evety arthaḥ /
analyzed: tava ca iti yadā yadā eva mama avatāraḥ tadā mad pārṣada tvāt tava api āvirbhāvaḥ bhūt eva iti arthaḥ
translated: And of yours means that whenever there was an incarnation of Mine, then due to your being My attendant, your manifestation also took place, this is the meaning.

original: veda vedmi sarveśvaratvena sarvajñatvāt /
analyzed: veda vedmi sarva īśvara tvena sarvajña tvāt
translated: I know, because I am the Lord of all, because I am omniscient.

original: tvaṃ na vettha mayaiva svalīlāsiddhyarthaṃ tvajjñānāvaraṇād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tvam na vettha mayā eva sva līlā siddhi artham tvad jñāna āvaraṇāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: You do not know, because I have concealed your knowledge for the accomplishment of My own pastimes. This is the idea.

original: ataeva he parantapa /
analyzed: ataeva he parantapa
translated: Therefore, O scorcher of enemies,

original: sāmpratikakuntīputratvābhimānamātreṇaiva parān śatrūṃs tāpayasi ////
analyzed: sāmpratika kuntī putra tva abhimāna mātreṇa eva parān śatrūn tāpayasi
translated: you torment your enemies merely by the pride of being the son of Kunti in the present time.

original: baladevaḥ / eka evāhaṃ eko 'pi san bahudhā yo 'vabhāti ity ādi śrutyuktāni nityasiddhāni
analyzed: baladevaḥ ekaḥ eva aham ekaḥ san bahudhā yaḥ vabhāti iti ādi śruti uktāni nitya siddhāni
translated: Balarama. The Lord, who is said in the scriptures to have eternally established many forms, such as I alone am all this,

original: bahūni rūpāṇi vaidūryavad ātmani dadhānaḥ purā rūpāntareṇa taṃ pratyupadiṣṭavān iti
analyzed: bahūni rūpāṇi vaidūrya vat ātmani dadhānaḥ purā rūpa antareṇa tam pratyupadiṣṭavān iti
translated: who bears many forms within Himself like a cat's eye gem, has instructed him with another form in the past.

original: bhāvenāha bhagavān bahūnīti /
analyzed: bhāvena āha bhagavān bahūni iti
translated: With this idea, the Lord says many etc.

original: tava ceti matsakhatvāt tāvanti janmāni tavāpy abhūvann ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: tava ca iti mad sakha tvāt tāvanti janmāni tava api abhūvan iti arthaḥ
translated: And of yours, meaning that because of being My friend, you have had that many births also.

original: na tvaṃ vettheti /
analyzed: na tvam vettha iti
translated: You do not know,

original: idānīṃ mayaivācintyaśaktyā svalīlāsiddhaye tvajjñānācchādanād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: idānīm mayā eva acintya śaktyā sva līlā siddhaye tvad jñāna ācchādanāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: because now I have concealed your knowledge by My inconceivable power for the accomplishment of My own pastimes. This is the idea.

original: etena sārvajñyaṃ svasya darśitam /
analyzed: etena sārvajñyam svasya darśitam
translated: By this, His omniscience is shown.

original: atra bhagavajjanmanāṃ vāstavatvaṃ bodhyam /
analyzed: atra bhagavat janmanām vāstava tvam bodhyam
translated: Here, the reality of the Lord's births should be understood.

original: bahūnītyādi śrīmukhoktes tava ceti dṛṣṭāntāc ca /
analyzed: bahūni ityādi śrī mukha ukteḥ tava ca iti dṛṣṭāntāt ca
translated: Because of the statement by the Lord's mouth beginning with many etc., and because of the example of yours.

original: na ca janmākhyo vikāras tasyāgrimavyākhyayā pratyākhyānāt ////
analyzed: na ca janma ākhyaḥ vikāraḥ tasya agrima vyākhyayā pratyākhyānāt
translated: And the modification called birth is not of Him, because it is denied by the explanation given later.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: ajo 'pi sann avyayātmā bhūtānām īśvaro 'pi san /
analyzed: ajaḥ pi san avyaya ātmā bhūtānām īśvaraḥ pi san
translated: Although unborn and although the Self of all, and although the Lord of all creatures,

original: prakṛtiṃ svām adhiṣṭhāya saṃbhavāmy ātmamāyayā ////
analyzed: prakṛtim svām adhiṣṭhāya saṃbhavāmi ātma māyayā
translated: yet, by My Māyā, I take birth as do all beings.

original: śrīdharaḥ / nanu anādes tava kuto janma /
translated: Śrīdhara: Objection: You are beginningless, so how can You have birth?

original: avināśinaś ca kathaṃ punar janma yena bahūni me vyatītānity ucyate /
analyzed: avināśinaḥ ca katham punar janma yena bahūni me vyatītān iti ucyate
translated: And how can You, who are indestructible, be born again, by which You say, Many have passed away?

original: īśvarasya tava puṇyapāpavihīnasya kathaṃ jīvavaj janmeti /
analyzed: īśvarasya tava puṇya pāpa vihīnasya katham jīvavat janma iti
translated: And how can You, the Lord, who are free from merit and demerit, be born like a living being?

original: ata āha ajo 'pīti /
analyzed: atas āha ajaḥ pi iti
translated: To this He says, Although unborn, etc.

original: satyam evam /🔽tathāpi ajo 'pi janmaśūnyo 'pi sann aham /
analyzed: satyam evam  tathā api ajaḥ pi janma śūnyaḥ pi san aham
translated: It is true that this is so.🔽Nevertheless, although unborn, devoid of birth, I am.

original: tathāvyayātmāpy anaśvarasvabhāvo 'pi san /
analyzed: tathā avyaya ātmā api anaśvara svabhāvaḥ pi san
translated: Similarly, although of imperishable Self, of indestructible nature, I am.

original: tathā īśvaro 'pi karmapāratantryarahito 'pi san /
analyzed: tathā īśvaraḥ pi karma pāratantrya rahitaḥ pi san
translated: Similarly, although the Lord, devoid of dependence on actions, I am.

original: svamāyayā sambhavāmi samyag apracyutajñānabalavīryādiśaktyaiva bhavāmi /
analyzed: sva māyayā sambhavāmi samyak apracyuta jñāna bala vīrya ādi śaktyā eva bhavāmi
translated: By My own Māyā, I take birth, I become fully endowed with the powers of knowledge, strength, valor, etc. that are never lost.

original: nanu tathāpi ṣoḍaśakalātamkaliṅgadehaśūnyasya ca tava kuto janmeti /
analyzed: nanu tathā api ṣoḍaśa kalā tamka liṅga deha śūnyasya ca tava kutas janma iti
translated: Objection: Even so, how can You, who are devoid of the body of Kaliṅga with sixteen parts, be born?

original: ata uktaṃ svāṃ śuddhasattvātmikāṃ prakṛtiṃ adhiṣṭhāya svīkṛtya /
analyzed: atas uktam svām śuddha sattva ātmikām prakṛtim adhiṣṭhāya svīkṛtya
translated: Therefore it is said: 'having taken up' or 'having accepted' my own nature which is of the form of pure goodness.

original: viśuddhorjitasattvamūrtyā svecchayāvatarāmīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: viśuddha ūrjita sattva mūrtyā sva icchayā avatarāmi iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: I descend by my own will in a form consisting of pure and powerful goodness.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: nanv atītānekajanmavattvam ātmanaḥ smarasi cet tarhi jātismaro jīvas tvaṃ parajanmajñānam🔽api yoginaḥ sārvātmyābhimānena śāstradṛṣṭyā tūpadeśo vāmadevavat Vs / / iti
analyzed: nanu atīta aneka janmavat tvam ātmanaḥ smarasi ced tarhi jātismaraḥ jīvaḥ tvam para janma jñānam  api yoginaḥ sārvātmya abhimānena śāstra dṛṣṭyā tu upadeśaḥ vāmadeva vat iti
translated: If you remember having had many past births, then you are a living being with the power of remembering past births, and you have the knowledge of other people's past lives.

original: nyāyena sambhavati /
analyzed: nyāyena sambhavati
translated: But it is possible for a yogi to have this knowledge by the principle of Vamadeva, which is stated in the scriptures: The teaching is like that of Vamadeva, who, though a living being, thought himself to be the universal Self.

original: tathā cāha vāmadevo jīvo 'pi ahaṃ manur abhavaṃ sūryaś cāhaṃ kakṣīvānṛpir asmi vipraḥity ādi dāśatayyām /
analyzed: tathā ca āha vāmadevaḥ aham manuḥ abhavam sūryaḥ ca aham kakṣīvān ṛpiḥ asmi vipraḥ iti ādi dāśatayyām
translated: Thus it is said in the Dasatirya Upanishad: I was Manu, I was the sun, I was Kakshivan, I was the sage, I was the brahmin, and so on.

original: ataeva na mukhyaḥ sarvajñas tvam /
analyzed: ataeva na mukhyaḥ sarvajñaḥ tvam
translated: Therefore, you are not the primary omniscient one.

original: tathā ca katham ādityaṃ sarvajñam upadiṣṭavān asy anīśvaraḥ san /
analyzed: tathā ca katham ādityam sarvajñam upadiṣṭavān asi anīśvaraḥ san
translated: And how is it that you, being not the supreme Lord, have taught the sun to be omniscient?

original: na hi jīvasya mukhyaṃ sārvajñyaṃ sambhavati vyaṣṭyupādheḥ paricchinnatvena sarvasambandhitvābhāvāt /
analyzed: na hi jīvasya mukhyam sārvajñyam sambhavati vyaṣṭi upādheḥ paricchinna tvena sarva sambandhi tva abhāvāt
translated: For the primary omniscience of the individual soul is not possible, because the limiting adjunct in the form of the individual is restricted and cannot be related to everything.

original: samaṣṭyupādher api virājaḥ sthūlabhūtopādhitvena sūkṣmabhūtapariṇāmaviṣayaṃ māyāpariṇāmaviṣayaṃ ca jñānaṃ na sambhavati /
analyzed: samaṣṭi upādheḥ api virājaḥ sthūlabhūta upādhi tvena sūkṣma bhūta pariṇāma viṣayam māyā pariṇāma viṣayam ca jñānam na sambhavati
translated: Even the gross elements are not the limiting adjuncts of the gross body of Virāj, because the knowledge of the gross elements is not possible for him.

original: evaṃ sūkṣmabhūtopādher api hiraṇyagarbhasya
analyzed: evam sūkṣma bhūta upādheḥ api hiraṇyagarbhasya
translated: Similarly, even the subtle elements are not the limiting adjuncts of Hiraṇyagarbha.

original: tatkāraṇamāyāpariṇāmākāśādisargakramādiviṣayajñānābhāvaḥ siddha eva /
analyzed: tad kāraṇa māyā pariṇāma ākāśa ādi sarga krama ādi viṣaya jñāna abhāvaḥ siddhaḥ eva
translated: The absence of knowledge of the sequence of creation of space etc. from the subtle elements, which are the effects of the subtle elements, is established.

original: tasmād īśvara eva kāraṇopāditvād atītān āgatavartamānasarvārthaviṣayajñānavān mukhyaḥ sarvajñaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt īśvaraḥ eva kāraṇa upādi tvāt atītān āgata vartamāna sarva artha viṣaya jñānavān mukhyaḥ sarvajñaḥ
translated: Therefore, only God, being the material cause, possesses the knowledge of all objects of the past, future and present, and is the primary omniscient one.

original: atītān āgatavartamānaviṣayaṃ māyāvṛttitrayam ekaiva vā sarvaviṣayā māyāvṛttir ity anyat /
analyzed: atītān āgata vartamāna viṣayam māyā vṛtti trayam ekā eva vā sarva viṣayā māyā vṛttiḥ iti anyat
translated: Whether the three transformations of māyā have the past, future and present as their objects, or whether there is only one transformation of māyā with all objects as its object, is another matter.

original: tasya ca nityeśvarasya sarvajñasya dharmādharmādyabhāvena janmaivānupapannam atītānekajanmavattvaṃ tu dūrotsāritam eva /
analyzed: tasya ca nitya īśvarasya sarvajñasya dharma adharma ādi abhāvena janma eva anupapannam atīta aneka janmavat tvam tu dūra utsāritam eva
translated: And for that eternal God, who is omniscient, birth is not even possible due to the absence of dharma, adharma etc., but the fact of having many past births is far removed.

original: tathā ca jīvatve sārvajñyānupapattir īśvaratve ca dehagrahaṇānupapattir iti śaṅkādvayaṃ pariharann anityatvapakṣasyāpi parihāram āha ajo
analyzed: tathā ca jīva tve sārvajñya anupapattiḥ īśvara tve ca deha grahaṇa anupapattiḥ iti śaṅkā dvayam pariharan anitya tva pakṣasya api parihāram āha ajaḥ
translated: Thus, the two doubts - that omniscience is not possible in the state of being a jīva, and that assuming a body is not possible in the state of being God - are removed. He also gives the answer to the view of non-eternality, saying even though unborn...

original: 'pīti /
analyzed: pi iti
translated: 'Also'.🔽🔽

original: apūrvadehendriyādigrahaṇaṃ janma /
analyzed: apūrva deha indriya ādi grahaṇam janma
translated: The taking up of a new body, senses, etc. is birth.

original: pūrvaghītadehendriyādiviyogo vyayaḥ /
analyzed: pūrva ghīta deha indriya ādi viyogaḥ vyayaḥ
translated: The separation from the previously obtained body, senses, etc. is death.

original: yad ubhayaṃ tārkikaiḥ prety abhāva ity ucyate /
analyzed: yat ubhayam tārkikaiḥ pra iti abhāvaḥ iti ucyate
translated: These two are called after death by the logicians.

original: tad uktaṃ jātasya hi dhruvo mṛtyur dhruvaṃ janma mṛtasya ca Gītā / iti /
analyzed: tat uktam jātasya hi dhruvaḥ mṛtyuḥ dhruvam janma mṛtasya ca gītāḥ iti
translated: This is stated in the Gita: For one who is born, death is certain; for one who is dead, birth is certain.

original: tad ubhayaṃ ca dharmādharmavaśād bhavati /
analyzed: tat ubhayam ca dharma adharma vaśāt bhavati
translated: And both of these occur by the power of dharma and adharma.

original: dharmādharmavaśatvaṃ cājñasya jīvasaya dehābhimāninaḥ karmādhikāritvād bhavati /
analyzed: dharma adharma vaśa tvam ca ajñasya deha abhimāninaḥ karma adhikāri tvāt bhavati
translated: And the subjection to dharma and adharma occurs for the ignorant individual soul who identifies with the body, because it is entitled to action.

original: tatra yad ucyate sarvajñasyeśvarasya sarvakāraṇasyedṛgdehagrahaṇaṃ nopapadyata iti tat tathaiva /
analyzed: tatra yat ucyate sarvajñasya īśvarasya sarva kāraṇasya īdṛś deha grahaṇam na upapadyate iti tat tathā eva
translated: Regarding this, what is said - that the taking up of such a body by the omniscient God, the cause of all, is not possible - that is exactly so.

original: katham / yadi tasya śarīraṃ sthūlabhūtakāryaṃ syāt tadā vyaṣṭirūpatve jāgradavasthāsmadāditulyatvam /
analyzed: katham yadi tasya śarīram sthūla bhūta kāryam syāt tadā vyaṣṭi rūpatve jāgrat avasthā asmat ādi tulya tvam
translated: How? If His body were an effect of the gross elements, then if it were in the form of the individual, He would be in the waking state and equal to us.

original: samaṣṭirūpatve ca virāḍjīvatvaṃ tasya tadupādhitvāt /
analyzed: samaṣṭi rūpa tve ca virāj jīva tvam tasya tad upādhi tvāt
translated: And if it were in the form of the aggregate, He would be the individual soul in the form of Virat, because that is His limiting adjunct.

original: atha sūkṣmabhūtakāryaṃ tadā vyaṣṭirūpatve svapnāvasthāsmadāditulyatvam /
analyzed: atha sūkṣma bhūta kāryam tadā vyaṣṭi rūpa tve svapna avasthā asmat ādi tulya tvam
translated: If, on the other hand, it were an effect of the subtle elements, then if it were in the form of the individual, He would be in the dream state and equal to us.

original: samaṣṭirūpatve ca hiraṇyagarbhajīvatvaṃ tasya tadupādhitvāt /
analyzed: samaṣṭi rūpa tve ca hiraṇyagarbha jīva tvam tasya tad upādhi tvāt
translated: And if it were in the form of the aggregate, He would be the individual soul in the form of Hiranyagarbha, because that is His limiting adjunct.

original: tathā ca bhautikaṃ śarīraṃ jīvānāviṣṭaṃ
analyzed: tathā ca bhautikam śarīram jīva an āviṣṭam
translated: And thus the material body is possessed by the individual souls,

original: parameśvarasya na sambhavaty eveti siddham /
analyzed: parameśvarasya na sambhavati eva iti siddham
translated: And so it is established that a material body is not possible for the Supreme Lord, since it is pervaded by individual souls.

original: na ca jīvāviṣṭa eva tādṛśe śarīre tasya bhūtāveśavat praveśa iti vācyam /
analyzed: na ca jīva āviṣṭe eva tādṛśe śarīre tasya bhūta āveśa vat praveśaḥ iti vācyam
translated: And it should not be said that He enters such a body, which is pervaded by individual souls, in the same way as the elements enter.

original: taccharīrāvacchedena tajjīvasya bhogābhyupagame 'ntaryāmirūpeṇa sarvaśarīrapraveśasya vidyamānatvena śarīraviśeṣābhyupagamavaiyarthyāt
analyzed: tad śarīra avacchedena tad jīvasya bhoga abhyupagame ntaryāmi rūpeṇa sarva śarīra praveśasya vidyamāna tvena śarīra viśeṣa abhyupagama vaiyarthyāt
translated: For if the enjoyment of that individual soul is accepted in relation to that body, then since He enters all bodies in the form of the Inner Controller, it would be pointless to accept a particular body.

original: bhogābhāve ca jīvaśarīratvānupapatteḥ /🔽ato na bhautikaṃ śarīram īśvarasyeti pūrvārdhenāṅgīkaroti ajo 'pi sann avyayātmā bhūtānām īśvaro 'pi sann iti /
analyzed: bhoga abhāve ca jīva śarīra tva anupapatteḥ  atas na bhautikam śarīram īśvarasya iti pūrva ardhena aṅgīkaroti ajaḥ san avyaya ātmā bhūtānām san iti
translated: And if there were no enjoyment, then it would be impossible for Him to have a body of an individual soul.🔽Therefore, in the first part of the verse, he accepts that the Supreme Lord does not have a material body, saying Though unborn, though having an imperishable Self, though the Lord of beings.

original: ajo 'pi sann ity apūrvadehagrahaṇam avyayātmāpi sann iti pūrvadehavicchedaṃ bhūtānāṃ
analyzed: ajaḥ san iti apūrva deha grahaṇam avyaya ātmā api san iti pūrva deha vicchedam bhūtānām
translated: Though unborn means He takes up a body that did not exist before. Though having an imperishable Self means He does not cut off His previous body. Though the Lord of beings

original: bhagavadharmāṇāṃ sarveṣāṃ brahmādistambaparyantānām īśvaro 'pi sann iti dharmādharmavaśatvaṃ nivārayati /
analyzed: bhagava dharmāṇām sarveṣām brahma ādi stamba paryantānām san iti dharma adharma vaśa tvam nivārayati
translated: means He is the Lord of all beings, from Brahmā down to a blade of grass. Though the Lord means He is not subject to the control of virtue and vice.

original: kathaṃ tarhi dehagrahaṇam ity uttarārdhenāha prakṛtiṃ svām adhiṣṭhāya sambhavāmi /
analyzed: katham tarhi deha grahaṇam iti uttara ardhena āha prakṛtim svām adhiṣṭhāya sambhavāmi
translated: How then is the taking up of the body? This is stated in the second half: I manifest, having controlled My own Nature.

original: prakṛtiṃ māyākhyāṃ vicitrānekaśaktim aghaṭamānaghaṭanāpaṭīyasīṃ svāṃ svopādibhūtām
analyzed: prakṛtim māyā ākhyām vicitra aneka śaktim a ghaṭamāna ghaṭanā paṭīyasīm svām sva upa ādi bhūtām
translated: Having controlled My own Nature, which is called Maya, which has various powers, which is capable of bringing about what is impossible, which is My own material cause,

original: adhiṣṭhāya cidābhāsena vaśīkṛtya sambhavāmi tatpariṇāmaviśeṣair eva jagatkāraṇatvasampādikā
analyzed: adhiṣṭhāya cit ābhāsena vaśīkṛtya sambhavāmi tad pariṇāma viśeṣaiḥ eva jagat kāraṇatva sampādikā
translated: by controlling it with the illumination of consciousness, I manifest, becoming the cause of the world through its specific evolutions.

original: madicchayaiva pravartamānā viśuddhasattvamayatvena mama mūrtis tadviśiṣṭasya
analyzed: mad icchayā eva pravartamānā viśuddha sattva maya tvena mama mūrtiḥ tad viśiṣṭasya
translated: That, functioning only by My will, is My form consisting of pure sattva. For one who is distinguished by that,

original: cājatvam avyayatvam īśvaratvaṃ copapannam /
analyzed: ca aja tvam avyaya tvam īśvara tvam ca upapannam
translated: the state of being without beginning and end and being God is proper.

original: ato 'nena nityenaiva dehena vivasvantaṃ ca tvāṃ ca pratīmaṃ yogam upadiṣṭavān aham ity upapannam /
analyzed: atas nena nityena eva dehena vivasvantam ca tvām ca prati imam yogam upadiṣṭavān aham iti upapannam
translated: Therefore, it is proper that with this eternal body alone I have taught this Yoga to Vivasvan and to you.

original: tathā ca śrutiḥ ākāśaśarīraṃ brahma iti / ākāśo
analyzed: tathā ca śrutiḥ ākāśa śarīram brahma iti
translated: And thus the Shruti says: Brahman has the sky as its body. The sky

original: 'nnāvyākṛtam /🔽ākāśa eva tad otaṃ ca protaṃ ca BAU / / ity ādau tathā darśanāt /
analyzed: na a vyākṛtam  ākāśe eva tat otam ca protam ca iti ādau tathā darśanāt
translated: is the unmanifest food.🔽Because it is shown thus in the beginning of the Taittiriya Upanishad, It is woven warp and woof in the sky itself,

original: ākāśas talliṅgāt Vs / / / iti nyāyāc ca /
analyzed: ākāśaḥ tad liṅgāt iti nyāyāt ca
translated: and because of the reasoning The sky, because of that indication.

original: tarhi bhautikavigrahābhāvāt taddharmamanuṣyatvādipratītiḥ katham iti cet tatrāha ātmamāyayeti /
analyzed: tarhi bhautika vigraha abhāvāt tad dharma manuṣya tva ādi pratītiḥ katham iti ced tatra āha ātma māyayā iti
translated: If it is asked how there is the cognition of human nature etc., which are its properties, due to the absence of a material body, he says by my own Maya.

original: manmāyayaiva mayi manuṣyatvādipratītir lokānugrahāya na tu vastuvṛttyeti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: mad māyayā eva mayi manuṣya tva ādi pratītiḥ loka anugrahāya na tu vastu vṛttyā iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the cognition of human nature etc. in me is only by my own Maya, for the grace of the world, but not according to reality.

original: tathā coktaṃ mokṣadharme
analyzed: tathā ca uktam mokṣadharme
translated: And thus it is said in the Mokshadharma:

original: māyā hy eṣā mayā sṛṣṭā yan māṃ paśyasi nārada /
analyzed: māyā hi eṣā mayā sṛṣṭā yat mām paśyasi nārada
translated: This Maya, O Narada, has been created by me, by which you see me.

original: sarvabhūtaguṇair yuktaṃ na tu māṃ draṣṭum arhasi // Mbh / / iti /
analyzed: sarva bhūta guṇaiḥ yuktam na tu mām draṣṭum arhasi     iti
translated: Endowed with all the qualities of beings, but you should not see me.

original: sarvabhūtaguṇair yuktaṃ kāraṇopādhiṃ māṃ carmacakṣuṣā draṣṭuṃ nārhasīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: sarva bhūta guṇaiḥ yuktam kāraṇa upādhim mām carma cakṣuṣā draṣṭum na arhasi iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that you should not see me, who am the cause-limited, with the eye of the skin, as endowed with all the qualities of beings.

original: uktaṃ ca bhagavatā bhāṣyakāreṇa sa ca bhagavān jñānaiśvaryaśaktibalavīryatejobhiḥ
analyzed: uktam ca bhagavatā bhāṣyakāreṇa sa ca bhagavān jñāna aiśvarya śakti bala vīrya tejobhiḥ
translated: And it has been said by the author of the commentary, the Lord, who is always endowed with knowledge, lordship, power, strength, valor, and splendor,

original: sadā sampannas triguṇātmikāṃ vaiṣṇavīṃ svāṃ māyāṃ prakṛtiṃ vaśīkṛtyājo 'vyayo bhūtānām
analyzed: sadā sampannaḥ triguṇa ātmikām vaiṣṇavīm svām māyām prakṛtim vaśīkṛtya ajaḥ vyayaḥ bhūtānām
translated: having brought under control his own Maya, which is the nature of Vishnu consisting of the three qualities, being unborn, imperishable, the Lord of beings,

original: īśvaro nityaśuddhabuddhamuktasvabhāvo 'pi san svamāyayā dehavān iva jāta iva
analyzed: īśvaraḥ san sva māyayā dehavān iva jātaḥ iva
translated: though of the nature of eternally pure, intelligent, and free, as if having a body by his own Maya, as if born,

original: ca lokānugrahaṃ kurvan lakṣyate svaprayojanābhāve 'pi bhūtānujighṛkṣayā iti /
analyzed: ca loka anugraham kurvan lakṣyate sva prayojana abhāve bhūta anujighṛkṣayā iti
translated: And it is seen that he bestows grace upon the world, even in the absence of his own purpose, out of compassion for beings.

original: vyākhyātṛbhiś coktaṃ svecchāvinirmitena māyāmayena divyena rūpeṇa sambabhūveti /
analyzed: vyākhyātṛbhiḥ ca uktam sva icchā vinirmitena māyā mayena divyena rūpeṇa sambabhūva iti
translated: And the commentators have said that he was born in a divine form created by his own will, which is made of illusion.

original: nityo yaḥ kāraṇopādhir māyākhyo 'nekaśaktimān /
analyzed: nityaḥ yaḥ kāraṇa upādhiḥ māyā ākhyaḥ neka śaktimān
translated: The author of the commentary holds the view that he who is eternal, who is the material cause called Maya, who possesses many powers,

original: sa eva bhagavaddeha iti bhāṣyakṛtāṃ matam //
analyzed: saḥ eva bhagavat dehaḥ iti bhāṣyakṛtām matam
translated: is himself the body of the Lord.

original: anye tu parameśvare dehadehibhāvaṃ na manyante /
analyzed: anye tu parameśvare deha dehi bhāvam na manyante
translated: But others do not consider the state of having a body to be present in the Supreme Lord.

original: kiṃ yaś ca nityo vibhuḥ saccidānandaghano bhagavān vāsudevaḥ paripūrṇo nirguṇaḥ paramātmā sa eva tadvigraho nānyaḥ kaścid bhautiko māyiko 🔽veti /
analyzed: kim yaḥ ca nityaḥ vibhuḥ saccidānanda ghanaḥ bhagavān vāsudevaḥ paripūrṇaḥ nirguṇaḥ paramātmā saḥ eva tad vigrahaḥ na anyaḥ kaścid bhautikaḥ māyikaḥ  vā iti
translated: What? That which is eternal, all-pervading, the essence of existence, consciousness and bliss, the blessed Vāsudeva, the perfect one, the attributeless Supreme Self, he alone is that form, not some other material or illusory one.

original: asmin pakṣe yojanā ākāśavat sarvagataś ca nityaḥ /
analyzed: asmin pakṣe yojanā ākāśa vat sarva gataḥ ca nityaḥ
translated: In this view, the interpretation is as follows: He is all-pervading like space, and eternal.

original: avināśī vā are 'yam ātmānucchittidharmā ity ādi śruteḥ /
analyzed: avināśī vai are yam ātmā an ucchitti dharmā iti ādi śruteḥ
translated: Because of scriptural statements such as This Self is undecaying, having the nature of not being cut off, etc.

original: asaṃbhavas tu sato 'nupaptteḥ Vs / / / /
analyzed: asaṃbhavaḥ tu sataḥ nupaptteḥ
translated: But the impossibility of what exists is due to the non-occurrence of what has already occurred,

original: nātmāśruter nityatvāc ca tābhyaḥ Vs / / / ity ādi nyāyāc ca vastugatyā janmavināśarahitaḥ
analyzed: na ātmā aśruteḥ nitya tvāt ca tābhyaḥ iti ādi nyāyāt ca vastugatyā janma vināśa rahitaḥ
translated: and because of logical arguments such as The Self is not the object of the word 'that,' because it is eternal, and because of those, in reality, he is free from birth and destruction.

original: sarvabhāsakaḥ sarvakāraṇamāyādhiṣṭhānatvena sarvabhūteśvaro 'pi sann ahaṃ prakṛtiṃ🔽svabhāvaṃ saccidānandaghanaikarasam /
analyzed: sarva bhāsakaḥ sarva kāraṇa māyā adhiṣṭhāna tvena sarva bhūta īśvaraḥ san aham prakṛtim
translated: Although He is the illuminator of all, the Lord of all beings by being the basis of the illusion of all causes, still I,🔽turning away My own Maya, which is the essence of existence, knowledge and bliss,

original: māyāṃ vyāvartayati svām iti /
analyzed: māyām vyāvartayati svām iti
translated: turn away My own Maya, which is the essence of existence, knowledge and bliss.

original: nijasvarūpam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: nija svarūpam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: My own nature.

original: sa bhagavaḥ kasmin pratiṣṭhitaḥ sve mahimni ChāU / / iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: sa bhagavaḥ kasmin pratiṣṭhitaḥ sve mahimni chāu iti śruteḥ
translated: As it is said in the Upanishad: O Lord, He is established in His own greatness.

original: svasvarūpam adhiṣṭhāya svarūpāvasthita eva san sambhavāmi dehadehibhāvam antareṇaiva dehivad vyavaharāmi /
analyzed: sva svarūpam adhiṣṭhāya sva rūpa avasthitaḥ eva san sambhavāmi deha dehi bhāvam antareṇa eva dehi vat vyavaharāmi
translated: Abiding in My own nature, existing in My own form, I manifest as if having a body, engaging in activities as if having a body, even without the state of having a body.

original: kathaṃ tarhy adehe saccidānandaghane dehatvapratītir ata āha ātmamāyayeti /
analyzed: katham tarhi adehe saccidānanda ghane deha tva pratītiḥ atas āha ātma māyayā iti
translated: Then how is there the perception of having a body in the essence of existence, knowledge and bliss that is without a body? To this He says by My own Maya.

original: nirguṇe śuddhe saccidānandaghane mayi bhagavati vāsudeve dehadehibhāvaśūnye tadrūpeṇa pratītir māyāmātram ity arthaḥ / tad uktam
analyzed: nirguṇe śuddhe saccidānanda ghane mayi bhagavati vāsudeve deha dehi bhāva śūnye tad rūpeṇa pratītiḥ māyā mātram iti arthaḥ tat uktam
translated: The meaning is: In Me, the Lord Vasudeva, who is without qualities, pure, the essence of existence, knowledge and bliss, and devoid of the state of having a body, the perception in that form is mere Maya. This is said:

original: kṛṣṇam enam avehi tvam ātmānam akhilātmanām /
analyzed: kṛṣṇam enam avehi tvam ātmānam akhila ātmanām
translated: Know Him to be Krishna, the Self of all selves.

original: jagaddhitāya so 'py atra dehīvābhāti māyayā // iti BhP / /
analyzed: jagat hitāya saḥ u pi atra dehī iva ābhāti māyayā iti bhp
translated: For the welfare of the world, He too appears here as if having a body by Maya.

original: aho bhāgyam aho bhāgyaṃ nandagopavrajaukasām
analyzed: aho bhāgyam aho bhāgyam nanda gopa vraja okasām
translated: Oh, what good fortune! Oh, what good fortune! Of the cowherds and inhabitants of Vraja!

original: yanmitraṃ paramānandaṃ pūrṇaṃ brahma sanātanam // BhP / / iti ca /
analyzed: yat mitram parama ānandam pūrṇam brahma sanātanam
translated: The friend who is supreme bliss, the complete, eternal Brahman.

original: kecit tu nityasya niravayavasya nirvikārasyāpi paramānandasyāvayavāyavibhāvaṃ vāstavam evecchanti te niryuktikaṃ bruvāṇas tu nāsmābhir vinivāryate
analyzed: kecid tu nityasya niravayavasya nirvikārasya api paramānandasya avayava āyavi bhāvam vāstavam eva icchanti te niryuktikam bruvāṇaḥ tu na asmābhiḥ vinivāryate  /
translated: But some people desire that even for the supreme bliss, which is eternal, partless, and changeless, there is a real division into parts and wholes. They are not to be refuted by us,

original: iti nyāyena nāpavādyāḥ /
analyzed: iti nyāyena na apavādyāḥ
translated: according to the principle stated thus:🔽One who speaks without reason is not to be refuted by us.

original: yadi sambhavet tathaivāstu kim atipallavitenety uparamyate ////
analyzed: yadi sambhavet tathā evā astu kim ati pallavitena iti uparamyate
translated: If it were possible, let it be so. What is the use of excessive elaboration? Thus I desist.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: svasya janmaprakāram āha ajo 'pi janmarahito 'pi san sambhavāmi /
analyzed: svasya janma prakāram āha ajaḥ pi janma rahitaḥ pi san sambhavāmi
translated: He says the way of His own birth: Although unborn, even though free from birth, I manifest.

original: devamanuṣyatiryagādiṣu āvirbhavāmi /
analyzed: deva manuṣya tiryak ādiṣu āvirbhavāmi
translated: I appear among gods, humans, animals, etc.

original: nanu kim atra citram /
analyzed: nanu kim atra citram
translated: But what is so wonderful about that?

original: jīvo 'pi vastuto 'ja eva sthūladehanāśānantaraṃ jāyata eva /🔽tatrāha savyayātmānaśvaraśarīraḥ /
analyzed: vastutas jaḥ eva sthūla deha nāśa anantaram jāyate eva  tatra āha sa vyaya ātmā anaśvara śarīraḥ
translated: Even the individual soul, in reality unborn, is born after the destruction of the gross body.🔽There He says: with a body that is perishable.

original: kiṃ ca / jīvasya svadehabhinnasvasvarūpeṇājatvam eva /
analyzed: kim ca jīvasya sva deha bhinna sva svarūpeṇa aja tvam eva
translated: Moreover, the individual soul is unborn in its own form, different from its own body.

original: āvidyakena dehasambandhenaiva tasya janmavattvam /
analyzed: āvidyakena deha sambandhena eva tasya janmavat tvam
translated: Its being born is only due to its connection with the body, which is due to ignorance.

original: mama tv īśvaratvāt svadehābhinnasyājatvaṃ janmavattvam ity ubhayam api svarūpasiddham /
analyzed: mama tu īśvara tvāt sva deha abhinnasya ajatvam janmavat tvam iti ubhayam api svarūpa siddham
translated: But in my case, because of my being God, both my being unborn and having birth are established by my very nature, as being non-different from my own body.

original: tac ca durghaṭatvāt citram atarkyam eva /
analyzed: tat ca durghaṭa tvāt citram atarkyam eva
translated: And that is wonderful because of its being difficult to accomplish, and is to be thought of only as inconceivable.

original: ataḥ puṇyapāpādimato jīvasyeva sadasadyoniṣu na me janmāśaṅkety āha bhūtānām īśvaro 'pi san karmapāratantryarahito 'pi bhūtvety arthaḥ
analyzed: atas puṇya pāpa ādimataḥ jīvasya iva sat asat yoniṣu na me janma āśaṅkā iti āha bhūtānām īśvaraḥ pi san karma pāratantrya rahitaḥ api bhūtvā iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, like the individual soul who has merit and demerit etc., I do not suspect having birth in good and bad wombs. Thus he says: Even being the Lord of beings, even being free from dependence on action, is the meaning.

original: nanu jīvo hi liṅgaśarīreṇa svabandhakena karmaprāpyān devādidehān prāpnoti /
analyzed: nanu jīvaḥ hi liṅga śarīreṇa sva bandhakena karma prāpyān deva ādi dehān prāpnoti
translated: But the individual soul obtains divine bodies etc. to be attained by action through his own bondage of the subtle body.

original: tvaṃ parameśvaro liṅgarahitaḥ sarvavyāpakaḥ karmakālādiniyantā /
analyzed: tvam parameśvaraḥ liṅga rahitaḥ sarva vyāpakaḥ karma kāla ādi niyantā
translated: You, the Supreme Lord, are devoid of the subtle body, all-pervading, and the controller of action, time etc.

original: bahu syām iti śruteḥ sarvajagadrūpo bhavaty eva /
analyzed: bahu syām iti śruteḥ sarva jagat rūpaḥ bhavati eva
translated: By the Vedic text Let me become many you do indeed become of the form of the entire world.

original: tad api yad viśeṣata evambhūto 'py ahaṃ sambhavāmīti brūṣe /
analyzed: tat api yat viśeṣataḥ evambhūtā u pi aham sambhavāmi iti brūṣe
translated: And that also, even though you are such in particular, you say I come into existence.

original: tan manye sarvajagadvilakṣaṇān dehaviśeṣān nityān eva loke prakāśayituṃ tvajjanmety avagamyate /
analyzed: tat manye sarva jagat vilakṣaṇān deha viśeṣān nityān eva loke prakāśayitum tvad janma iti avagamyate
translated: I understand that your birth is for the purpose of manifesting in the world eternal special bodies which are unlike the entire world.

original: tat khalu katham ity ata āha prakṛtiṃ svām adhiṣṭhāyeti /
analyzed: tat khalu katham iti atas āha prakṛtim svām adhiṣṭhāya iti
translated: How is that indeed? Therefore he says having entered into my own nature.

original: atra prakṛtiśabdena yadi bahiraṅgā māyāśaktir ucyate /
analyzed: atra prakṛti śabdena yadi bahiraṅgā māyā śaktiḥ ucyate
translated: If, in this [verse], the word 'Prakriti' refers to the external power of Maya,

original: tadā tadadhiṣṭhātā parameśvaras taddvārā jagadrūpo bhavaty eveti na viśeṣopalabdhiḥ /
analyzed: tadā tad adhiṣṭhātā parameśvaraḥ tad dvārā jagat rūpaḥ bhavati eva iti na viśeṣa upalabdhiḥ
translated: then the Supreme Lord, who presides over that, becomes the form of the world through that [Maya], so there is no perception of a special [meaning].

original: tasmāt saṃsiddhiprakṛtī tv ime svarūpaṃ ca svabhāvaś ca ity abhidhānād atra prakṛtiśabdena svarūpam evocyate /
analyzed: tasmāt saṃsiddhi prakṛtī tu ime svarūpam ca svabhāvaḥ ca iti abhidhānāt atra prakṛti śabdena svarūpam eva ucyate
translated: Therefore, because of the statement 'Prakriti is the nature and essence of these', here the word 'Prakriti' refers to the very nature [of the Lord].

original: na tat svarūpabhūtā māyāśaktiḥ /
analyzed: na tat svarūpa bhūtā māyā śaktiḥ
translated: It is not the power of Maya, which is His nature.

original: svarūpaṃ ca tasya saccidānanda eva /🔽ataveva tvāṃ śuddhasattvātmikāṃ
analyzed: svarūpam ca tasya saccidānandaḥ eva  tvām śuddha sattva ātmikām
translated: And that nature is only existence, consciousness, and bliss.

original: prakṛtim iti śrīsvāmicaraṇāḥ /
analyzed: prakṛtim iti śrī svāmi caraṇāḥ
translated: For this very reason, the revered Swami Charanas say: You are the Prakruti, which is of the nature of pure existence.

original: prakṛtiṃ svabhāvaṃ svam eva svabhāvam adhiṣṭhāya svarūpeṇa svecchayā sambhavāmīty arthaḥ iti śrīrāmānujācāryacaraṇāḥ /
analyzed: prakṛtim svabhāvam svam eva svabhāvam adhiṣṭhāya sva rūpeṇa sva icchayā sambhavāmi iti arthaḥ iti śrī rāmānuja ācārya caraṇāḥ
translated: The revered Ramanuja Acharya Charanas say: Having presided over the Prakruti, which is one's own nature, the meaning is that one manifests by one's own will in one's own form.

original: prakṛtiṃ svabhāvaṃ saccidānandaghanaikarasam /
analyzed: prakṛtim svabhāvam saccidānanda ghana eka rasam
translated: Prakruti is one's own nature, which is of the essence of existence, consciousness, and bliss.

original: māyāṃ vyāvartayati svām iti nijasvarūpam ity arthaḥ /
translated: To exclude Maya, the word 'sva' (one's own) is used. The meaning is one's own nature.

original: sa bhagavaṃ kasmin pratiṣṭhitaḥ svamahimni iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: sa bhagavan kasmin pratiṣṭhitaḥ sva mahimni iti śruteḥ
translated: Because of the Upanisadic text: O Lord, in what is He established? In His own glory.

original: svasvarūpam adhiṣṭhāya svarūpāvasthita eva sambhavāmi dehadehibhāvam antareṇaiva dehivad vyavaharāmi iti śrīmadhusūdanasarasvatīpādāḥ
analyzed: sva svarūpam adhiṣṭhāya sva rūpa avasthitaḥ eva sambhavāmi deha dehi bhāvam antareṇa eva dehi vat vyavaharāmi iti śrī madhusūdana sarasvatī pādāḥ
translated: The venerable Madhusudana Sarasvati says: Assuming my own nature, I manifest myself even without the state of body and embodied being, and conduct myself as if I were embodied.

original: nanu yady avyayātmā anaśvaramatsyakūrmādisvarūpa eva bhavasi /
analyzed: nanu yadi avyaya ātmā anaśvara matsya kūrma ādi svarūpaḥ eva bhavasi
translated: If you are the imperishable Self, having the unchanging forms of a fish, tortoise, etc.,

original: tarhi tava prādurbhavatsvarūpaṃ pūrvaprādurbhūtasvarūpāṇi ca yugapad eva kiṃ nopalabhyanta /
analyzed: tarhi tava prādurbhavat sva rūpam pūrva prādurbhūta sva rūpāṇi ca yugapad eva kim na upalabhyanta
translated: then why are your manifested forms and your previously manifested forms not perceived simultaneously?

original: tatrāha ātmabhūtā yā māyā tayā svasvarūpāvaraṇaprakāśanakarma ca yayā cicchaktivṛttyāyogamāyayety arthaḥ /
analyzed: tatra āha ātma bhūtā yā māyā tayā sva svarūpa āvaraṇa prakāśana karma ca yayā cicchakti vṛttyā ayoga māyayā iti arthaḥ
translated: To that he says: By the Maya that is inherent in Me, by the manifestation of My own nature, by the activity of concealing and revealing, by the potency of the Lord called Yoga Maya, which is the manifestation of the power of consciousness.

original: tayā hi pūrvakālāvatīrṇasvarūpāṇi pūrvam evāvṛtya vartamānasvarūpaṃ prakāśya sambhavāmi /
analyzed: tayā hi pūrva kāla avatīrṇa sva rūpāṇi pūrvam eva āvṛtya vartamāna sva rūpam prakāśya sambhavāmi
translated: For by that, having previously concealed the forms that have descended in previous times, it reveals the present form and I manifest.

original: ātmamāyayā samyag apracyutajñānabalavīryādiśaktyaiva bhavāmi iti śrīsvāmicaraṇāḥ /
analyzed: ātma māyayā samyak apracyuta jñāna bala vīrya ādi śaktyā eva bhavāmi iti śrī svāmi caraṇāḥ
translated: The venerable Swami Charanas say: I become by the Maya of the Self, by the power of knowledge, strength, valor, etc. that have not fallen away.

original: ātmamāyayātmajñānena māyā vayunaṃ jñānam iti jñānaparyāyo 'tra māyāśabdaḥ /
analyzed: ātma māyayā ātma jñānena māyā vayunam jñānam iti jñāna paryāyaḥ tra māyā śabdaḥ
translated: By the Maya of the Self, by the knowledge of the Self, Maya means delusion, knowledge is a synonym for knowledge here.

original: tathā cābhiyuktaprayogaḥ māyayā satataṃ vetti prācīnānāṃ śubhāśubham iti śrīrāmānujācāryacaraṇāḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca abhiyukta prayogaḥ māyayā satatam vetti prācīnānām śubha aśubham iti śrī rāmānuja ācārya caraṇāḥ
translated: And thus the usage of the learned: He who is always deluded by Maya knows the good and bad of the past. The feet of Sri Ramanuja Acharya.

original: mayi bhagavati vāsudeve dehadehibhāvaśūnye tadrūpeṇa pratītiḥ māyāmātram iti śrīmadhusūdanasarasvatīpādāḥ ////
analyzed: mayi bhagavati vāsudeve deha dehi bhāva śūnye tad rūpeṇa pratītiḥ māyā mātram iti śrī madhusūdana sarasvatī pādāḥ
translated: The idea of the Lord Vasudeva, who is devoid of the relation between the body and the embodied self, in that form is mere Maya. The feet of Sri Madhusudana Sarasvati.

original: baladevaḥ / lokavilakṣaṇatayā svarūpaṃ svajanma ca vadan sanātanatvaṃ svasyāha ajo 'pīti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ loka vilakṣaṇa tayā svarūpam sva janma ca vadan sanātana tvam svasya āha
translated: Balarama. Saying that his nature and birth are different from the world, he says that he is eternal. He says Though unborn...

original: atra svarūpasvabhāvaparyāyaḥ prakṛtiśabdaḥ /
analyzed: atra svarūpa svabhāva paryāyaḥ prakṛti śabdaḥ
translated: Here, the word prakriti is a synonym for nature and form.

original: svāṃ prakṛtiṃ svaṃ svarūpaṃ adhiṣṭhāyālambya sambhavāmi āvirbhavāmi /
analyzed: svām prakṛtim svam svarūpam adhiṣṭhāya ālambya sambhavāmi āvirbhavāmi
translated: I manifest, I appear, relying on my own nature, my own form.

original: saṃsiddhiprakṛtī tv ime /🔽svarūpaṃ ca svabhāvaś ca ity amaraḥ /
analyzed: saṃsiddhi prakṛtī tu ime  svarūpam ca svabhāvaḥ ca iti amaraḥ
translated: But these are the perfected natures.🔽Amarakośa says Nature and form are synonyms.

original: svarūpeṇaiva sambhavāmīti /
analyzed: sva rūpeṇa eva sambhavāmi iti
translated: I manifest only in my own form.

original: etam arthaṃ vicarituṃ viśinaṣṭi ajo 'pīty ādinā /
analyzed: etam artham vicaritum viśinaṣṭi ajaḥ pi iti ādinā
translated: To explain this meaning, he distinguishes with Though unborn... and so on.

original: api avadhāraṇe /
analyzed: api avadhāraṇe
translated: Api is for emphasis.

original: apūrvadehayogo janma /
analyzed: apūrva deha yogaḥ janma
translated: Birth is the union with a new body.

original: tadrahita eva san /
analyzed: tad rahitaḥ eva san
translated: Being devoid of that,

original: avyayātmāpi san avyayaḥ pariṇāmaśūnya ātmā buddhyādir yasya tādṛśa eva san /
analyzed: avyaya ātmā api san avyayaḥ pariṇāma śūnyaḥ ātmā buddhi ādiḥ yasya tādṛśaḥ eva san
translated: Even though having an imperishable self, having an unchanging intellect etc.,

original: ātmā puṃsi ity ādy ukteḥ /
analyzed: ātmā puṃsi iti ādi ukteḥ
translated: Because it has been said that the soul is in the masculine gender, etc.

original: bhūtānām īśvaro 'pi san svetareṣāṃ jīvānāṃ niyantaiva san ity arthaḥ /🔽ajatvādiguṇakaṃ yad vibhujñānasukhaghanaṃ rūpaṃ tenaivāvatarāmīti svarūpeṇaiva sambhavāmīty asya vivaraṇaṃ tādṛśasya svarūpasya raver ivābhiyaktimātram
analyzed: bhūtānām īśvaraḥ api san sva itareṣām jīvānām niyantā eva san iti arthaḥ  aja tva ādi guṇakam yat vibhu jñāna sukha ghanam rūpam tena eva avatarāmi iti sva rūpeṇa eva sambhavāmi iti asya vivaraṇam tādṛśasya sva rūpasya raveḥ iva abhiyakti mātram
translated: The meaning is that although he is the Lord of the elements, he is still the controller of other individual souls.

original: eva janmeti tatsvarūpasya tajjanmanaś ca lokavilakṣaṇatvaṃ tena sanātanatvaṃ ca vyaktam /
analyzed: eva janma iti tad sva rūpasya tad janmanaḥ ca loka vilakṣaṇa tvam tena sanātana tvam ca vyaktam
translated: The explanation of I manifest only in that form which is all-pervading, full of knowledge and bliss, and possesses the qualities of being unborn, etc. is that I manifest only in my own nature. This clearly shows that that nature and that birth of Him are different from the world and are eternal.

original: karmatantratvaṃ nirastam /
analyzed: karma tantra tvam nirastam
translated: The dependence on karma is refuted.

original: śrutiś caivam āha ajāyamāno bahudhā vijāyate iti /
analyzed: śrutiḥ ca evam āha a jāyamānaḥ bahudhā vijāyate iti
translated: And the Veda says thus: The unborn one is born in many ways.

original: smṛtiś ca pratyakṣaṃ ca harer janma na vikāraḥ kathaṃcana ity ādyā /
analyzed: smṛtiḥ ca pratyakṣam ca hareḥ janma na vikāraḥ kathaṃcana iti ādyā
translated: And the Smriti and the direct perception say: The birth of Hari is never a transformation, etc.

original: ataeva sūtikāgṛhe divyāyudhabhūṣaṇasya divyarūpasya ṣaḍaiśvaryasampannasya tasya vīkṣaṇaṃ smaryate /
analyzed: ataeva sūtikāgṛhe divya āyudha bhūṣaṇasya divya rūpasya ṣaṣ aiśvarya sampannasya tasya vīkṣaṇam smaryate
translated: For this very reason, the seeing of Him in the lying-in chamber, adorned with divine weapons and having a divine form, endowed with the six opulences, is remembered.

original: prayojanam āha ātmamāyayeti /
analyzed: prayojanam āha ātma māyayā iti
translated: He states the purpose: by His own Maya.

original: bhajajjīvānukampayā hetunā taduddhārāyety arthaḥ /
analyzed: bhajat jīva anukampayā hetunā tad uddhārāya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that by the cause of compassion for the individual souls who are His devotees, for their liberation.

original: māyā dambhe kṛpāyāṃ ca iti viśvaḥ /
analyzed: māyā dambhe kṛpāyām ca iti viśvaḥ
translated: Maya means deceit and compassion, according to Visnu.

original: ātmamāyayā svasārvajñena svasaṅkalpeneti kecit /
analyzed: ātma māyayā sva sārvajñena sva saṅkalpena iti kecid
translated: Some say: by His own Maya, by His own omniscience, by His own will.

original: māyā vayunaṃ jñānaṃ ca iti nirghaṇṭukoṣāt /
analyzed: māyā vayunam jñānam ca iti nirghaṇṭu koṣāt
translated: Maya, Vayu, and Jñana - from the Nirghantu lexicon.

original: lokaḥ khalu rājādiḥ pūrvadehādīni vihāyāpūrvadehādīni bhajan niranusandhir ajño janmībhavati tadvailakṣaṇyaṃ harer janminaḥ prasphuṭam /
analyzed: lokaḥ khalu rāja ādiḥ pūrva deha ādīni vihāya apūrva deha ādīni bhajan niranusandhiḥ ajñaḥ janmībhavati tad vailakṣaṇyam hareḥ janminaḥ prasphuṭam
