translated: The world, indeed, the king and others, abandoning the previous body and so on, taking up the new body and so on, being ignorant, without memory, becomes one who is born. The difference of that from the born of Hari is clear.

original: bhūtānām īśvaro 'pi sann ity anena labdhasiddhayo yogiprabhṛtayo
analyzed: bhūtānām īśvaraḥ pi san iti anena labdha siddhayaḥ yogi prabhṛtayaḥ
translated: Even though being the Lord of beings, by this (verse) the yogis and others who have attained perfection

original: 'pi vyāvṛttāḥ /
analyzed: pi vyāvṛttāḥ
translated: are also excluded.

original: sukhacidghano harir dehadehibhedena guṇaguṇibhedena ca śūnyo 'pi viśeṣabalāt tattadbhāvena viduṣāṃ pratītir āsīd iti ////
analyzed: sukha cit ghanaḥ hariḥ deha dehi bhedena guṇa guṇi bhedena ca viśeṣa balāt tad tad bhāvena viduṣām pratītiḥ āsīt iti
translated: Although Hari, who is full of bliss and consciousness, is devoid of the distinction of body and embodied, and of the distinction of quality and possessor of quality, by the power of His special (Maya), He was perceived by the wise as having such and such states.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: yadā yadā hi dharmasya glānir bhavati bhārata /
analyzed: yadā yadā hi dharmasya glāniḥ bhavati bhārata
translated: Whenever there is a decline of Dharma, O descendant of Bharata,

original: abhyutthānam adharmasya tadātmānaṃ sṛjāmy aham ////
analyzed: abhyutthānam adharmasya tadā ātmānam sṛjāmi aham
translated: and an uprising of Adharma, then I create Myself.

original: śrīdharaḥ / kadā sambhavasīty apekṣāyām āha yadā yadeti /
analyzed: āha
translated: Shridhar: When asked about when He is born, He says: Yada yada hi, whenever; etc.

original: glānir hāniḥ /
analyzed: glāniḥ hāniḥ
translated: Glani, decline; means loss.

original: abhyutthānam ādhikyam ////
analyzed: abhyutthānam ādhikyam
translated: Abhyutthana, uprising; means excess.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: evaṃ saccidānandaghanasya tava kadā kimarthaṃ vā dehivad vyavahāra iti tatrocyate yadā yadeti /
analyzed: evam saccidānanda ghanasya tava kadā kimartham vā dehi vat vyavahāraḥ iti tatra ucyate yadā yadā iti
translated: Thus, when and for what purpose do you, who are the essence of existence, knowledge and bliss, behave like an embodied being? In response to this, it is said: yadā yadā hi bhūteṣu...

original: dharmasya vedavihitasya prāṇinām abhyudayaniḥśreyasasādhanasya pravṛttinivṛttilakṣaṇasya
analyzed: dharmasya veda vihitasya prāṇinām abhyudaya niḥśreyasa sādhanasya pravṛtti nivṛtti lakṣaṇasya
translated: When there is a decline, a decrease, of dharma, which is the means of attaining the prosperity and ultimate good of living beings, which consists of engagement and disengagement,

original: varṇāśramatadācāravyaṅgyasya yadā yadā glānir hānir bhavati he bhārata bharatavaṃśodbhavatvena
analyzed: varṇa āśrama tad ācāra vyaṅgyasya yadā yadā glāniḥ hāniḥ bhavati he bhārata bharata vaṃśa udbhava tvena
translated: which is indicated by the conduct of the varnas and āśramas, then, O Bhārata, because you are born in the Bharata dynasty,

original: bhā jñānaṃ tatra ratatvena vā tvaṃ na dharmahāniṃ soḍhuṃ śaknoṣīti sambodhanārthaḥ /
analyzed: bhā jñānam tatra rata tvena vā tvam na dharma hānim soḍhum śaknoṣi iti sambodhana arthaḥ
translated: you are not able to bear the loss of dharma. This is the meaning of the vocative.

original: evaṃ yadā yadābhyutthānam udbhavo 'dharmasya vedaniṣiddhasya nānāvidhaduḥkhasādhanasya
analyzed: evam yadā yadā abhyutthānam udbhavaḥ dharmasya veda niṣiddhasya nānāvidha duḥkha sādhanasya
translated: Similarly, when there is a rise, an occurrence, of adharma, which is prohibited by the Vedas and is the means of various kinds of suffering,

original: dharmavirodhinas tadā tadātmānaṃ dehaṃ sṛjāmi nityasiddham eva sṛṣṭam iva darśayāmi māyayā // //
analyzed: dharma virodhinaḥ tadā tadā ātmānam deham sṛjāmi nitya siddham eva sṛṣṭam iva darśayāmi māyayā
translated: which is opposed to dharma, then I create myself, the eternally existent one, as if created by illusion.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: kadā sambhavāmīty apekṣāyām āha yadeti /
analyzed: kadā sambhavāmi iti apekṣāyām āha yadā iti
translated: When there is expectation of when do I manifest?, it is said: yadā yadā...

original: dharmasya glānir hānir adharmasyābhyutthānaṃ vṛddhis te dve soḍhum aśaknuvan tayor vaiparītyaṃ kartum iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: dharmasya glāniḥ hāniḥ adharmasya abhyutthānam vṛddhiḥ te dve soḍhum aśaknuvan tayoḥ vaiparītyam kartum iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that, unable to bear the decline of Dharma and the rise of Adharma, he creates a reversal of the two.

original: ātmānaṃ dehaṃ sṛjāmi nity siddham eva taṃ sṛṣṭam iva darśayāmi māyayā iti śrīmadhusūdanasarasvatīpādāḥ ////
analyzed: ātmānam deham sṛjāmi niti siddham eva tam sṛṣṭam iva darśayāmi māyayā iti śrī madhusūdana sarasvatī pādāḥ
translated: The revered Madhusudana Sarasvati says, I create the body, the Self, and by Maya, I show as if it were created, though it is eternally existent.

original: baladevaḥ / atha sambhavakālam āha yadeti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ atha sambhava kālam āha yadā iti
translated: Balarama. Now he speaks of the time of manifestation with the word 'yad'.

original: dharmasya vedoktasya glānir vināśaḥ adharmasya tadviruddhasyābhyutthānam abhuyudayas tadāham ātmānaṃ sṛjāmi prakaṭayāmi /
analyzed: dharmasya veda uktasya glāniḥ vināśaḥ adharmasya tad viruddhasya abhyutthānam abhuyudayaḥ tadā aham ātmānam sṛjāmi prakaṭayāmi
translated: When there is the decline, destruction, of Dharma, which is enjoined by the Vedas, and the rise, increase, of Adharma, which is contrary to that, then I manifest, reveal, the Self.

original: na tu nirmame tasya pūrvasiddhatvād iti nāsti matsambhavakālaniyamaḥ ////
analyzed: na tu nirmame tasya pūrva siddha tvāt iti nā asti mad sambhava kāla niyamaḥ
translated: But I do not create it, because it is already existent from before. Thus there is no restriction on the time of my manifestation.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: paritrāṇāya sādhūnāṃ vināśāya ca duṣkṛtām /
analyzed: paritrāṇāya sādhūnām vināśāya ca duṣkṛtām
translated: For the protection of the good, and for the destruction of the evil-doers,

original: dharmasaṃsthāpanārthāya saṃbhavāmi yuge yuge ////
analyzed: dharma saṃsthāpana arthāya saṃbhavāmi yuge yuge
translated: and for the establishment of righteousness, I take birth, age after age.

original: śrīdharaḥ / kimartham /
analyzed: śrīdharaḥ kimartham
translated: Sridhar. For what purpose?

original: ity apekṣāyām āha paritrāṇāyeti /
analyzed: iti apekṣāyām āha paritrāṇāya iti
translated: When there is expectation of this, he says 'for the protection' etc.

original: sādhūnāṃ svadharmavartināṃ rakṣaṇāya /
analyzed: sādhūnām svadharma vartinām rakṣaṇāya
translated: For the protection of the good, who abide by their own duty.

original: duṣṭaṃ karma kurvantīti duṣkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: duṣṭam karma kurvanti iti duṣkṛtaḥ
translated: One who does evil deeds is an evildoer.

original: teṣāṃ vadhāya ca /
analyzed: teṣām vadhāya ca
translated: And for the sake of their destruction.

original: evaṃ dharmasaṃsthāpanārthāya sādhurakṣaṇena duṣṭavadhena ca dharmaṃ sthirīkartum /
analyzed: evam dharma saṃsthāpana arthāya sādhu rakṣaṇena duṣṭa vadhena ca dharmam sthirīkartum
translated: Thus, for the sake of establishing Dharma, by protecting the good and by destroying the wicked, in order to stabilize Dharma.

original: yuge yuge tattadavasare sambhavāmīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: yuge yuge tad tad avasare sambhavāmi iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that I appear at that time, in that age.

original: na caivaṃ duṣṭanigrahaṃ kurvato 'pi nairghṛṇyaṃ śaṅkanīyam /
analyzed: na ca evam duṣṭa nigraham kurvataḥ nairghṛṇyam śaṅkanīyam
translated: And even while acting thus to restrain the wicked, one should not suspect that you are devoid of compassion.

original: yathāhuḥ lālane tāḍane mātur nākāruṇyaṃ yathārbhake /
analyzed: yathā āhuḥ lālane tāḍane mātuḥ na akāruṇyam yathā arbhake
translated: As they say: Just as a mother is not uncompassionate in fondling and beating her child,

original: tat tad eva maheśasya niyantur guṇadoṣayoḥ ////
analyzed: tat tat eva maheśasya niyantuḥ guṇa doṣayoḥ
translated: That is exactly the quality and fault of Mahesha, the controller.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: tat kiṃ dharmasya hānir adharmasya ca vṛddhis tava paritoṣakāraṇaṃ yena tasminn eva kāla āvirbhavasīti tathā cānarthāvaha eva tavāvatāraḥ
analyzed: tat kim dharmasya hāniḥ adharmasya ca vṛddhiḥ tava paritoṣa kāraṇam yena tasmin eva kāle āvirbhavasi iti tathā ca anartha āvahaḥ eva tava avatāraḥ
translated: Is it the cause of your satisfaction that there is a decline of Dharma and an increase of Adharma, by which you manifest at that very time? And thus your incarnation is indeed fruitless.

original: iti nety āha paritrāṇāyeti /🔽dharmahānyā hīyamānānāṃ sādhūnāṃ puṇyakāriṇāṃ vedamārgasthānāṃ paritrāṇāya paritaḥ sarvato rakṣaṇāya /
analyzed: iti na iti āha paritrāṇāya iti  dharma hānyāḥ hīyamānānām sādhūnām puṇya kāriṇām veda mārga sthānām paritrāṇāya paritas sarvatas rakṣaṇāya
translated: No, he says, for the sake of protection, etc.🔽For the sake of protecting the virtuous, the meritorious, the followers of the Vedic path, who are declining due to the decline of Dharma.

original: tathādharmavṛddhyā vardhamānānāṃ duṣkṛtāṃ pāpakāriṇāṃ vedamārgavirodhināṃ vināśāya ca /
analyzed: tathā adharma vṛddhyā vardhamānānām duṣkṛtām pāpa kāriṇām veda mārga virodhinām vināśāya ca
translated: And for the sake of destroying those who are increasing due to the increase of Adharma, the evil-doers, the followers of paths contrary to the Vedas.

original: tad ubhayaṃ kathaṃ syād iti tad āha dharmasaṃsthāpanārthāya dharmasya samyagadharmanivāraṇena
analyzed: tat ubhayam katham syāt iti tat āha dharma saṃsthāpana arthāya dharmasya samyak adharma nivāraṇena
translated: How can both of these be? To that He says, for the establishment of religion, by the proper prevention of irreligion,

original: sthāpanaṃ vedamārgaparirakṣaṇaṃ dharmasaṃsthāpanaṃ tadarthaṃ sambhavāmi pūrvavat /
analyzed: sthāpanam veda mārga parirakṣaṇam dharma saṃsthāpanam tad artham sambhavāmi pūrvavat
translated: the establishment of religion is the protection of the path of the Vedas. For that purpose I take birth as before.

original: yuge yuge pratiyugam ////
analyzed: yuge yuge pratiyugam
translated: In every age, in every age.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: nanu tvadbhaktā rājarṣayo brahmarṣayo 'pi vā dharmahānyadharmavṛddhī dūrīkartuṃ śaknuvanty eva /
analyzed: nanu tvad bhaktāḥ rājarṣayaḥ brahmarṣayaḥ vā dharma hāni adharma vṛddhī dūrīkartum śaknuvanti eva
translated: But the royal sages and even the Brahmana sages who are Your devotees can certainly remove the loss of religion and the increase of irreligion.

original: etāvad artham eva kiṃ tavāvatāreṇa /
analyzed: etāvat artham eva kim tava avatāreṇa
translated: Is it only for this purpose that You take birth?

original: iti cet / satyam /
analyzed: iti ced satyam
translated: If so, that is true.

original: anyad api anyaduṣkaraṃ karma kartuṃ sambhavāmīty āha parīti /
analyzed: anyat api anya duṣkaram karma kartum sambhavāmi iti āha pari iti
translated: He says with 'paritrāṇāya' that He takes birth to do another difficult task.

original: sādhūnāṃ paritrāṇāya madekāntabhaktānāṃ maddarśanotkaṇṭhāsphuṭacittānāṃ yad vaiyāgryarūpaṃ duḥkham /
analyzed: sādhūnām paritrāṇāya mad ekānta bhaktānām mad darśana utkaṇṭhā sphuṭa cittānām yat vaiyāgrya rūpam duḥkham
translated: For the protection of the good, of those who are solely devoted to Me, whose minds are filled with longing to see Me, from the sorrow in the form of fear.

original: tasmāt trāṇāya /
analyzed: tasmāt trāṇāya
translated: For that protection.

original: tathā duṣkṛtāṃ madbhaktalokaduḥkhadāyināṃ madanyair avadhyānāṃ rāvaṇakaṃsakeśyādīnāṃ vināśāya /
analyzed: tathā duṣkṛtām mad bhakta loka duḥkha dāyinām mad anyaiḥ avadhyānām rāvaṇa kaṃsa keśī ādīnām vināśāya
translated: And for the destruction of the wicked, who cause suffering to My devotees and cannot be killed by anyone else, like Ravana, Kamsa, Keshi, and others.

original: tathā dharmasaṃsthāpanārthāya madīyadhyānayajanaparicaryāsaṅkīrtanalakṣaṇaṃ paramadharmaṃ madanyaiḥ pravartayitum aśakyaṃ samyak prakāreṇa
analyzed: tathā dharma saṃsthāpana arthāya madīya dhyāna yajana paricaryā saṅkīrtana lakṣaṇam parama dharmam mad anyaiḥ pravartayitum aśakyam samyak prakāreṇa
translated: Similarly, for the sake of establishing Dharma, the supreme Dharma characterized by meditation, worship, and service to me, which cannot be properly practiced by anyone else,

original: sthāpayitum ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: sthāpayitum iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is that it can be properly established.

original: yuge yuge pratiyugaṃ pratikalpaṃ vā /🔽na caivaṃ duṣṭanigrahakṛto bhagavato vaiṣamyam
analyzed: yuge yuge pratiyugam pratikalpam vā  na ca evam duṣṭa nigraha kṛtaḥ bhagavataḥ vaiṣamyam
translated: In every age, in every kalpa.

original: āśaṅkanīyam /🔽duṣṭānām apy asurāṇāṃ svakartṛvadhena vividhaduṣkṛtaphalān narakasahapraṇipātāt saṃsārāc ca paritrāṇatas tasya sa khalu nigraho 'py anugraha
analyzed: āśaṅkanīyam  duṣṭānām api asurāṇām svakartṛ vadhena vividha duṣkṛta phalāt naraka saha praṇipātāt saṃsārāt ca paritrāṇataḥ tasya sa khalu
translated: And one should not suspect that the Lord's partiality arises from punishing the wicked.

original: eva nirṇītaḥ ////
analyzed: eva nirṇītaḥ
translated: For even the wicked demons, by killing themselves, are saved from hell and rebirth due to the fruits of their various misdeeds, and are thus protected from the cycle of existence. Therefore, that punishment of theirs is indeed determined to be a favor.

original: baladevaḥ / nanu tvadbhaktā rājarṣayo 'pi dharmaglānim adharmābhyutthānaṃ cāpanetuṃ prabhavanti tāvate 'rthāya kiṃ sambhavāmīty āha parīti
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu tvad bhaktāḥ rājarṣayaḥ api dharma glānim adharma abhyutthānam ca apanetum prabhavanti tāvate rthāya kim sambhavāmi iti āha pari iti
translated: Balarama. But even your devotee-kings are able to remove the decline of Dharma and the rise of adharma. For that purpose, why do I exist? He says: parī (verse 11).

original: sādhūnāṃ madrūpaguṇaniratānāṃ matsākṣātkāram ākāṅkṣyatāṃ tena vinātivyagrāṇāṃ tadvaiyagryarūpād duḥkhāt paritrāṇāyātimanojñasvarūpasākṣātkāreṇa
analyzed: sādhūnām mad rūpa guṇa niratānām mad sākṣātkāram ākāṅkṣyatām tena vinā ati vyagrāṇām tad vaiyagrya rūpāt duḥkhāt paritrāṇāya ati manojña sva rūpa sākṣātkāreṇa
translated: For the virtuous who are devoted to qualities like Me, who desire the direct realization of Me, who are very busy without that, for their protection from the suffering in the form of that busyness, by the direct realization of a very pleasing form,

original: tathā duṣkṛtāṃ duṣṭakarmakāriṇāṃ madanyair avadhyānāṃ daśagrīvakaṃsādīnāṃ tādṛgbhaktadrohiṇāṃ
analyzed: tathā duṣkṛtām duṣṭa karma kāriṇām madanyaiḥ avadhyānām daśagrīva kaṃsa ādīnām tādṛś bhakta drohiṇām
translated: And for the destruction of the wicked who perform evil deeds, who are not to be killed by others, like Ravana, Kamsa and others, who are such betrayers of devotees,

original: vināśāya dharmasya madekārcanadhyānādilakṣaṇasya śuddhabhaktiyogasya vaidikasyāpi
analyzed: vināśāya dharmasya mad eka arcana dhyāna ādi lakṣaṇasya śuddha bhakti yogasya vaidikasya api
translated: For the establishment and propagation of righteousness, which is characterized by worship, meditation on Me and so on, and even of the Vedic path of devotion,

original: maditaraiḥ pracārayitum aśakyasya saṃsthāpanārthāya sampracārāyety etat trayaṃ matsambhavasya kāraṇam iti /
analyzed: mad itaraiḥ pracārayitum aśakyasya saṃsthāpana arthāya sampracārāya iti etat trayam mad sambhavasya kāraṇam iti
translated: Which is incapable of being practiced by others, these three are the causes of My manifestation.

original: yuge yuge tattatsamayena ca duṣṭavadhena harau vaiṣamyaṃ /🔽tena duṣṭānāṃ mokṣānandalābhe sati tasyānugraharūpatvena
analyzed: yuge yuge tad tad samayena ca duṣṭa vadhena harau vaiṣamyam  tena duṣṭānām mokṣa ānanda lābhe sati tasya anugraha rūpa tvena
translated: In every age, at that time, there is inequality in Hari due to the killing of the wicked.🔽Therefore, when the wicked attain the bliss of liberation, by that as His grace,

original: pariṇāmāt ////
analyzed: pariṇāmāt
translated: there is transformation.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: janma karma ca me divyam evaṃ yo vetti tattvataḥ /
analyzed: janma karma ca me divyam evam yaḥ vetti tattvataḥ
translated: One who knows My divine birth and deeds thus in reality,

original: tyaktvā dehaṃ punar janma naiti mām eti so 'rjuna ////
analyzed: tyaktvā deham punar janma na eti mām eti saḥ rjuna
translated: renouncing the body, does not attain birth again, but attains Me, O Arjuna.

original: śrīdharaḥ / evaṃvidhānām īśvarajanmakarmaṇāṃ jñāne phalam āha janmeti /
translated: Śrīdhara: The result of the knowledge of the incarnations of the Lord, which are of this kind, is stated with birth etc.

original: svecchayā kṛtaṃ mama janma karma ca dharmapālanarūpaṃ divyam alaukikaṃ tattvataḥ parānugrahārtham eveti yo vetti sa dehābhimānaṃ tyaktvā
analyzed: sva icchayā kṛtam mama janma karma ca dharma pālana rūpam divyam alaukikam tattvataḥ para anugraha artham eva iti yaḥ vetti sa deha abhimānam tyaktvā
translated: Sridhara: The result of the knowledge of the activities of the Lord's birth is stated thus: One who knows that My birth and activities are divine, not worldly, are only for the grace of others, he, renouncing the notion of the body,

original: punar janma saṃsāraṃ naiti na prāpnoti /
analyzed: punar janma saṃsāram na eti na prāpnoti
translated: does not return to birth, to worldly existence.

original: kintu mām eva prāpnoti ////🔽madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: kintu mām eva prāpnoti  madhusūdanaḥ
translated: But he attains Me alone.

original: janma nityasiddhasyaiva mama saccidānandaghanasya līlayā tathānukaraṇam /
analyzed: janma nitya siddhasya eva mama saccidānanda ghanasya līlayā tathā anukaraṇam
translated: Madhusudana: Birth is the mere imitation by Me, who am eternally existent, of birth, by My own will, of one who is an aggregate of existence, knowledge and bliss.

original: karma ca dharmasaṃsthāpanena jagatparipālanaṃ me mama nityasiddheśvarasya divyam aprākṛtam anyaiḥ kartum aśakyam īśvarasyaivāsādharaṇam
analyzed: karma ca dharma saṃsthāpanena jagat paripālanam me mama nitya siddha īśvarasya divyam aprākṛtam anyaiḥ kartum aśakyam īśvarasya eva a sādharaṇam
translated: And My activity, which consists in the establishment of religion and the protection of the world, is divine, not natural, incapable of being performed by others, and unique to God.

original: evam ajo 'pi sann ity ādinā pratipāditaṃ yo vetti tattvato bhramanivartanena /
analyzed: evam ajaḥ san iti ādinā pratipāditam yaḥ vetti tattvataḥ bhrama nivartanena
translated: One who knows this as it is, by the removal of error, as stated by though unborn... etc.

original: mūḍhair hi mauṣyatvabhrāntyā bhagavato 'pi garbhavāsādirūpam eva janma svabhogārtham eva karmety āropitam /
analyzed: mūḍhaiḥ hi garbha vāsa ādi rūpam eva janma sva bhoga artham eva karma iti āropitam
translated: For the deluded, by the error of considering Him as a human being, have superimposed on Him birth in the form of residence in the womb, etc., and activity for His own enjoyment alone.

original: paramārthataḥ śuddhasaccidānandarūpatvajñānena tadapanudyājasyāpi māyayā janmānukaraṇam
analyzed: paramārthataḥ śuddha saccidānanda rūpa tva jñānena tat apanudya ajasya api māyayā janma anukaraṇam
translated: By the knowledge that in reality he is pure, real, knowledge, and bliss, he removes that (ignorance) and even though he is not the doer, he imitates birth by Maya.

original: akartur api parānugrahāya karmānukaraṇam iy evaṃ yo vetti sa ātmano 'pi tattvasphuraṇāt
analyzed: akartuḥ api para anugrahāya karma anukaraṇam id evam yaḥ vetti saḥ ātmanaḥ tattva sphuraṇāt
translated: Even though he is not the doer, he imitates action for the grace of others. Thus, he who knows this, by the manifestation of the truth of the Self,

original: tyaktvā deham imaṃ punar janma naiti /
analyzed: tyaktvā deham imam punar janma na eti
translated: having abandoned this body, does not return to birth again.

original: kintu māṃ bhagavantaṃ vāsudevam eva saccidānandaghanam eti saṃsārān mucyata ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: kintu mām bhagavantam vāsudevam eva saccidānanda ghanam eti saṃsārāt mucyate iti arthaḥ
translated: But he goes to Me, the Lord Vasudeva, who is full of existence, knowledge, and bliss. The meaning is that he is liberated from the worldly existence.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: uktalakṣaṇasya majjanmanas tathā janmānantaraṃ matkarmaṇaś ca tattvato jñānamātreṇaiva kṛtārthaḥ syād ity āha janmeti /
analyzed: ukta lakṣaṇasya mad janmanaḥ tathā janma anantaram mad karmaṇaḥ ca tattvataḥ jñāna mātreṇa eva kṛtārthaḥ syāt iti āha janma iti
translated: He would be satisfied merely by the knowledge of the truth of my birth, which is described above, and of my actions after birth. Thus, it is said: By birth...

original: divyam aprākṛtaṃ iti śrīrāmānujācāryacaraṇāḥ śrīmadhusūdanasarasvatīpādāś ca /
analyzed: divyam aprākṛtam iti śrī rāmānuja ācārya caraṇāḥ śrī madhusūdana sarasvatī pādāḥ ca
translated: The divine is non-natural, according to Sri Ramanuja Acharya's feet and Sri Madhusudana Saraswati's feet.

original: divyam alaukikaṃ iti śrīsvāmicaraṇāḥ /
analyzed: divyam alaukikam iti śrī svāmi caraṇāḥ
translated: The divine is transcendental, according to Sri Swami's feet.

original: lokānāṃ prakṛtisṛṣṭatvād alaukikaśabdasya aprākṛtatvam evārthas teṣām apy abhipretaḥ /
analyzed: lokānām prakṛti sṛṣṭa tvāt alaukika śabdasya aprākṛta tvam eva arthaḥ teṣām api abhipretaḥ
translated: Since the worlds are created by Prakriti, the meaning of the word transcendental is only non-natural for them, which is also intended by them.

original: ataevāprākṛtatvena guṇātītatvād bhagavajjanmakarmaṇo nityatvam /
analyzed: ataeva aprākṛta tvena guṇa atīta tvāt bhagavat janma karmaṇaḥ nitya tvam
translated: Therefore, because of being extraordinary, the birth and activities of the Lord are eternal, being beyond the qualities.

original: tac ca bhagavatsandarbhe na vidyate yasya ca janma karma vā BhP / / ity atra śloke śrījīvagosvāmicaraṇair upapāditam /
analyzed: tat ca bhagavat sandarbhe na vidyate yasya ca janma karma vā bhp iti atra śloke śrī jīvagosvāmi caraṇaiḥ upapāditam
translated: And that is not found in the Bhagavat-सन्दर्भ. And in the verse Whose birth and activities... it has been explained by Sri Jiva Gosvami.

original: yad vā yuktyanupapannam api śrutismṛtivākyabalād atarkam evedaṃ mantavyam /
analyzed: yat vā yukti anupapannam api śruti smṛti vākya balāt atarkam evā idam mantavyam
translated: Or, even if it is logically impossible, this should be considered as beyond reasoning only by the power of the statements of the Vedas and Smritis.

original: tatra pippalādaśākhāyāṃ puruṣabodhinīśrutiḥ eko devo nityalīlānurakto bhaktavyāpī bhaktahṛdayāntarātmā iti /
analyzed: tatra pippalāda śākhāyām puruṣabodhinī śrutiḥ ekaḥ devaḥ nitya līlā anuraktaḥ bhakta vyāpī bhakta hṛdaya antarātmā iti
translated: In that regard, in the Pipalada branch, there is the Purusabodhini Veda: The one God, always attached to pastimes, pervades the devotees, the inner soul of the hearts of the devotees.

original: tathā janmakarmaṇo
analyzed: tathā janma karmaṇaḥ
translated: Similarly, the eternality of birth and activities

original: nityatvaṃ śrībhāgavatāmṛte bahuśa eva prapañcitam /
analyzed: nitya tvam śrī bhāgavatāmṛte bahuśas eva prapañcitam
translated: has been extensively explained in the nectar of the Srimad Bhagavatam.

original: evaṃ yo vetti tattvata iti ajo 'pi sann avyayatātmā ity asmiṃs tathā janma karma ca me divyam ity asmiṃś ca madvākya evāstikatayā majjanmakarmaṇor
analyzed: evam yaḥ vetti tattvataḥ iti ajaḥ san avyaya tā ātmā iti asmin tathā janma karma ca me divyam iti asmin ca mad vākye eva āstika tayā mad janma karmaṇoḥ
translated: Thus, one who knows this as it is, as in The unborn, the unchanging Self... and My divine birth and activities... has faith in My words alone.

original: nityatvam eva yo jānāti /
analyzed: nitya tvam eva yaḥ jānāti
translated: He knows the eternality of My birth and activities.

original: na tu tayor nityatve kāñcid yuktim apy apekṣamāṇo bhavatīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: na tu tayoḥ nitya tve kāñcid yuktim api apekṣamāṇaḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he does not even look for any logic in the eternality of those two.

original: yad vā tattvataḥ oṃ tat sad iti nirdeśo brahmaṇas trividhaḥ smṛtaḥ Gītā / ity
analyzed: yat vā tattvataḥ om tat sat iti nirdeśaḥ brahmaṇaḥ trividhaḥ smṛtaḥ gītā iti
translated: Or, in reality, the three-fold designation of Brahman is said to be Om, Tat, Sat, as stated in the Gita.

original: agrimoktes tacchabdena brahmocyate tasya bhāvas tattvaṃ tena brahmasvarūpatvena yo vettīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: agrima ukteḥ tad śabdena brahma ucyate tasya bhāvaḥ tattvam tena brahma svarūpa tvena yaḥ vetti iti arthaḥ
translated: By the word tat (that) mentioned in the next verse, Brahman is meant. The meaning is: he who knows Brahman as the reality, i.e., as having the nature of Brahman.

original: sa vartamānaṃ dehaṃ tyaktvā punar janma naiti kintu mām evaiti /
analyzed: sa vartamānam deham tyaktvā punar janma na eti kintu mām eva eti
translated: He, having given up the present body, does not go to rebirth again, but goes to Me alone.

original: atra dehaṃ tyaktvā ity asyādhikyād evaṃ vyācakṣate sma /
analyzed: atra deham tyaktvā iti asya ādhikyāt evam vyācakṣate sma
translated: Here, because of the superabundance of the words having given up the body, they explain it thus.

original: sa dehaṃ tyaktvā punar janma naiti kintu deham atyaktvaiva mām eti /
analyzed: sa deham tyaktvā punar janma na eti kintu deham a tyaktvā eva mām eti
translated: He, having given up the body, does not go to rebirth again, but goes to Me even without giving up the body.

original: madīyadivyajanmaceṣṭitayāthātmyavijñānena vidhvastasamastamatsamāśrayaṇavirodhipāpmāsminn eva janmani yathoditaprakāreṇa mām
analyzed: madīya divya janma ceṣṭita yāthātmya vijñānena vidhvasta samasta mad samāśrayaṇa virodhi pāpmā asmin eva janmani yathā udita prakāreṇa mām
translated: By the knowledge of the truth of My divine deeds and conduct, having destroyed all the sins that obstruct taking refuge in Me, in this very life, by resorting to Me in the manner described,

original: āśritya madekapriyo madekacitto mām eva prāpnoti iti śrīrāmānujācāryacaraṇāḥ ////
analyzed: āśritya mad eka priyaḥ mad ekacittaḥ mām eva prāpnoti iti śrī rāmānuja ācārya caraṇāḥ
translated: he, being dear to Me alone, having his mind fixed on Me alone, attains Me alone. Thus say the feet of the illustrious Ramanuja.

original: baladevaḥ / bahulāyāsaiḥ sādhanasahasrair api durlabho mokṣo majjanmacaritaśravaṇena
analyzed: baladevaḥ bahula āyāsaiḥ sādhana sahasraiḥ api durlabhaḥ mokṣaḥ mad janma carita śravaṇena
translated: Balarama. Liberation, which is difficult to attain even with thousands of austerities requiring great effort,🔽is attained by listening to the life story of Me, the Supreme Lord.

original: madekāntipathānuvartināṃ sulabho 'stv ity etad arthaṃ ca sambhavāmīty āśayā bhagavān āha janmeti /🔽mama sarveśvarasya satyecchasya vaidūryavan nityasiddhanṛsiṃharaghunāthādibahularūpasya🔽tatra tatroktalakṣṇaṃ janma tathā karma ca tattadbhaktasambandhaṃ caritaṃ tad🔽ubhayaṃ divyam aprākṛtaṃ nityaṃ bhavatīty evam evaitad iti yas tattvato vetti yad🔽gataṃ bhavac ca bhaviṣyac ca eko devo nityalīlānurakto bhaktavyāpī bhaktahṛdy
analyzed: mad ekānti patha anuvartinām sulabhaḥ stu iti etat artham ca sambhavāmi iti āśayā bhagavān āha janma iti  mama sarveśvarasya satya icchasya vaidūrya vat nitya siddha nṛsiṃha raghunātha ādi bahula rūpasya  tatra tatra ukta lakṣṇam janma tathā karma ca tad tad bhakta sambandham caritam tat  ubhayam divyam aprākṛtam nityam bhavati iti evam eva etat iti yaḥ tattvataḥ vetti yat  gatam bhavat ca bhaviṣyat ca ekaḥ devaḥ nitya līlā anuraktaḥ bhakta vyāpī bhakta hṛdi
translated: The Lord says janma etc. with the intention that it may be easy for those who follow the path of exclusive devotion to me.🔽Of me, the all-powerful one, whose desire is true, whose many forms such as Nṛsiṃha, Raghunātha, etc. are eternally established like a lapis lazuli,🔽there in each place, the birth with the characteristics mentioned, the deeds, and the conduct related to each devotee,🔽both of those are divine, unmanifest, and eternal. One who knows this as it is,🔽who is the one God, always devoted to play, pervading the devotees, dear to the devotees,🔽who has gone, who is present, and who will come,

original: antarātmā iti śrutyā divyam iti maduktyā ca dṛḍhaśraddho yuktinirapekṣaḥ san /🔽he arjuna /
analyzed: antarātmā iti śrutyā divyam iti mad uktyā ca dṛḍha śraddhaḥ yukti nirapekṣaḥ san  he arjuna
translated: The Lord says jñātvā, knowing; tattvena, in reality; yad, what; gatan, has gone; bhavacc, that is present; and bhaviṣyat, that will be; ekaḥ, the One; devo, God; nitya-līlā-anuraktaḥ, who is ever attached to divine pastimes; bhakta-vyāpī, who pervades the devotees; bhakta-hṛd-ātmā, whose heart is the devotees; iti, thus; śrutyā, by the scriptures; and divyam, divine; iti, thus; mad-uktyā, by My statement; saḥ, he; who is dṛḍha-śraddhah, of firm faith; and yukti-nirapekṣaḥ, who is not dependent on logic; saḥ, he; na eti, does not go; punar, again; janma-mārgam, the path of birth; tyaktvā, after giving up; deham, this body.🔽But he attains Me alone, who is pleasing to the mind through various actions. The meaning is: he becomes liberated.

original: sa vartamānaṃ dehaṃ tyaktvā punaḥ prāpañcikaṃ janma naiti /
analyzed: sa vartamānam deham tyaktvā punar prāpañcikam janma na eti
translated: O Arjuna, he, after giving up this present body, does not go again to mundane birth.

original: kintu mām eva tattatkarmamanojñam eti mukto bhavatīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: kintu mām eva tad tad karma manojñam eti muktaḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: But he attains Me alone, who is pleasing to the mind through various actions. The meaning is: he becomes liberated.

original: yad vā mocakatvaliṅgena tat tvam asi iti śruteś ca me janmakarmaṇī🔽tattvato brahmatvena yo vettīti vyākhyeyam /
analyzed: yat vā mocaka tva liṅgena tat tvam asi iti śruteḥ ca me janma karmaṇī  tattvataḥ brahmatvena yaḥ vetti iti vyākhyeyam
translated: Or, it should be explained that one who knows his birth and actions🔽as truly being Brahman by the mark of being the liberator, according to the Upanisadic text That thou art.

original: itarathā tam eva viditvātimṛtyum eti nānyaḥ panthā vidyate 'yanāya ŚvetU / iti śrutir vyākupyet /
analyzed: itarathā tam eva viditvā atimṛtyum eti na anyaḥ panthāḥ vidyate yanāya śvetu iti śrutiḥ vyākupyet
translated: Otherwise, the Upanisadic text Knowing Him alone, one goes beyond death. There is no other path to go would be contradicted.

original: samānam anyat /
analyzed: samānam anyat
translated: The rest is the same.

original: janmādinityatāyāṃ yuktayas tv anyatra vistṛtā draṣṭavyāḥ ////
analyzed: janma ādi nitya tāyām yuktayaḥ tu anyatra vistṛtāḥ draṣṭavyāḥ
translated: The arguments for the eternality of birth etc. should be seen as elaborated elsewhere.

original: BhG /🔽vītarāgabhayakrodhā manmayā mām upāśritāḥ /
analyzed: bhg  vīta rāga bhaya krodhāḥ mad mayāḥ mām upāśritāḥ
translated: BhG.🔽Many, being free from attachment, fear and anger, being full of Me, resorting to Me,

original: bahavo jñānatapasā pūtā madbhāvam āgatāḥ ////
analyzed: bahavaḥ jñāna tapasā pūtāḥ mad bhāvam āgatāḥ
translated: purified by knowledge and austerity, have attained My nature.

original: śrīdharaḥ / kathaṃ janmakarmajñānena tvatprāptiḥ syād iti /
translated: Shridhar: How can one attain You through knowledge of birth and action?

original: ata āha vītarāgeti /
analyzed: atas āha vīta rāga iti
translated: To this, He says, being free from attachment etc.

original: ahaṃ śuddhasattvāvatāraiḥ dharmapālanaṃ karomīti madīyaṃ paramakāruṇikatvaṃ jñātvā /
analyzed: aham śuddha sattva avatāraiḥ dharma pālanam karomi iti madīyam parama kāruṇika tvam jñātvā
translated: Knowing that I, out of supreme compassion, carry out the protection of religion through incarnations of pure goodness,

original: mām evopāśritāḥ santaḥ /
analyzed: mām eva upāśritāḥ santaḥ
translated: resorting to Me alone,

original: matprasādalabdhaṃ yadātmajñānaṃ ca tapaś ca /
analyzed: mad prasāda labdham yat ātma jñānam ca tapaḥ ca
translated: the knowledge of the Self and austerity, which are obtained by My grace,

original: tatparipākahetuḥ svadharmaḥ /
analyzed: tad paripāka hetuḥ svadharmaḥ
translated: are the cause of their maturity. One's own duty.

original: tayor dvandvaikavad bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tayoḥ dvandva eka vat bhāvaḥ
translated: The dvandva compound is in the singular.

original: tena jñānatapasā pūtāḥ śuddhā nirastājñānatatkāryamalāḥ /
analyzed: tena jñāna tapasā pūtāḥ śuddhāḥ nirasta ajñāna tad kārya malāḥ
translated: By that knowledge-penance, many have become purified, cleansed, and freed from the impurities of ignorance and its effects.

original: madbhāvaṃ matsāyujyaṃ prāptā bahavaḥ /
analyzed: mad bhāvam mad sāyujyam prāptāḥ bahavaḥ
translated: They have attained My nature, union with Me.

original: na tv adhunaiva pravṛtto 'yaṃ madbhaktimārga ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: na tu adhunā eva pravṛttaḥ yam mad bhakti mārgaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that this path of devotion to Me did not begin only now.

original: tad evaṃ tāny ahaṃ veda sarvāṇīty ādinā vidyāvidyopādhibhyāṃ tattvaṃpadārthāv īśvarajīvau🔽pradarśyeśvarasya cāvidyābhāvena nityaśuddhatvāj jīvasya ceśvaraprasādalabdhajñānenājñānanivṛtteḥ
analyzed: tat evam tāni aham veda sarvāṇi iti ādinā vidyā avidyā upādhibhyām tattvam padārthau īśvara jīvau  pradarśya īśvarasya ca avidyā bhāvena nitya śuddha tvāt jīvasya ca īśvara prasāda labdha jñānena ajñāna nivṛtteḥ
translated: Thus, by the passages beginning with I know all those, the true meanings of the words tat and tvam, the Lord and the individual soul, are shown to be qualified by knowledge and ignorance respectively.

original: śuddhasya sataś cidaṃśena tadaikyam uktam iti draṣṭavyam // //
analyzed: śuddhasya sataḥ cit aṃśena tad aikyam uktam iti draṣṭavyam
translated: And it should be seen that the identity of the pure with the conscious part of that [Lord] is stated because the Lord is eternally pure due to the absence of ignorance in Him, and the individual soul's ignorance ceases by the knowledge obtained through the Lord's grace.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: mām eti so 'rjunety uktaṃ tatra svasya sarvamuktaprāpyatayā puruṣārthatvam asya mokṣamārgasyānādiparasparāgatatvaṃ ca darśayati vītarāgeti
analyzed: mām eti saḥ rjuna iti uktam tatra svasya sarva mukta prāpya tayā puruṣa artha tvam asya mokṣa mārgasya anādi paraspara āgata tvam ca darśayati vīta rāga iti
translated: He goes to Me, O Arjuna, this is said. There, by showing that one's own self is the human goal through being attainable by all the liberated, and that this path of liberation is beginningless and mutually related, [the Lord] says free from attachment and so on.

original: rāgas tattatphalatṛṣṇā /
translated: Attachment is the desire for the fruits of various [actions].

original: sarvān viṣayān parityajya jñānamārge kathaṃ jīvitavyam iti trāso bhayam /
analyzed: sarvān viṣayān parityajya jñāna mārge katham jīvitavyam iti trāsaḥ bhayam
translated: Fear is the terror of how to live by abandoning all objects and following the path of knowledge.

original: sarvaviṣayocchedako 'yaṃ jñānamārgaḥ kathaṃ hitaḥ syād iti dveṣaḥ krodhaḥ /
analyzed: sarva viṣaya ucchedakaḥ yam jñāna mārgaḥ katham hitaḥ syāt iti dveṣaḥ krodhaḥ
translated: How can this path of knowledge, which cuts off all objects of sense, be beneficial? This is hatred, anger.

original: ta ete rāgabhayakrodhā vītā vivekena vigatā yebhyas te vītarāgabhayakrodhāḥ śuddhasattvāḥ /
analyzed: te ete rāga bhaya krodhāḥ vītāḥ vivekena vigatāḥ yebhyaḥ te vīta rāga bhaya krodhāḥ śuddha sattvāḥ
translated: Those who are devoid of these, attachment, fear, and anger, through discrimination, are free from attachment, fear, and anger, are pure souls.

original: manmayā māṃ paramātmānaṃ tatpadārthatvaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: mad mayāḥ mām paramātmānam tad padārtha tvam gatāḥ
translated: They are absorbed in Me, have attained the state of being the supreme Self.

original: bahavo 'neke jñānatapasā jñānam eva tapaḥ sarvakarmakṣayahetutvāt /
analyzed: bahavaḥ na eke jñāna tapasā jñānam eva tapaḥ sarva karma kṣaya hetu tvāt
translated: Many, many, through knowledge and austerity - knowledge itself is austerity, because it is the cause of the destruction of all actions.

original: na hi jñānena sadṛśaṃ pavitram iha vidyate iti hi vakṣyati /🔽tena pūtāḥ kṣīṇasarvapāpāḥ santo nirastājñānatatkāryamalāḥ /
analyzed: na hi jñānena sadṛśam pavitram iha vidyate iti hi vakṣyati  tena pūtāḥ kṣīṇa sarva pāpāḥ santaḥ nirasta ajñāna tad kārya malāḥ
translated: For it will be said: In this world there is no purifier equal to knowledge.🔽Purified by that, having destroyed all sins, having removed the impurity of ignorance and its effects,

original: madbhāvaṃ madrūpatvaṃ viśuddhasaccidānandaghanaṃ mokṣam
analyzed: mad bhāvam mad rūpa tvam viśuddha saccidānanda ghanam mokṣam
translated: they have attained My state, which is liberation, consisting of pure existence, knowledge, and bliss, the nature of Me, the supreme Self.

original: āgatā ajñānamātrāpanayena mokṣaṃ prāptāḥ /
analyzed: āgatāḥ ajñāna mātra apanayena mokṣam prāptāḥ
translated: By the mere removal of ignorance, they have attained liberation.

original: jñānatapasā pūtā jīvanmuktāḥ santo madbhāvaṃ madviṣayaṃ bhāvaṃ ratyākhyaṃ premāṇam āgatā iti vā /
analyzed: jñāna tapasā pūtāḥ jīvanmuktāḥ santaḥ mad bhāvam mad viṣayam bhāvam rati ākhyam premāṇam āgatāḥ iti vā
translated: Or, purified by knowledge and austerity, being liberated while living, they have attained the state of being absorbed in Me, love called rati.

original: teṣāṃ jñānī nityayuktā ekabhaktir viśiṣyate iti hi vakṣyati ////
analyzed: teṣām jñānī nitya yuktā eka bhaktiḥ viśiṣyate iti hi vakṣyati
translated: Among them, the knower, always devoted, having single devotion, is distinguished. Thus it will be said.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: na kevalam eka evādhunika eva /
analyzed: na kevalam ekaḥ eva ādhunikaḥ eva
translated: Not only one, but many.

original: majjanmakarmatattvajñānamātreṇaiva māṃ prāpnoty api tu prāktanā api pūrvapūrvakalpāvatīrṇasya mama janmakarmatattvajñānavanto mām
analyzed: mad janma karma tattva jñāna mātreṇa eva mām prāpnoti api tu prāktanāḥ api pūrva pūrva kalpa avatīrṇasya mama janma karma tattva jñānavantaḥ mām
translated: Not only one who is born in the present age, but also those who were born in the past ages, who knew the truth of my birth and deeds,

original: āpur evety āha vīteti /
analyzed: āpuḥ eva iti āha vīta iti
translated: attained me.

original: jñānam uktalakṣaṇaṃ majjanmakarmaṇos tattvato 'nubhavarūpam eva tapas tena pūtāḥ iti śrīrāmānujācāryacaraṇāḥ /
analyzed: jñānam ukta lakṣaṇam mad janma karmaṇoḥ tattvataḥ nubhava rūpam eva tapaḥ tena pūtāḥ iti śrī rāmānuja ācārya caraṇāḥ
translated: The penance is the knowledge of the nature of my birth and deeds, which is in the form of direct experience, by which they were purified. Thus say the feet of Sri Ramanuja.

original: yad vā / jñāne majjanmakarmaṇor nityatvaniścayānubhave yannānākumatakutarkayuktisarpīviṣadāhasahanarūpaṃ tapas tena pūtāḥ /
analyzed: yat vā jñāne mad janma karmaṇoḥ nitya tva niścaya anubhave yat nānā kumata kutarka yukti sarpī viṣa dāha sahana rūpam tapaḥ tena pūtāḥ
translated: Or, the penance is the ability to bear the poison of the burning of the serpent of various wrong arguments and reasonings in the knowledge of the eternality of my birth and deeds, by which they were purified.

original: tathā ca śrīrāmānujadhṛtaśrutiḥ tasya dhīrāḥ parijānanti yoniṃ iti dhīrā dhīmanta eva tasya yoniṃ janmaprakāraṃ jānantīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: tathā ca śrī rāmānuja dhṛta śrutiḥ tasya dhīrāḥ parijānanti yonim iti dhīrāḥ dhīmantaḥ eva tasya yonim janma prakāram jānanti iti arthaḥ
translated: And thus the Shruti accepted by Sri Ramanuja says: The wise know His source. The meaning is that only the wise know the source, the mode of birth, of Him.

original: vītās tyaktāḥ kumataprajalpiteṣu janeṣu rāgādyā yais te na teṣu rāgaḥ prītir nāpi tebhyo bhayaṃ nāpi teṣu krodho madbhaktānām ity arthaḥ
analyzed: vītāḥ tyaktāḥ kumata prajalpiteṣu janeṣu rāga ādyāḥ yaiḥ te na teṣu rāgaḥ prītiḥ na api tebhyaḥ bhayam na api teṣu krodhaḥ mad bhaktānām iti arthaḥ
translated: Those who have abandoned attachment etc. towards people who speak wrongly, they have no attachment, no fear, and no anger towards them. This is the meaning of my devotees.

original: kuto manmayā majjanmakarmānudhyānamananaśravaṇakīrtanādipracurāḥ /
analyzed: kutas mad mayāḥ mad janma karma anudhyāna manana śravaṇa kīrtana ādi pracurāḥ
translated: How can they be full of thoughts, meditations, recitations, glorifications, etc. of My birth, activities, etc.?

original: madbhāvaṃ mayi premāṇam ////
analyzed: mad bhāvam mayi premāṇam
translated: The state of being Mine, i.e., love for Me, etc.

original: baladevaḥ / idānīm iva purāpi majjanmādinityatājñānena bahūnāṃ vimuktir abhūd iti tannityatāṃ draḍhayitum āha vīteti /
translated: Balarama: Now, in order to strengthen the eternality of Me by saying that just as now, in the past also, many people attained liberation by the knowledge of the eternality of My birth, etc., he says those who are free from attachment etc.

original: bahavo janā jñānatapasā pūtāḥ santaḥ purā madbhāvam āgatā ity anuṣaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: bahavaḥ janāḥ jñāna tapasā pūtāḥ santaḥ purā mad bhāvam āgatāḥ iti anuṣaṅgaḥ
translated: The continuation is: Many people, being purified by knowledge and austerity, have in the past attained the state of being Mine.

original: majjanmādinityatvaviṣayakaṃ yaj jñānaṃ tad eva duradhigamaśrutiyuktisampādyatvāt
analyzed: mad janma ādi nitya tva viṣayakam yat jñānam tat eva duradhigama śruti yukti sampādya tvāt
translated: That knowledge which has as its object the eternality of My birth, etc., is itself difficult to attain, being accomplished by scripture and reasoning.

original: tapas tasmin jñāne vā yad vividhakumatakutarkādinivāraṇarūpaṃ tapas tena pūtā
analyzed: tapaḥ tasmin jñāne vā yat vividha kumata kutarka ādi nivāraṇa rūpam tapaḥ tena pūtā
translated: Or, that austerity which is in the form of removing various wrong views and arguments etc. in that knowledge,

original: nirdhūtāvidyā ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: nirdhūta avidyāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: by that they are purified, the meaning is that ignorance is dispelled.

original: mayi bhāvaṃ premāṇaṃ vidyamānatāṃ vā matsākṣātkṛtim /
analyzed: mayi bhāvam premāṇam vidyamāna tām vā mad sākṣātkṛtim
translated: The state of being in Me, i.e., love for Me, or the realization of Me.

original: kīdṛśās te ity āha vīteti /
analyzed: kīdṛśāḥ te iti āha vīta iti
translated: What are they like? He says those who are free from attachment etc.

original: vītāḥ parityaktās tannityatvavirodhiṣu rāgādayo yais te /
analyzed: vītāḥ parityaktāḥ tad nitya tva virodhiṣu rāga ādayaḥ yaiḥ te
translated: Those by whom attachment etc. which are opposed to the eternality of that [knowledge] are abandoned,

original: na teṣu rāgaṃ na bhayaṃ na ca krodhaṃ prakāśayantīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: na teṣu rāgam na bhayam na ca krodham prakāśayanti iti arthaḥ
translated: the meaning is that they do not manifest attachment, fear, or anger towards them.

original: tatra hetuḥ manmayā madekaniṣṭhā upāśritāḥ saṃsevamānāḥ ////
analyzed: tatra hetuḥ mad mayāḥ mad ekaniṣṭhāḥ upāśritāḥ saṃsevamānāḥ
translated: The reason for that is: being devoted to Me, being solely intent on Me, having resorted to Me, serving Me.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: ye yathā māṃ prapadyante tāṃs tathaiva bhajāmy aham /
analyzed: ye yathā mām prapadyante tān tathā eva bhajāmi aham
translated: In whatever way people approach Me, in just that way I respond to them.

original: mama vartmānuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśaḥ ////
analyzed: mama vartma anuvartante manuṣyāḥ pārtha sarvaśas
translated: People everywhere follow My path, O son of Prtha.

original: śrīdharaḥ / nanu tarhi kiṃ tvayy api vaiṣamyam asti /
translated: Sridhar: Now, if that is so, then is there inequality in You?

original: yad evaṃ tvadekaśaraṇānām evātmābhāvaṃ dadāsi nānyeṣāṃ sakāmānām iti /
analyzed: yat evam tvad eka śaraṇānām eva ātma abhāvam dadāsi na anyeṣām sa kāmānām iti
translated: In that You give self-realization only to those who are solely devoted to You, not to others who have desires.

original: ata āha ya iti /
analyzed: atas āha yaḥ iti
translated: To that, He says: Yatha (in whatever way).

original: yathā yena prakāreṇa sakāmatayā niṣkāmatayā vā ye māṃ bhajante tān ahaṃ tathaiva tadapekṣitaphaladānena bhajāmi anugṛhṇāmi /
analyzed: yathā yena prakāreṇa sa kāma tayā niṣkāma tayā vā ye mām bhajante tān aham tathā eva tad apekṣita phala dānena bhajāmi anugṛhṇāmi
translated: In whatever way, with whatever attitude, whether with desires or without desires, people worship Me, I respond to them in just that way by giving the fruits they desire.

original: na tu sakāmā māṃ vihāyendrādīn eva ye bhajante tān aham upekṣa iti mantavyam /
analyzed: na tu sa kāmāḥ mām vihāya indra ādīn eva ye bhajante tān aham upekṣe iti mantavyam
translated: But it should not be thought that I ignore those who, having desires, worship Indra and others, abandoning Me.

original: yataḥ sarvaśaḥ sarvaprakārair indrādisevakā api mamaiva vartma bhajanamārgam anuvartante /
analyzed: yatas sarvaśas sarva prakāraiḥ indra ādi sevakāḥ api mama eva vartma bhajana mārgam anuvartante
translated: Because people everywhere, even those who serve Indra and others, follow My path, the path of worship.

original: indrādirūpeṇāpi mamaiva sevyatvāt ////
analyzed: indra ādi rūpeṇa api mama eva sevya tvāt
translated: Because even Indra and others are to be served only as forms of Me.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: nanu ye jñānatapasā pūtā niṣkāmās te tvadbhāvaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: nanu ye jñāna tapasā pūtāḥ niṣkāmāḥ te tvad bhāvam gacchanti
translated: Objection: Those who are purified by knowledge and austerity and are free from desires attain Your nature.

original: ye tv apūtāḥ sakāmās te na gacchantīti phaladātus tava vaiṣamyanairghṛṇye syātām iti nety āha ye yatheti /
analyzed: ye tu a pūtāḥ sa kāmāḥ te na gacchanti iti phala dātuḥ tava vaiṣamya nairghṛṇye syātām iti na iti āha ye yathā iti
translated: But those who are impure and have desires do not attain it. Thus, there would be inequality and cruelty in You, the bestower of fruits. Reply: No, as stated in the verse Those who...

original: ya ārtā arthārthino jijñāsavo jñāninaś ca yathā yena prakāreṇa sakāmatayā niṣkāmatayā
analyzed: ye ārtāḥ artha arthinaḥ jijñāsavaḥ jñāninaḥ ca yathā yena prakāreṇa sa kāma tayā niṣkāma tayā
translated: Those who are afflicted, seekers of wealth, inquirers, and knowers, in whatever way, by whatever means, with desires or without desires,

original: ca mām īśvaraṃ sarvaphaladātāraṃ prapadyante bhajanti tāṃs tathaiva tadapekṣitaphaladānenaiva
analyzed: ca mām īśvaram sarva phala dātāram prapadyante bhajanti tān tathā eva tad apekṣita phala dānena eva
translated: worship Me, the Lord, the bestower of all fruits, I serve them in the same way, by bestowing the fruits they desire,

original: bhajāmy anugṛhṇāmy ahaṃ na viparyayeṇa /
analyzed: bhajāmi anugṛhṇāmi aham na viparyayeṇa
translated: and not otherwise.

original: tatrāmumukṣūn ārtān arthārthinaś cārtiharaṇenārthadānena cānugṛhṇāmi /
analyzed: tatra amumukṣūn ārtān artha arthinaḥ ca ārti haraṇena artha dānena ca anugṛhṇāmi
translated: Among them, I serve those who are not desirous of liberation, the afflicted, and seekers of wealth, by removing their affliction and by bestowing wealth.

original: jiijñāsūn vividiṣanti yajñenety ādiśrutivihitaniṣkāmakarmānuṣṭhātṝn jñānadānena jñāninaś ca mumukṣūn mokṣadānena na tv anyakāmāyānyad
analyzed: jiijñāsūn vividiṣanti yajñena iti ādi śruti vihita niṣkāma karma anuṣṭhātṝn jñāna dānena jñāninaḥ ca mumukṣūn mokṣa dānena na tu anya kāmāya anyat  /
translated: I serve the inquirers, the performers of obligatory and optional rites enjoined by scriptures like They desire to know through sacrifice etc., by bestowing knowledge, and the knowers who are desirous of liberation, by bestowing liberation, but not by giving something else to one who desires something else.

original: dadāmīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: dadāmi iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: nanu tathāpi svabhaktānām eva phalaṃ dadāsi na tv anyadevabhaktānām iti vaiṣamyaṃ
analyzed: nanu tathā api sva bhaktānām eva phalam dadāsi na tu anya deva bhaktānām iti vaiṣamyam
translated: Objection: Even so, You bestow fruits only on Your devotees, not on the devotees of other gods. Thus, there is inequality.

original: sthitam eveti nety āha mama sarvātmano vāsudevasya vartma bhajanamārgaṃ karmajñānalakṣaṇam
analyzed: sthitam eva iti na iti āha mama sarvātmanaḥ vāsudevasya vartma bhajana mārgam karma jñāna lakṣaṇam
translated: He says, No, they follow the path of Me, Vasudeva, the All-pervading Self, which is characterized by action and knowledge.

original: anuvartante he pārtha sarvajñaḥ sarvaprakārair indrādīn apy anuvartamānā manuṣyā
analyzed: anuvartante he pārtha sarva jñaḥ sarva prakāraiḥ indra ādīn api anuvartamānāḥ manuṣyāḥ
translated: O Partha, all men, even Indra and others, follow it in all ways.

original: iti karmādhikāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: iti karma adhikāriṇaḥ
translated: Thus, they are entitled to perform actions.

original: indraṃ mitraṃ varuṇam agnim āhuḥ ity ādimantravarṇāt phalam ata upapatteḥ Vs / / / iti nyāyāc ca sarvarūpeṇāpi phaladātā bhagavān eka
analyzed: indram mitram varuṇam agnim āhuḥ iti ādi mantra varṇāt phalam atas upapatteḥ iti nyāyāt ca sarva rūpeṇa api phala dātā bhagavān
translated: And by the reasoning that the result is inferred from the mantra beginning with 'Indra, Mitra, Varuna, Agni' and so on, and by the principle that 'the result is inferred from the means', the Lord is the giver of results in all forms.

original: evety arthaḥ /
analyzed: eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that He is the only one.

original: tathā ca vakṣyati ye 'py anyadevatābhaktā Gītā / ity ādi ////
analyzed: tathā ca vakṣyati ye pi anya devatā bhaktāḥ gītāḥ iti ādi
translated: And thus He will say, Those who are devotees of other gods (11.45), and so on.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: nanu tvadekāntabhaktāḥ kilatajjanmakarmaṇor nityatvaṃ manyanta eva /
analyzed: nanu tvad ekānta bhaktāḥ kila tad janma karmaṇoḥ nitya tvam manyante eva
translated: Well, indeed, the devotees solely devoted to You consider the birth and actions of the Lord to be eternal.

original: kecit tu jñānādisiddhyarthaṃ tvāṃ prapannā jñāniprabhṛtayas tvajjanmakarmaṇor nityatvaṃ nāpi manyanta iti tatrāha ya iti /
analyzed: kecid tu jñāna ādi siddhi artham tvām prapannāḥ jñāni prabhṛtayaḥ tvad janma karmaṇoḥ nitya tvam na api manyante iti tatra āha ye iti
translated: But some who have resorted to You for the attainment of knowledge and so on, the knowers and others, do not even consider the birth and actions of the Lord to be eternal. There, He says ya (whoever).

original: yathā yena prakāreṇa māṃ prapadyante bhajante aham api tāṃs tenaiva prakāreṇa bhajāmi /
analyzed: yathā yena prakāreṇa mām prapadyante bhajante aham api tān tena eva prakāreṇa bhajāmi
translated: In whatever way, by whatever means, they resort to, worship Me, I also worship them in that very same way.

original: bhajanaphalaṃ dadāmi /
analyzed: bhajana phalam dadāmi
translated: I grant the fruit of devotion.

original: ayam arthaḥ ye matprabhor janmakarmaṇī nitye eveti manasi kurvāṇās tattallīlāyām
analyzed: ayam arthaḥ ye mad prabhoḥ janma karmaṇī nitye eva iti manasi kurvāṇāḥ tad tad līlāyām
translated: This is the meaning: Those who keep in mind that my Lord's birth and deeds are eternal,

original: eva kṛtamanorathaviśeṣā māṃ bhajantaḥ sukhayanty aham apīśvaratvāt kartum akartum
analyzed: eva kṛta manoratha viśeṣāḥ mām bhajantaḥ sukhayanti aham api īśvara tvāt kartum a kartum
translated: and who, having special desires in those pastimes, worship Me, please Me, and I, being God, am able to create, destroy,

original: anyathā kartum api samarthas teṣām api janmakarmaṇor nityatvaṃ kartuṃ tān svapārṣadīkṛtya
analyzed: anyathā kartum api samarthaḥ teṣām api janma karmaṇoḥ nitya tvam kartum tān sva pārṣadīkṛtya
translated: and do otherwise, in order to make their birth and deeds eternal, having made them My devotees,

original: taiḥ sārdham eva yathāsamayam avatarann antar dadhānaś ca tān pratikṣaṇam anugṛhṇann
analyzed: taiḥ sārdham eva yathāsamayam avataran antar dadhānaḥ ca tān pratikṣaṇam anugṛhṇan
translated: and descending and disappearing at the proper time along with them, and constantly blessing them,

original: eva tadbhajanaphalaṃ premāṇam eva dadāmi /
analyzed: eva tad bhajana phalam premāṇam eva dadāmi
translated: I grant them the fruit of their devotion, which is love alone.

original: ye jñāniprabhṛtayo majjanmakarmaṇor naśvaratvaṃ madvigrahasya māyāmayatvaṃ ca
analyzed: ye jñāni prabhṛtayaḥ mad janma karmaṇoḥ naśvara tvam mad vigrahasya māyā maya tvam ca
translated: Those who, as knowers of reality and others, consider my birth and deeds to be perishable, and my form to be illusory,

original: manyamānā māṃ prapadyante aham api tān punaḥ punar naśvarajanmakarmavato māyāpāśapatitān
analyzed: manyamānāḥ mām prapadyante aham api tān punar punar naśvara janma karmavataḥ māyā pāśa patitān
translated: and who take refuge in Me, I also repeatedly make them have perishable birth and deeds, and fallen into the noose of illusion,

original: eva kurvāṇas tatpratiphalaṃ janmamṛtyuduḥkham eva dadāmi /
analyzed: eva kurvāṇaḥ tad pratiphalam janma mṛtyu duḥkham eva dadāmi
translated: and giving them the fruit of that, I give them birth, death, and suffering.

original: ye tu majjanmakarmaṇor nityatvaṃ madvigrahasya ca saccidānandatvaṃ manyamānā jñāninaḥ svajñānasiddhyarthaṃ māṃ🔽prapadyante /
analyzed: ye tu mad janma karmaṇoḥ nitya tvam mad vigrahasya ca saccidānanda tvam manyamānāḥ jñāninaḥ sva jñāna siddhi artham mām  prapadyante
translated: for the accomplishment of their own knowledge,

original: teṣāṃ svadehadvayabhaṅgam evecchatāṃ mumukṣūṇām anaśvaraṃ brahmānandam eva sampādayan bhajanaphalam āvidyakajanmamṛtyudhvaṃsam eva dadāmi
analyzed: teṣām sva deha dvaya bhaṅgam eva icchatām mumukṣūṇām anaśvaram brahma ānandam eva sampādayan bhajana phalam āvidyaka janma mṛtyu dhvaṃsam eva dadāmi
translated: for them, who desire liberation and wish only for the destruction of the two bodies, I grant the fruit of devotion, which is the destruction of ignorance, birth and death, and the accomplishment of the imperishable bliss of Brahman itself.

original: tasmān na kevalaṃ madbhaktā eva māṃ prapadyante /
analyzed: tasmāt na kevalam mad bhaktāḥ eva mām prapadyante
translated: Therefore, not only my devotees resort to me.

original: api tu sarvaśaḥ sarve 'pi manuṣyā jñāninaḥ karmiṇo yoginaś ca devatāntaropāsakāś
analyzed: api tu sarvaśas sarve pi manuṣyāḥ jñāninaḥ karmiṇaḥ yoginaḥ ca devatā antara upāsakāḥ
translated: But all human beings, the wise, the performers of actions, the yogis, and the worshippers of other deities

original: ca mama vartmānuvartante mama sarvasvarūpatvāt jñānakarmādikaṃ sarvaṃ māmakam eva🔽vartmeti bhāvaḥ // //
analyzed: ca mama vartma anuvartante mama sarva sva rūpa tvāt jñāna karma ādikam sarvam māmakam eva  vartma iti bhāvaḥ
translated: follow my path, because I am the all-in-all. The idea is that knowledge, action, etc. are all my own path.

original: baladevaḥ / nanu nityajanmādimanojñaḥ sarveśvaras tvaṃ mayāvagatakvacittvaṅguṣṭhamātrādir apīśvaro janmādiśūnyaḥ śrūyate /
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu nitya janma ādi manojñaḥ sarva īśvaraḥ tvam mayā avagata kvacid tu aṅguṣṭha mātra ādiḥ api īśvaraḥ janma ādi śūnyaḥ śrūyate
translated: Balarama: Now, if it is asked: But I have understood that you are the Lord of all, delightful with eternal birth, etc., while in some places an Ishvara of the size of a thumb, etc. is heard to be devoid of birth, etc.

original: tat kiṃ tava tvadupāsanasya ca vaividhyaṃ bhaved iti ced om ity āha ye yatheti /
analyzed: tat kim tava tvad upāsanasya ca vaividhyam bhavet iti ced om iti āha ye yathā iti
translated: So, is there diversity in you and in your worship? To this, he says Om. Those who are of such and such nature, etc.

original: ye bhaktā mām ekaṃ vaidūryam iva bahurūpaṃ sarveśvaraṃ yathā yena prakāreṇa bhāveneti yāvat prapadyante bhajanti /
analyzed: ye bhaktāḥ mām ekam vaidūryam iva bahu rūpam sarveśvaram yathā yena prakāreṇa bhāvena iti yāvat prapadyante bhajanti
translated: Those who, with devotion of such a kind, i.e. in such a manner, worship Me alone, the one who is of many forms like a lapis lazuli, the Lord of all.

original: tān ahaṃ tādṛśas tathaiva tadbhāvānusāriṇā rūpeṇa bhāvena ca bhajāmi sākṣāt bhavann anugṛhṇāmi /
analyzed: tān aham tādṛśaḥ tathā eva tad bhāva anusāriṇā rūpeṇa bhāvena ca bhajāmi sākṣāt bhavan anugṛhṇāmi
translated: I too, in a form and with a devotion that accords with their devotion, worship them, i.e. becoming manifest, I bless them.

original: nūnatām evakāro nivartayati /
analyzed: nūna tām evakāraḥ nivartayati
translated: The word indeed excludes any other possibility.

original: ato mamaikasyaiva bahurūpasya vartmabahuvidham upāsanamārgam anādipravṛttatadupāsakaparamparānukampitā manuṣyāḥ sarve 'nuvartante anusaranti
analyzed: atas mama ekasya eva bahurūpasya vartma bahuvidham upāsana mārgam anādi pravṛtta tad upāsaka paramparā anukampitāḥ manuṣyāḥ sarve nuvartante anusaranti
translated: Therefore, all men, who are favored by the unbroken line of devotees of that (devotion) that has been going on since beginningless time, follow, i.e. follow, the many paths of devotion of Me alone, who is of many forms.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: kāṅkṣantaḥ karmaṇāṃ siddhiṃ yajanta iha devatāḥ /
analyzed: kāṅkṣantaḥ karmaṇām siddhim yajantaḥ iha devatāḥ
translated: Desiring the perfection of actions, they worship the gods here.

original: kṣipraṃ hi mānuṣe loke siddhir bhavati karmajā ////
analyzed: kṣipram hi mānuṣe loke siddhiḥ bhavati karma jā
translated: For in the human world, perfection arises quickly from action.

original: śrīdharaḥ / tarhi mokṣārtham eva kim iti sarve tvāṃ na bhajantīti /
translated: Sridhar: Then why is it that everyone does not worship You alone for the sake of liberation?

original: ata āha kāṅkṣanta iti /
analyzed: atas āha kāṅkṣante iti
translated: To this He says desiring etc.

original: karmaṇāṃ siddhiṃ karmaphalaṃ kāṅkṣantaḥ prāyeneha mānuṣyaloke indrādidevatā eva yajante /
analyzed: karmaṇām siddhim karma phalam kāṅkṣantaḥ prāyena iha mānuṣya loke indra ādi devatāḥ eva yajante
translated: Desiring the perfection of actions, i.e. the fruits of actions, they mostly worship the gods such as Indra here in the human world.

original: na tu sākṣān mām eva /
analyzed: na tu sākṣāt mām eva
translated: But not Me alone directly.

original: hi yasmāt karmajā siddhiḥ karmajaṃ phalaṃ śīghraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: hi yasmāt karma jā siddhiḥ karma jam phalam śīghram bhavati
translated: For, from action, success comes; the fruit of action comes quickly.

original: na tu jñānaphalaṃ kaivalyaṃ /
analyzed: na tu jñāna phalam kaivalyam
translated: But not so the fruit of knowledge, which is Liberation.

original: duṣprāpyatvāj jñānasya ////
analyzed: duṣprāpya tvāt jñānasya
translated: Because knowledge is difficult to attain.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: nanu tvām eva bhagavantaṃ vāsudevaṃ kim iti sarve na prapadyanta iti tatrāha kāṅkṣanta iti /
analyzed: nanu tvām eva bhagavantam vāsudevam kim iti sarve na prapadyante iti tatra āha kāṅkṣantaḥ iti
translated: Now, why do not all men resort to you, O Lord Vasudeva? In reply to this, the Lord says: 'They who desire' etc.

original: karmaṇāṃ siddhiṃ phalaniṣpattiṃ kāṅkṣanta iha loke devatā devān indrāgnyādyān yajante pūjayanti ajñānapratihatatvān na tu niṣkāmāḥ santo
analyzed: karmaṇām siddhim phala niṣpattim kāṅkṣantaḥ iha loke devatāḥ devān indra agni ādyān yajante pūjayanti ajñāna pratihata tvāt na tu niṣkāmāḥ santaḥ
translated: They who desire the success, the accomplishment, of their actions, the attainment of their fruits, in this world, worship, adore, the gods, Indra, Agni and others, in this world, not being free from ignorance, not being free from desires.

original: māṃ bhagavantaṃ vāsudevam iti śeṣaḥ /
analyzed: mām bhagavantam vāsudevam iti śeṣaḥ
translated: Not me, the Lord Vasudeva, is to be understood.

original: kasmāt / hi yasmād indrādidevatāyājināṃ tatphalakāṅkṣiṇāṃ karmajā siddhiḥ karmajanyaṃ phalaṃ kṣipraṃ śīghram eva bhavati mānuṣe loke /
analyzed: kasmāt hi yasmāt indra ādi devatā yājinām tad phala kāṅkṣiṇām karma jā siddhiḥ karma janyam phalam kṣipram śīghram eva bhavati mānuṣe loke
translated: Why? For, from action, success comes; the fruit born of action comes quickly, soon, in the human world, to those who worship the gods Indra and others, and desire their fruits.

original: jñānaphalaṃ tv antaḥkaraṇaśuddhisāpekṣatvān na kṣipraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: jñāna phalam tu antaḥkaraṇa śuddhi sāpekṣa tvāt na kṣipram bhavati
translated: But the fruit of knowledge does not come quickly, because it depends on the purification of the internal organ.

original: mānuṣe loke karmaphalaṃ śīghraṃ bhavatīti viśeṣaṇād anyaloke 'pi varṇāśramadharmavyatiriktakarmaphalasiddhir bhagavatā sūcitā /
analyzed: mānuṣe loke karma phalam śīghram bhavati iti viśeṣaṇāt anya loke varṇa āśrama dharma vyatirikta karma phala siddhiḥ bhagavatā sūcitā
translated: The Lord has indicated by the word 'quickly' that the result of action is quick in the human world, that the result of action other than that of the duties of caste and life-stage is also possible in other worlds.

original: yatas tat tat kṣudraphalasiddhyarthaṃ sakāmā mokṣavimukhā anyā devatā yajante 'to na mumukṣava iva māṃ vāsudevaṃ sākṣāt te prapadyanta
analyzed: yatas tat tat kṣudra phala siddhi artham sa kāmāḥ mokṣa vimukhāḥ anyāḥ devatāḥ yajante na mumukṣavaḥ iva mām vāsudevam sākṣāt te prapadyanta
translated: Since they, for the sake of attaining that and that small result, worship other deities, being desirous and averse to liberation, therefore, they do not resort to Me, Vasudeva, directly, as do the seekers of liberation.

original: ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: tatrāpi manuṣyeṣu madhye kāminas tu mama sākṣādbhūtam api bhaktimārgaṃ parihāya śīghraphalasādhakaṃ karmavartmaivānuvartanta ity āha kāṅkṣanta 🔽iti /
analyzed: tatra api manuṣyeṣu madhye kāminaḥ tu mama sākṣāt bhūtam api bhakti mārgam parihāya śīghra phala sādhakam karma vartma eva anuvartante iti āha kāṅkṣanta  iti
translated: Among them, even among humans, the lovers of enjoyment, abandoning even the path of devotion to Me, which is directly manifest, follow only the path of action, which brings quick results. Thus the Lord says, 'They desire...'

original: karmajā siddhiḥ svargādimayī ////
analyzed: karma jā siddhiḥ svarga ādi mayī
translated: The result of action is heaven and so on.

original: baladevaḥ / evaṃ prāsaṅgikaṃ procya prakṛtasya niṣkāmakarmaṇo jñānākāratvaṃ vadiṣyaṃs tad anuṣṭhātuṃ viralatvam āha kāṅkṣanta iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam prāsaṅgikam procya prakṛtasya niṣkāma karmaṇaḥ jñāna ākāra tvam vadiṣyan tat anuṣṭhātum virala tvam āha kāṅkṣantaḥ iti
translated: Baladeva: Having spoken thus incidentally, in order to say that the subject under discussion, namely, action without desire, is of the nature of knowledge, He says that it is rare to practice it, with the words 'They desire...'

original: iha loke 'nādibhogavāsanāniyantritāḥ prāṇinaḥ karmaṇāṃ siddhiṃ paśuputrādiphalaniṣpattiṃ
analyzed: iha loke na ādi bhoga vāsanā niyantritāḥ prāṇinaḥ karmaṇām siddhim paśu putra ādi phala niṣpattim
translated: In this world, beings are controlled by the impressions of enjoyment from beginningless time. They desire the result of actions, the attainment of the fruits of animals, sons, etc.

original: kāṅkṣanto 'nityālpadān apīndrādidevān yajante sakāmaiḥ karmabhir na tu sarvadeveśvaraṃ
analyzed: kāṅkṣantaḥ nitya alpa dān api indra ādi devān yajante sa kāmaiḥ karmabhiḥ na tu sarva deva īśvaram
translated: Desiring even the impermanent and limited fruits of Indra and other gods, they worship them with actions motivated by desire, but not me, the Lord of all gods,

original: nityānandaphalapradam api māṃ niṣkāmais tair yajante /
analyzed: nitya ānanda phala pradam api mām niṣkāmaiḥ taiḥ yajante
translated: who bestows the fruit of eternal bliss, with actions free from desire.

original: hi yasmād asmin mānuṣe loke karmajā siddhiḥ kṣipraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: hi yasmāt asmin mānuṣe loke karma jā siddhiḥ kṣipram bhavati
translated: For in this human world, success born of action comes quickly.

original: niṣkāmakarmārādhitān matto jñānato mokṣalakṣaṇā siddhis tu cireṇaiva bhavatīti /
analyzed: niṣkāma karma ārādhitāt mattaḥ jñānataḥ mokṣa lakṣaṇā siddhiḥ tu cireṇa eva bhavati iti
translated: But success in the form of liberation, which is attained through knowledge of me, who am pleased by actions free from desire, comes only after a long time.

original: sarve lokā bhogavāsanāgrastasadasadvivekāḥ śīghrabhogecchavas tadarthaṃ madbhṛtyān devān bhajanti /
analyzed: sarve lokāḥ bhoga vāsanā grasta sat asat vivekāḥ śīghra bhoga icchavaḥ tad artham mad bhṛtyān devān bhajanti
translated: All people, their discrimination between right and wrong overwhelmed by the desire for enjoyment, desire quick enjoyment and worship for that purpose the gods who are my servants.

original: na tu kaścit sadasadvivekī saṃsāraduḥkhavitrastaduḥkhanivṛttaye niṣkāmakarmabhiḥ sarvadeveśaṃ māṃ
analyzed: na tu kaścid sat asat vivekī saṃsāra duḥkha vitrasta duḥkha nivṛttaye niṣkāma karmabhiḥ sarva deva īśam mām
translated: But no one, discriminating between right and wrong, frightened by the suffering of worldly existence, worships me, the Lord of all gods, with actions free from desire for the cessation of that suffering.

original: bhajatīti viralas tadadhikārīti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: bhajati iti viralaḥ tad adhikārī iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that he is rare, qualified for that.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: cāturvarṇyaṃ mayā sṛṣṭaṃ guṇakarmavibhāgaśaḥ /
analyzed: cāturvarṇyam mayā sṛṣṭam guṇa karma vibhāgaśaḥ
translated: The four castes have been created by me according to the division of gunas and actions.

original: tasya kartāram api māṃ viddhy akartāram avyayam ////
analyzed: tasya kartāram api mām viddhi akartāram avyayam
translated: Know me to be the creator of that also, but to be the imperishable non-creator.

original: śrīdharaḥ / nanu kecit sakāmatayā pravartante /
translated: Sridhar: Well, some people engage in actions with desire.

original: kecit niṣkāmatayā iti karmavaicitryam /
analyzed: kecid niṣkāma tayā iti karma vaicitryam
translated: Some, due to being disinterested, thus there is variety in actions.

original: tatkartṛṇā ca brāhmaṇādīnām uttamamadhyamādivaicitryaṃ kurvatas tava kathaṃ vaiṣamyaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: tad kartṛṇā ca brāhmaṇa ādīnām uttama madhyama ādi vaicitryam kurvataḥ tava katham vaiṣamyam nā asti
translated: And since You, the doer of that, create the variety of Brahmins etc. as superior, middling etc., how is it that there is no inequality for You?

original: ity āśaṅkyāha cāturvarṇyam iti /
analyzed: iti āśaṅkya āha cāturvarṇyam iti
translated: Thinking thus, He says, The four varnas etc.

original: catvāro varṇā eveti cāturvarṇyaṃ svārthe ṣyañpratyayaḥ /
analyzed: catvāraḥ varṇāḥ eva iti cāturvarṇyam svārthe
translated: The four varnas themselves are the four varnas. The suffix ṣyañ is used in its own sense.

original: ayam arthaḥ sattvapradhānā brāhmaṇās teṣāṃ śamadamādīni karmāṇi /
analyzed: ayam arthaḥ sattva pradhānāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ teṣām śama dama ādīni karmāṇi
translated: The meaning is: Brahmins are predominantly sattva. Their actions are tranquility, self-control etc.

original: sattva rajaḥpradhānāḥ kṣatriyās teṣāṃ śauryayuddhādīni karmāṇi /
analyzed: sattva rajaḥ pradhānāḥ kṣatriyāḥ teṣām śaurya yuddha ādīni karmāṇi
translated: Kshatriyas are predominantly sattva and rajas. Their actions are heroism, fighting etc.

original: rajas tamaḥpradhānā vaiśyās teṣāṃ kṛṣivāṇijyādīni karmāṇi /
analyzed: rajaḥ tamaḥ pradhānāḥ vaiśyāḥ teṣām kṛṣi vāṇijya ādīni karmāṇi
translated: Vaishyas are predominantly rajas and tamas. Their actions are agriculture, trade etc.

original: tamaḥpradhānāḥ śūdrās teṣāṃ traivarṇikaśuśrūṣādīni karmāṇi /
analyzed: tamaḥ pradhānāḥ śūdrāḥ teṣām traivarṇika śuśrūṣā ādīni karmāṇi
translated: Shudras are predominantly tamas. Their actions are service to the three varnas etc.

original: ity evaṃ guṇānāṃ karmaṇāṃ ca vibhāgaiś cāturvarṇyaṃ mayaiva sṛṣṭam iti satyam /
analyzed: iti evam guṇānām karmaṇām ca vibhāgaiḥ cāturvarṇyam mayā eva sṛṣṭam iti satyam
translated: Thus, the four varnas have been created by Me through the divisions of qualities and actions. This is true.

original: tathāpy evaṃ tasya kartāram api phalato 'kartāram eva māṃ viddhi /
analyzed: tathā api evam tasya kartāram api kartāram eva mām viddhi
translated: Nevertheless, know that I am the doer of that, but not the doer in terms of the result.

original: tatra hetuḥ avyayam
analyzed: tatra hetuḥ avyayam
translated: The reason for that is imperishable

original: āsaktirāhityena śramarahitaṃ nāśādirahitaṃ vā ////
analyzed: āsakti rāhityena śrama rahitam nāśa ādi rahitam vā
translated: Free from attachment, free from effort, free from destruction etc.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: śarīrārambhakaguṇavaiṣamyād api na sarve samānasvabhāvā ity āha cāturvarṇyam iti /
analyzed: śarīra ārambhaka guṇa vaiṣamyāt api na sarve samāna svabhāvāḥ iti āha cāturvarṇyam iti
translated: Even due to the inequality of the qualities that form the body, not all have the same nature. He says: The four castes.

original: catvāro varṇā eva cāturvarṇyaṃ svārthe ṣyañ /
analyzed: catvāraḥ varṇāḥ eva cāturvarṇyam svārthe ṣyam
translated: The four castes themselves are the four castes, with the suffix ṣya in the sense of one's own.

original: mayeśvareṇa sṛṣṭam utpāditaṃ guṇakarmavibhāgaśo guṇavibhāgaśaḥ karmavibhāgaśaś ca /
analyzed: mayā īśvareṇa sṛṣṭam utpāditam guṇa karma vibhāgaśaḥ guṇa vibhāgaśaḥ karma vibhāgaśaḥ ca
translated: Created by the God of inequality, produced by the division of qualities and the division of actions, by the division of qualities and the division of actions.

original: tathā hi sattvapradhānā brāhmaṇās teṣāṃ ca sāttvikāni śamadamādīni karmāṇi /
analyzed: tathā hi sattva pradhānāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ teṣām ca sāttvikāni śama dama ādīni karmāṇi
translated: For thus, Brahmins are dominated by sattva, and their actions are of the sattva type, such as tranquility, self-control, etc.

original: sattvopasarjanarajaḥpradhānāḥ kṣatriyās teṣāṃ ca tādṛśāni śauryatejaḥprabhṛtīni karmāṇi /
analyzed: sattva upasarjana rajaḥ pradhānāḥ kṣatriyāḥ teṣām ca tādṛśāni śaurya tejaḥ prabhṛtīni karmāṇi
translated: Kshatriyas are dominated by rajas, with sattva as a subordinate, and their actions are of that type, such as heroism, splendor, etc.

original: tamaupasarjanarajaḥpradhānā vaiśyās teṣāṃ ca kṛṣyādīni tādṛśāni karmāṇi /
analyzed: tama aupasarjana rajaḥ pradhānāḥ vaiśyāḥ teṣām ca kṛṣi ādīni tādṛśāni karmāṇi
translated: Vaishyas are dominated by rajas, with tamas as a subordinate, and their actions are of that type, such as agriculture, etc.

original: tamaḥpradhānāḥ śūdrās teṣāṃ ca tāmasāni traivarṇikaśuśrūṣādīni karmāṇīti mānuṣe loke vyavasthitāni /
analyzed: tamaḥ pradhānāḥ śūdrāḥ teṣām ca tāmasāni traivarṇika śuśrūṣā ādīni karmāṇi iti mānuṣe loke vyavasthitāni
translated: Shudras are dominated by tamas, and their actions are of the tamas type, such as serving the three higher castes, etc. Thus they are established in the human world.

original: evaṃ tarhi viṣamasvabhāvacāturvarṇyasraṣṭṛtena tava vaiṣamyaṃ durvāram ity āśaṅkya
analyzed: evam tarhi viṣama svabhāva cāturvarṇya sraṣṭṛ tena tava vaiṣamyam durvāram iti āśaṅkya
translated: If so, then the inequality of creating the four castes of unequal nature is unavoidable for you. Anticipating this,

original: nety āha tasya viṣamasvabhāvasya cāturvarṇyasya vyavahāradṛṣṭyā kartāram api māṃ
analyzed: na iti āha tasya viṣama svabhāvasya cāturvarṇyasya vyavahāra dṛṣṭyā kartāram api mām
translated: No, he says. I am the creator of that four-varṇa system, which has an unequal nature, from the perspective of worldly transactions.

original: paramārthadṛṣṭyā viddhy akartāram avyayaṃ nirahaṅkāratvenākṣīṇamahimānam // //
analyzed: paramārtha dṛṣṭyā viddhi akartāram avyayam nirahaṅkāra tvena akṣīṇa mahimānam
translated: But from the perspective of ultimate truth, know Me to be the non-creator, the imperishable one, whose glory is undiminished due to being devoid of ego.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: nanu bhaktijñānamārgau mocakau /
analyzed: nanu bhakti jñāna mārgau mocakau
translated: Now, devotion and knowledge are the liberators.

original: karmamārgas tu bandhaka iti sarvamārgasraṣṭari tvayi parameśvare vaiṣamyaṃ prasaktam /
analyzed: karma mārgaḥ tu bandhakaḥ iti sarva mārga sraṣṭari tvayi parameśvare vaiṣamyam prasaktam
translated: But the path of action is the binder. Thus, inconsistency is implied in You, the Supreme Lord, the creator of all paths.

original: tatra nahi nahīty āha cāturvarṇyam iti /
analyzed: tatra nahi nahi iti āha cāturvarṇyam iti
translated: To that, he says no, no with the four-varṇa system.

original: catvāro varṇā eva cāturvarṇyam /
analyzed: catvāraḥ varṇāḥ eva cāturvarṇyam
translated: The four varnas themselves are the four-varṇa system.

original: svārthe ṣyañ /
analyzed: svārthe ṣyam
translated: The suffix ṣya is used in the sense of the object.

original: atra sattvapradhānā brāhmaṇās teṣāṃ śamadamādīni karmāṇi /
analyzed: atra sattva pradhānāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ teṣām śama dama ādīni karmāṇi
translated: Here, the Brahmins are dominated by sattva. Their duties are tranquility, self-control, etc.

original: rajaḥsattvapradhānāḥ kṣatriyās teṣāṃ śauryayuddhādīni karmāṇi /
analyzed: rajaḥ sattva pradhānāḥ kṣatriyāḥ teṣām śaurya yuddha ādīni karmāṇi
translated: The Kshatriyas are dominated by rajas and sattva. Their duties are heroism, warfare, etc.

original: tamorajaḥpradhānā vaiśyās teṣāṃ kṛṣigorakṣādīni karmāṇi /
analyzed: tamaḥ rajaḥ pradhānāḥ vaiśyāḥ teṣām kṛṣi gorakṣa ādīni karmāṇi
translated: The Vaishyas are dominated by tamas and rajas. Their duties are agriculture, cattle herding, etc.

original: tamaḥpradhānāḥ śūdrās teṣāṃ paricaryātmakaṃ karmety evaṃ guṇakarmavibhāgaśo guṇānāṃ karmaṇāṃ ca vibhāgaiś catvāro varṇā mayā dharmamārgāśritatvena 🔽sṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: tamaḥ pradhānāḥ śūdrāḥ teṣām paricaryā ātmakam karma iti evam guṇa karma vibhāgaśas guṇānām karmaṇām ca vibhāgaiḥ catvāraḥ varṇāḥ mayā dharma mārga āśrita tvena  sṛṣṭāḥ
translated: The Sudras, who are dominated by the quality of darkness, have duties consisting of service. Thus, by the divisions of the qualities and duties, the four castes have been created by Me as being based on the path of righteousness.

original: kintu teṣāṃ kartāraṃ sraṣṭāram api mām akartāram asraṣṭāram eva viddhi /
analyzed: kintu teṣām kartāram sraṣṭāram api mām a kartāram a sraṣṭāram eva viddhi
translated: But know Me to be the doer, the creator, yet also the non-doer, the non-creator.

original: teṣāṃ prakṛtiguṇasṛṣṭatvāt prakṛteś🔽ca macchaktitvāt /
analyzed: teṣām prakṛti guṇa sṛṣṭa tvāt prakṛteḥ  ca mad śakti tvāt
translated: Because they are created by the qualities of Nature, and because Nature is🔽My power.

original: sraṣṭāram api māṃ vastutas tv asraṣṭāram /
analyzed: sraṣṭāram api mām vastutas tu a sraṣṭāram
translated: Although I am the creator, in reality I am the non-creator.

original: mama prakṛtiguṇātītasvarūpatvād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: mama prakṛti guṇa atīta svarūpa tvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that My nature is beyond the qualities of Nature.

original: ataevāvyayam /
analyzed: atas eva avyayam
translated: And for that very reason, I am immutable.

original: sraṣṭṛtve 'pi na sāmyaṃ kiṃcid evety arthaḥ ////
analyzed: sraṣṭṛ tve pi na sāmyam kiṃcid eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that even in creation, there is no similarity whatsoever.

original: baladevaḥ / atha niṣkāmakarmānuṣṭhānavirodhibhogavāsanāvināśahetum āha cāturvarṇyam iti dvābhyām /
analyzed: baladevaḥ atha niṣkāma karma anuṣṭhāna virodhi bhoga vāsanā vināśa hetum āha cāturvarṇyam iti dvābhyām
translated: [Baladeva Vidyabhusana:] Now, to state the cause for the destruction of the latent impressions of enjoyment, which are contrary to the performance of selfless actions, [the Lord] says with two [verses] beginning with 'The four castes'.

original: catvāro varṇāś cāturvarṇyaṃ svārthikaḥ ṣyañ /🔽sattvapradhānāḥ viprās teṣāṃ śamādīni karmāṇi /
analyzed: catvāraḥ varṇāḥ cāturvarṇyam svārthikaḥ  sattva pradhānāḥ viprāḥ teṣām śama ādīni karmāṇi
translated: The four castes is [derived] from the word 'varṇa' with the suffix 'kya' added to express the meaning of the word itself.🔽The Brahmins, who are dominated by the quality of goodness, have duties such as tranquility.

original: rajaḥsattvapradhānāḥ kṣatriyās teṣāṃ yuddhādīni /
analyzed: rajaḥ sattva pradhānāḥ kṣatriyāḥ teṣām yuddha ādīni
translated: The Kshatriyas, who are dominated by passion and goodness, have duties such as warfare.

original: tamorajaḥpradhānā vaiśyās teṣāṃ kṛṣyādīni /
analyzed: tamaḥ rajaḥ pradhānāḥ vaiśyāḥ teṣām kṛṣi ādīni
translated: The Vaisyas, who are predominantly of the nature of Tamas and Rajas, have agriculture etc.

original: tamaḥpradhānāḥ śūdrās teṣāṃ viprāditrikaparicaryādīnīti guṇavibhāgaiḥ karmavibhāgaiś ca vibhaktāś catvāro varṇāḥ sarveśvareṇa mayā sṛṣṭāḥ
analyzed: tamaḥ pradhānāḥ śūdrāḥ teṣām vipra ādi trika paricaryā ādīni iti guṇa vibhāgaiḥ karma vibhāgaiḥ ca vibhaktāḥ catvāraḥ varṇāḥ sarveśvareṇa mayā sṛṣṭāḥ  /
translated: The Sudras, who are predominantly of the nature of Tamas, have the service of the three higher castes etc. Thus, the four castes have been created by Me, the Lord of all, as divided by the divisions of qualities and the divisions of duties.

original: sthitisaṃhṛtyor upalakṣaṇam etat /
analyzed: sthiti saṃhṛtyoḥ upalakṣaṇam etat
translated: This is an indication of the creation and dissolution (of the universe).

original: brahmādistambāntasya prapañcasyāham eva sargādikarteti /
