analyzed: brahma ādi stamba antasya prapañcasya aham eva sarga ādi kartā iti
translated: I alone am the creator of the universe from Brahma down to a blade of grass.

original: yad āha sūtrakāraḥ janmādy asya yataḥ Vs / / iti /
analyzed: yat āha sūtrakāraḥ janma ādi asya yatas iti
translated: As the author of the aphorisms says: The origin etc. of this (universe) is from Him (VsS 1.1.1).

original: tasya sargādeḥ kartāram api māṃ tat tat karmāntaritatvād akartāraṃ viddhīti svasmin vaiṣamyādikaṃ parihṛtam
analyzed: tasya sarga ādeḥ kartāram api mām tat tat karma antarita tvāt akartāram viddhi iti svasmin vaiṣamya ādikam parihṛtam
translated: Know Me as the creator of that creation etc., but as not the creator because of being separated by those and those other actions. Thus, the contradiction etc. in Me is avoided.

original: etat prāhāvyayaym iti sraṣṭṛtve 'pi sāmyān na vyemīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: etat prāha avyayaym iti sraṣṭṛ tve pi sāmyāt na vyemi iti arthaḥ
translated: He said this: I am the undecaying (10.30). Even in (My) being the creator, I do not decay because of equality.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: The Blessed Lord said --

original: na māṃ karmāṇi limpanti na me karmaphale spṛhā /
analyzed: na mām karmāṇi limpanti na me karma phale spṛhā
translated: Actions do not contaminate Me; nor does desire have any influence on Me.

original: iti māṃ yo 'bhijānāti karmabhir na sa badhyate ////
analyzed: iti mām yaḥ abhijānāti karmabhiḥ na sa badhyate
translated: One who knows Me thus is not bound by actions.

original: śrīdharaḥ / tad eva darśayann āha na mām iti /
analyzed: eva   āha
translated: Sri Sridhara says: Showing that very thing, He says Actions do not contaminate Me etc.

original: karmāṇi viśvasṛṣṭyādīny api māṃ na limpanty āsaktaṃ na kurvanti /
analyzed: karmāṇi viśva sṛṣṭi ādīni api mām na limpanti āsaktam na kurvanti
translated: Even the actions such as creation of the universe do not stain Me, do not attach Me.

original: nirahaṅkāratvān mama karmaphale spṛhābhāvāc ca /
analyzed: nirahaṅkāra tvāt mama karma phale spṛhā abhāvāt ca
translated: Because I am free from false-ego and because I have no desire for the results of actions.

original: māṃ limpantīti kiṃ kartavyam /
analyzed: mām limpanti iti kim kartavyam
translated: What is to be done with Me who am not stained?

original: yataḥ karmaleparahitatvena māṃ yo 'bhijānāti so 'pi karmabhir na badhyate /
analyzed: yatas karma lepa rahita tvena mām yaḥ abhijānāti saḥ u pi karmabhiḥ na badhyate
translated: Because one who knows Me as being free from the stain of actions, he also is not bound by actions.

original: mama nirlepatve kāraṇaṃ nirahaṅkāratvaniḥspṛhatvādikaṃ jānatas tasyāpy ahaṅkārādiśaithilyāt ////
analyzed: mama nirlepa tve kāraṇam nirahaṅkāra tva niḥspṛha tva ādikam jānataḥ tasya api ahaṅkāra ādi śaithilyāt
translated: The cause of My being free from stain is the absence of false-ego, desire etc. Knowing that, his false-ego etc. also become loose.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: karmāṇi viśvasargādīni māṃ nirahaṅkāratvena kartṛtvena kartṛtvābhimānahīnaṃ bhagavantaṃ na limpanti dehārambhakatvena na badhnanti /
analyzed: karmāṇi viśva sarga ādīni mām nirahaṅkāra tvena kartṛ tvena kartṛ tva abhimāna hīnam bhagavantam na limpanti deha ārambhaka tvena na badhnanti
translated: Actions such as creation of the universe do not stain Me, the Lord who is free from false-ego, who is the doer but is devoid of the sense of doership.

original: evaṃ kartṛtvaṃ nirākṛtya bhoktṛtvaṃ nirākaroti na me mamāptakāmasya karmaphale spṛhā tṛṣṇā āptakāmasya kā spṛhā iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: evam kartṛ tvam nirākṛtya bhoktṛ tvam nirākaroti na me mama āpta kāmasya karma phale spṛhā tṛṣṇā āpta kāmasya kā spṛhā iti śruteḥ
translated: Thus, having refuted the idea of being the doer, He refutes the idea of being the enjoyer: I, who am one whose desires are fulfilled, have no desire for the results of actions. Where there is desire, there is greed.

original: kartṛtvābhimānaphalaspṛhābhyāṃ hi karmāṇi limpanti tadabhāvān na māṃ karmāṇi limpantīti /
analyzed: kartṛ tva abhimāna phala spṛhābhyām hi karmāṇi limpanti tad abhāvāt na mām karmāṇi limpanti iti
translated: For actions stain one who has the sense of doership and who has desire for the results of actions. Because I am devoid of those, actions do not stain Me.

original: evaṃ yo 'nyo 'pi mām akartāram abhoktāraṃ cātmatvenābhijānāti karmabhir na sa badhyate 'kartrātmajñānena mucyata ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: evam yaḥ mām akartāram abhoktāram ca ātma tvena abhijānāti karmabhiḥ na sa badhyate kartrā ātma jñānena mucyate iti arthaḥ
translated: Similarly, one who knows Me in this way as the non-doer and the non-experiencer, he is not bound by actions. The meaning is: by knowing the Self as the non-doer, one is liberated.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: nanv etat tāvad āstām /
analyzed: nanu etat tāvat āstām
translated: Let this much be for now.

original: samprati tvaṃ kṣatriyakule 'vatīrṇaḥ /
analyzed: samprati tvam kṣatriya kule vatīrṇaḥ
translated: You have now descended into a Kshatriya family.

original: kṣatriyajātyucitāni karmāṇi pratyahaṃ karoṣy eva /
analyzed: kṣatriya jāti ucitāni karmāṇi pratyaham karoṣi eva
translated: You perform daily the duties befitting a Kshatriya birth.

original: tatra kā vārtā ity ata āha na mām iti /
analyzed: tatra kā vārtā iti atas āha na mām iti
translated: What is the situation there? To this he says, 'not Me' etc.

original: na limpanti jīvam iva na liptīkurvanti /
analyzed: na limpanti jīvam iva na liptīkurvanti
translated: They do not stain Me, as they do a living being.

original: nāpi jīvasyeva karmaphale svargādau spṛhā /
analyzed: nā api jīvasya iva karma phale svarga ādau spṛhā
translated: Nor do I have a desire for the fruits of actions like heaven, as a living being does.

original: parameśvaratvena svānandapūrṇatve 'pi lokapravartanārtham eva me karmādikaraṇam iti bhāvaḥ /
translated: The idea is that even though I am the Supreme Lord and am full of My own bliss, I perform actions etc. only in order to engage the world.

original: iti mām iti /
analyzed: iti mām iti
translated: 'Thus, Me' etc.

original: yas tu na jānāti sa karmabhir badhyata iti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: yaḥ tu na jānāti sa karmabhiḥ badhyate iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that one who does not know this is bound by actions.

original: baladevaḥ / etad viśadayati na mām iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ etat viśadayati na mām iti
translated: Baladeva: He clarifies this with 'not Me' etc.

original: karmāṇi viśvasargādīni māṃ na limpanti vaiṣamyādidoṣeṇa jīvam iva liptaṃ na kurvanti /
analyzed: karmāṇi viśva sarga ādīni mām na limpanti vaiṣamya ādi doṣeṇa jīvam iva liptam na kurvanti
translated: The actions, such as creation of the universe, do not stain Me, as they do a living being with the fault of inequality etc.

original: yat tāni sṛjyajīvakarmaprayuktāni na ca matprayuktāni na ca sargādikarmaphale mama spṛhāsty ato na limpantīti /
analyzed: yat tāni sṛjya jīva karma prayuktāni na ca mad prayuktāni na ca sarga ādi karma phale mama spṛhā asti atas na limpanti iti
translated: That they are impelled by the actions of the beings to be created, not by Me, and I have no desire for the fruits of creation etc., therefore they do not stain Me.

original: phalaspṛhayā yaḥ karmāṇi karoti sa tatphalair lipyate /
analyzed: phala spṛhayā yaḥ karmāṇi karoti sa tad phalaiḥ lipyate
translated: One who performs actions with a desire for fruits is affected by those fruits.

original: ahaṃ tu svarūpānandapūrṇaḥ prakṛtivilīnakṣetrajñabubhukṣābhyuditadayaḥ /
analyzed: aham tu sva rūpa ānanda pūrṇaḥ prakṛti vilīna kṣetrajña bubhukṣā abhyudita dayaḥ
translated: But I, being full of the bliss of My own nature, with the desire for enjoyment of the individual souls dissolved in Prakṛti, and compassion arising,

original: parjanyavan nimittamātraḥ san tatkarmāṇi pravartayāmīti / smṛtiś ca 🔽nimittamātram evāsau sṛjyānāṃ sargakarmaṇi /
analyzed: parjanya vat nimitta mātraḥ san tad karmāṇi pravartayāmi iti smṛtiḥ ca  nimitta mātram eva asau sṛjyānām sarga karmaṇi
translated: being like a cloud, merely the instrument, I engage in those actions. And there is a Smṛti text:🔽He is merely the instrument in the creation of the beings to be created.

original: pradhānakāraṇībhūtā yato vai sṛjyaśaktayaḥ // ity ādyā /🔽sṛjyānāṃ devamānavādibhāvabhājāṃ kṣetrajñānāṃ sargakriyāyām asau pareśo nimittamātram🔽eva devādibhāvavaicitryāṃ kāraṇībhūtās tu sṛjyānāṃ teṣāṃ prācīnakarmaśaktaya
analyzed: pradhāna kāraṇībhūtāḥ yatas vai sṛjya śaktayaḥ iti ādyā  sṛjyānām deva mānava ādi bhāva bhājām kṣetrajñānām sarga kriyāyām asau pareśaḥ nimitta mātram  eva deva ādi bhāva vaicitryām kāraṇībhūtāḥ tu sṛjyānām teṣām prācīna karma śaktayaḥ
translated: For from Him arise the potencies of the beings to be created, which are the material causes of Prakṛti. And so on.🔽In the creation of the individual souls who are to be created and who attain the states of gods, humans, etc., that Supreme Lord is merely the instrument.🔽But the potencies of those beings to be created, which are the causes of the variety of states such as godhood,

original: eva bhavantīti tadarthaḥ /
analyzed: eva bhavanti iti tad arthaḥ
translated: are the very potencies of their past actions. This is the meaning.

original: evam āha sūtrakṛt vaiṣamyanairghṛṇyena Vs / / / ity ādinā /
analyzed: evam āha sūtra kṛt vaiṣamya nairghṛṇyena iti ādinā
translated: Thus the author of the aphorisms says: By the objection of inequality and cruelty... and so on.

original: evaṃ jñānasya phalam āha iti mām iti /
analyzed: evam jñānasya phalam āha iti mām iti
translated: Thus he states the fruit of knowledge: Thus... and so on.

original: itthambhūtaṃ māṃ yo 'bhijānāti /
analyzed: itthambhūtam mām yaḥ abhijānāti
translated: He who knows Me thus.

original: sa tadvirodhibhis taddhetubhiḥ prācīnakarmabhir na badhyate /
analyzed: sa tad virodhibhiḥ tad hetubhiḥ prācīna karmabhiḥ na badhyate
translated: He is not bound by the opposing actions of the past, which are the causes of that (bondage).

original: tair vimucyata ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: taiḥ vimucyate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that he is freed from them.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: evaṃ jñātvā kṛtaṃ karma pūrvair api mumukṣubhiḥ /
analyzed: evam jñātvā kṛtam karma pūrvaiḥ api mumukṣubhiḥ
translated: Knowing thus, action was performed by the ancients also who were desirous of liberation.

original: kuru karmaiva tasmāt tvaṃ pūrvaiḥ pūrvataraṃ kṛtam ////
analyzed: kuru karma eva tasmāt tvam pūrvaiḥ pūrvataram kṛtam
translated: Therefore, do action alone, which was performed by the ancients even earlier.

original: śrīdharaḥ / ye yathā mām ity ādi caturbhiḥ ślokaiḥ prāsaṅgikam īśvarasya vaiṣamyaṃ parihṛtya pūrvoktam eva karmayogaṃ prapañcayitum anusmārayati
translated: Sri Sridhara: With the four verses beginning with Those who know Me thus, having incidentally resolved the issue of God's partiality, he reminds us of the very action-yoga that was previously mentioned.

original: evam iti /
analyzed: evam iti
translated: Thus.

original: ahaṅkārādirāhityena kṛtaṃ karma bandhakaṃ na bhavati /
analyzed: ahaṅkāra ādi rāhityena kṛtam karma bandhakam na bhavati
translated: Action performed without egoism etc. does not lead to bondage.

original: ity evaṃ jñātvā pūrvair janakādibhir api mumukṣubhiḥ sattvaśuddhyarthaṃ pūrvataraṃ yugāntareṣv api kṛtam /
analyzed: iti evam jñātvā pūrvaiḥ janaka ādibhiḥ api mumukṣubhiḥ sattva śuddhi artham pūrvataram yuga antareṣu api kṛtam
translated: Knowing thus, action was performed by the ancients also, who were desirous of liberation, for the purification of the mind, even earlier, in other ages.

original: tasmāt tvam api prathamaṃ karmaiva kuru ////
analyzed: tasmāt tvam api prathamam karma eva kuru
translated: Therefore, you also perform action first.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: yato nāhaṃ kartā na me karmaphalaspṛheti jñānāt karmabhir na badhyate 'ta āha evam iti /
analyzed: yatas na aham kartā na me karma phala spṛhā iti jñānāt karmabhiḥ na badhyate te āha evam iti
translated: Since one is not bound by actions due to the knowledge that I am not the doer, I have no desire for the fruits of action, therefore he says thus.

original: evam ātmano 'kartuḥ karmālepaṃ jñātvā kṛtaṃ karma pūrvair atikrāntair api asmin yuge yayātiyaduprabhṛtibhir mumukṣubhiḥ /
analyzed: evam kartuḥ karma ālepam jñātvā kṛtam karma pūrvaiḥ atikrāntaiḥ api asmin yuge yayāti yadu prabhṛtibhiḥ mumukṣubhiḥ
translated: Thus, knowing that the Self, which is not the doer, is not affected by actions, you should perform action, as did the men of yore, such as Yayati and Yadu, who were desirous of liberation.

original: tasmāt tvam api karmaiva kuru na tūṣṇīm āsanaṃ nāpi saṃnyāsam /
analyzed: tasmāt tvam api karma eva kuru na tūṣṇīm āsanam na api saṃnyāsam
translated: Therefore, you also should perform action, but not remain silent, nor renounce.

original: yady atattvavit tadātmaśuddhyarthaṃ tattvavic cel lokasaṅgrahārtham /
analyzed: yadi a tattva vid tadā ātma śuddhi artham tattva vid ced loka saṅgraha artham
translated: If you do not know the truth, then for the purification of the Self; if you know the truth, then for the protection of the world.

original: pūrvair janakādibhiḥ pūrvataram atipūrvaṃ yugāntare kṛtam /
analyzed: pūrvaiḥ janaka ādibhiḥ pūrvataram ati pūrvam yuga antare kṛtam
translated: What was done by the men of yore, such as Janaka, in the previous yuga, was done by the men of still earlier yugas, and still earlier.

original: etenāsmin yuge 'nyayuge ca pūrvapūrvataraiḥ kṛtatvād avaśyaṃ tvayā kartavyaṃ karmeti darśayati ////
analyzed: etena asmin yuge nyayuge ca pūrva pūrvataraiḥ kṛta tvāt avaśyam tvayā kartavyam karma iti darśayati
translated: By this it is shown that action should necessarily be performed by you in this yuga and other yugas because it was performed by the men of earlier, earlier yugas.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: evambhūtam eva māṃ jñātvā pūrvair janakādibhir api lokapravartanārtham eva karma kṛtam ////
analyzed: evambhūtam eva mām jñātvā pūrvaiḥ janaka ādibhiḥ api loka pravartana artham eva karma kṛtam
translated: Knowing Me to be such, action was performed by the men of yore, such as Janaka, for the purpose of setting an example to the world.

original: baladevaḥ / evam iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam iti
translated: Balarama: Thus.

original: mām eva jñātvā tadanusāribhir macchiṣyaiḥ pūrvair vivasvadādibhir mumukṣubhir niṣkāmaṃ karma kṛtam /
analyzed: mām eva jñātvā tad anusāribhiḥ mad śiṣyaiḥ pūrvaiḥ vivasvat ādibhiḥ mumukṣubhiḥ niṣkāmam karma kṛtam
translated: Knowing Me alone, action was performed by the men of yore, such as Vivasvata and others, who were My disciples and desirous of liberation.

original: tasmāt tvam api karmaiva tat kuru /
analyzed: tasmāt tvam api karma eva tat kuru
translated: Therefore, you also should perform that action.

original: na karmasaṃnyāsam /
analyzed: na karma saṃnyāsam
translated: Not renounce action.

original: aśuddhacittaś cej jñānagarbhāyai cittaśuddhyai śuddhacittaś cel lokasaṅgrahāyety arthaḥ /
analyzed: a śuddha cittaḥ ced jñāna garbhāyai citta śuddhyai śuddha cittaḥ ced loka saṅgrahāya iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: if one has an impure mind, then in order to purify the mind for the sake of the embryo of knowledge; if one has a pure mind, then in order to gather the people.

original: kīdṛśaṃ pūrvais taiḥ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: kīdṛśam pūrvaiḥ taiḥ kṛtam
translated: What kind of action was done by those ancient ones?

original: pūrvataraṃ atiprācīnam ////
analyzed: pūrvataram atiprācīnam
translated: Earlier, very long ago.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: kiṃ karma kim akarmeti kavayo 'py atra mohitāḥ /
analyzed: kim karma kim akarma iti kavayaḥ api atra mohitāḥ
translated: Even the wise are confused about this: what is action and what is inaction?

original: tat te karma pravakṣyāmi yaj jñātvā mokṣyase 'śubhāt ////
analyzed: tat te karma pravakṣyāmi yat jñātvā mokṣyase śubhāt
translated: I shall tell you that action by knowing which you will be freed from evil.

original: śrīdharaḥ / tac ca tattvavidbhiḥ saha vicārya kartavyam /
analyzed: ca
translated: And that should be done after discussing it with those who know the truth.

original: na lokaparamparāmātreṇety āha kiṃ karmeti /🔽kiṃ karma / kīdṛśaṃ karmakaraṇam /
analyzed: na loka paramparā mātreṇa iti āha kim karma iti  kim karma kīdṛśam karma karaṇam
translated: Not merely by the tradition of the world, says (the Lord): What is action?🔽What kind of action is to be done?

original: kim akarma / kīdṛśaṃ karmākaraṇam /
analyzed: kim akarma kīdṛśam karma akaraṇam
translated: What is inaction? What kind of action is not to be done?

original: ity asminn arthe vivekino 'pi mohitāḥ /
analyzed: iti asmin arthe vivekinaḥ mohitāḥ
translated: Even the wise are confused about this.

original: ato yaj jñātā yadanuṣṭhāyāśubhāt saṃsārān mokṣyase mukto bhaviṣyasi tat karmākarma ca tubhyam ahaṃ pravakṣyāmi tac chṛṇu ////
analyzed: atas yat jñātā yat anuṣṭhāya aśubhāt saṃsārāt mokṣyase muktaḥ bhaviṣyasi tat karma akarma ca tubhyam aham pravakṣyāmi tat śṛṇu
translated: Therefore, I shall tell you that action and inaction by knowing which you will be freed from evil, from the world, I shall tell you that, listen.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: nanu karmaviṣaye kiṃ kaścit saṃśayo 'py asti yena pūrvaiḥ pūrvataraṃ kṛtam ity atinirbadhnāsi /
analyzed: nanu karma viṣaye kim kaścid asti yena pūrvaiḥ pūrvataram kṛtam iti ati nirbadhnāsi
translated: But is there any doubt at all regarding action, by which you are pressing too hard, saying what was done by the ancient ones earlier?

original: asty evety āha kiṃ karmeti /
analyzed: asti eva iti āha kim karma iti
translated: He says, 'It exists' (in the form of the body). 'What is action?'🔽Because even for one in a boat, trees on the bank appear to move, and because even for one far away,

original: nausthasya niṣkriyeṣv api taṭasthavṛkṣeṣu gamanabhramadarśanāt tathā dūrāc cakṣuḥsaṃnikṛṣṭeṣu
analyzed: nausthasya niṣkriyeṣu api taṭastha vṛkṣeṣu gamana bhrama darśanāt tathā dūrāt cakṣuḥ saṃnikṛṣṭeṣu
translated: men who are close to the eye appear not to move, the wise, even though intelligent, are confused in this matter, i.e.

original: gacchatsv api puruṣeṣv agamanabhramadarśanāt paramārthataḥ kiṃ karma kiṃ vā paramārthato🔽'karmeti kavayo medhāvino 'py atrāsmin viṣaye mohitā mohaṃ nirṇayāsāmarthyaṃ prāptā🔽atyantadurnirūpatvād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: gacchatsu api puruṣeṣu agamana bhrama darśanāt paramārthataḥ kim karma kim vā  karma iti kavayaḥ medhāvinaḥ pi atra asmin viṣaye mohitāḥ moham nirṇaya a sāmarthyam prāptā  atyanta durnirūpa tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: they are unable to decide what is action and what is not action in reality, because it is extremely difficult to determine.

original: tat tasmāt te tubhyam ahaṃ karma /
analyzed: tat tasmāt te tubhyam aham karma
translated: Therefore, I will tell you, to you, what action is and what is not action.

original: akārapraśleṣeṇa cchedād akarma ca pravakṣyāmi prakarṣeṇa sandehocchedena vakṣyāmi /
analyzed: akāra praśleṣeṇa chedāt akarma ca pravakṣyāmi prakarṣeṇa sandeha ucchedena vakṣyāmi
translated: By dividing the sentence after adding the letter 'a', I will tell you, by cutting off all doubts, what action is and what is not action.

original: yat karmākarmasvarūpaṃ jñātvā mokṣyase mukto bhaviṣyasy aśubhāt saṃsārāt ////
analyzed: yat karma akarma svarūpam jñātvā mokṣyase muktaḥ bhaviṣyasi aśubhāt saṃsārāt
translated: By knowing what action is in the form of inaction, you will be liberated, you will become free from evil, from worldly existence.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: kiṃ ca karmāpi na gatānugatikanyāyenaiva kevalaṃ vivekinā kartavyam /
analyzed: kim ca karma api na gatānugatika nyāyena eva kevalam vivekinā kartavyam
translated: Moreover, action should not be performed by the wise merely by following the herd,

original: kintu tasya prakāraviśeṣaṃ jñātvaivety atas tasya prathamaṃ durjñeyatvam āha ////
analyzed: kintu tasya prakāra viśeṣam jñātvā evā iti atas tasya prathamam durjñeya tvam āha
translated: but only by knowing its specific method. Therefore, its first difficulty in being known is stated.

original: baladevaḥ / nanu kiṃ karmaviṣayakaḥ kaścit sandeho 'py asti yataḥ pūrvaiḥ pūrvataraṃ kṛtam ity atinirbandhād bravīṣīti ced asty evety āha
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu kim karma viṣayakaḥ kaścid asti yatas pūrvaiḥ pūrvataram kṛtam iti ati nirbandhāt bravīṣi iti ced asti eva iti āha  /
translated: Balarāma: Now, if it is asked, Is there even some doubt regarding karma, for which reason you speak with such insistence, saying 'what was done by the ancient ones in the past'? He says there is indeed:

original: kiṃ karmeti /
analyzed: kim karma iti
translated: What is karma?

original: mumukṣubhir anuṣṭheyaṃ karma kiṃ rūpaṃ syād akarma ca karmānyat tadantargataṃ jñānaṃ ca kiṃ rūpam ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: mumukṣubhiḥ anuṣṭheyam karma kim rūpam syāt akarma ca karma anyat tad antargatam jñānam ca kim rūpam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: What should be the form of the karma to be performed by those who desire liberation, and what is karma other than that, and what is the form of the knowledge contained within it?

original: tadanyatve enaṃ ca /
analyzed: tad anya tve enam ca
translated: And in the case of their being different from that, and in this matter,

original: atrārthe kavayo dhīmanto 'pi mohitās tadyāthātmyanirṇayāsāmarthyān mohaṃ prāpuḥ /
analyzed: atrā arthe kavayaḥ mohitāḥ tad yāthātmya nirṇaya asāmarthyāt moham prāpuḥ
translated: even the wise and intelligent ones are deluded, having attained delusion due to the inability to determine their true nature.

original: ahaṃ sarveśaḥ sarvajñas te tubhyaṃ tat karma akārapraśleṣād akarma ca pravakṣyāmi yaj jñātvānuṣṭhāya prāpya cāśubhāt saṃsārān mokṣyase ////
analyzed: aham sarva īśaḥ sarvajñaḥ te tubhyam tat karma akāra praśleṣāt akarma ca pravakṣyāmi yat jñātvā anuṣṭhāya prāpya ca aśubhāt saṃsārāt mokṣyase
translated: I, the Lord of all, the Omniscient One, will declare to you that karma and also non-karma, by connecting the word 'a' (to form 'akarma'), by knowing which and performing it, you will quickly be liberated from the inauspicious world of transmigration.

original: BhG /🔽karmaṇo hy api boddhavyaṃ boddhavyaṃ ca vikarmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: bhg  karmaṇaḥ hi api boddhavyam boddhavyam ca vikarmaṇaḥ
translated: (Bhagavad Gita 4.16)🔽For one should know even about karma, and one should know about deviant karma,

original: akarmaṇaś ca boddhavyaṃ gahanā karmaṇo gatiḥ ////
analyzed: akarmaṇaḥ ca boddhavyam gahanā karmaṇaḥ gatiḥ
translated: and one should know about non-action, for the course of karma is inscrutable.🔽(Bhagavad Gita 4.17)

original: śrīdharaḥ / nanu lokaprasiddham eva karma dehādivyāpārātmakam /
translated: Śrīdhara: Now, if it is said, Karma is well-known in the world itself, consisting of the activities of the body etc.,

original: akarma tadavyāpārātmakam /
analyzed: akarma tat a vyāpāra ātmakam
translated: and non-karma is that which is not such activity.

original: ataḥ katham ucyate kavayo 'py atra mohaṃ prāptā iti /
analyzed: atas katham ucyate kavayaḥ pi atra moham prāptāḥ iti
translated: Therefore, how can it be said that even the wise become deluded in this matter?

original: tatrāha karmaṇa iti /
analyzed: tatra āha karmaṇaḥ iti
translated: In response to that, he says, of action, etc.

original: karmaṇo vihitavyāpārasyāpi tattvaṃ boddhavyam asti /
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ vihita vyāpārasya api tattvam boddhavyam asti
translated: Even of action, which is engaged in what is enjoined, the truth must be understood.

original: na tu lokaprasiddhamātram eva /🔽akarmaṇo 'vihitavyāpārasyāpi tattvaṃ boddhavyam asti /
analyzed: na tu loka prasiddha mātram eva  akarmaṇaḥ vihita vyāpārasya api tattvam boddhavyam asti
translated: But it is not just what is well-known in the world.🔽Even of inaction, which is not engaged in anything, the truth must be understood.

original: vikarmaṇo niṣiddhavyāpārasyāpi tattvaṃ boddhavyam asti /
analyzed: vikarmaṇaḥ niṣiddha vyāpārasya api tattvam boddhavyam asti
translated: Even of misaction, which is engaged in what is prohibited, the truth must be understood.

original: yataḥ karmaṇo gatir gahanā /
analyzed: yatas karmaṇaḥ gatiḥ gahanā
translated: Because the course of action is difficult to understand.

original: karmaṇa ity upalakṣaṇārtham /
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ iti upalakṣaṇa artham
translated: Of action is used as an illustration.

original: karmākarmavikarmaṇāṃ tattvaṃ durvijñeyam ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: karma akarma vikarmaṇām tattvam durvijñeyam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the truth of action, inaction, and misaction is difficult to know.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: nanu sarvalokaprasiddhatvād aham evaitaj jānāmi dehendriyādivyāpāraḥ karma tūṣṇīm āsanam akarmeti tatra kiṃ tvayā vaktavyam iti tatrāha
analyzed: nanu sarva loka prasiddha tvāt aham eva etat jānāmi deha indriya ādi vyāpāraḥ karma tūṣṇīm āsanam akarma iti tatra kim tvayā vaktavyam iti tatra āha
translated: But since it is well-known to everyone, I myself know this: the activity of the body, senses, etc. is action, and sitting silently is inaction. What can you say about that? In response to that, he says

original: karmaṇa iti /
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ iti
translated: of action, etc.

original: hi yasmāt karmaṇaḥ śāstravihitasyāpi tattvaṃ boddhavyam asti /🔽vikarmaṇaś ca pratiṣiddhasya /
analyzed: hi yasmāt karmaṇaḥ śāstra vihitasya api tattvam boddhavyam asti  vikarmaṇaḥ ca pratiṣiddhasya
translated: For, since the truth of action, which is enjoined by scripture, must be understood,🔽and of misaction, which is prohibited,

original: akarmaṇaś ca tūṣṇīmbhāvasya /
analyzed: a karmaṇaḥ ca tūṣṇīmbhāvasya
translated: and of inaction, which is silence,

original: atra vākyatraye 'pi tattvam asīty adhyāhāraḥ /
analyzed: atra vākya traye tat tvam asi iti adhyāhāraḥ
translated: In all these three sentences, the word 'tatvam asi' (that thou art) is to be supplied.

original: yasmād gahanā durjñānā /
analyzed: yasmāt gahanā durjñānā
translated: Because it is difficult to understand.

original: karmaṇa ity upalakṣaṇaṃ karmākarmavikarmaṇām /
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ iti upalakṣaṇam karma akarma vikarmaṇām
translated: The word 'karma' is used figuratively to include both action and inaction.

original: gatis tattvam ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: gatiḥ tattvam iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the truth is the goal.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: niṣiddhācaraṇaṃ durgatiprāpakam iti tattvam /
analyzed: niṣiddha ācaraṇam durgati prāpakam iti tattvam
translated: The truth is that the performance of prohibited acts leads to a bad end.

original: tathākarmaṇaḥ karmākaraṇasyāpi sannyāsinaḥ kīdṛśaṃ karmākaraṇaṃ śubhadam iti /
analyzed: tathā akarmaṇaḥ karma akaraṇasya api sannyāsinaḥ kīdṛśam karma akaraṇam śubha dam iti
translated: Similarly, for one who has renounced action, what kind of inaction of action leads to good?

original: anyathā niḥśreyasaṃ kathaṃ hastagataṃ syād iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: anyathā niḥśreyasam katham hasta gatam syāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: Otherwise, how can liberation come within reach? This is the idea.

original: karmaṇa ity upalakṣaṇaṃ karmākarmavikarmaṇām /
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ iti upalakṣaṇam karma akarma vikarmaṇām
translated: The word 'karma' is used figuratively to include both action and inaction.

original: gatis tattvam /
analyzed: gatiḥ tattvam
translated: The truth is the goal.

original: gahanā durgamā ////
analyzed: gahanā durgamā
translated: It is difficult to understand.

original: baladevaḥ / nanu kavayo 'pi mohaṃ prāpur iti cet tatrāha karmaṇo hīti /🔽karmaṇo niṣkāmasya mumukṣubhir anuṣṭhātavyasya svarūpaṃ boddhavyam /🔽vikarmaṇo jñānaviruddhasya kāmyakarmaṇaḥ svarūpaṃ boddhavyam /
analyzed: baladevaḥ nanu kavayaḥ api moham prāpuḥ iti ced tatra āha karmaṇaḥ hi iti  karmaṇaḥ niṣkāmasya mumukṣubhiḥ anuṣṭhātavyasya svarūpam boddhavyam  vikarmaṇaḥ jñāna viruddhasya kāmya karmaṇaḥ svarūpam boddhavyam
translated: Baladeva: If it is argued that even the wise ones attained delusion, then it is said 'because of action'.🔽The nature of action, which is to be performed by those who desire liberation, should be known.🔽The nature of prohibited action, which is contrary to knowledge, should be known.

original: akarmaṇaś ca karmabhinnasya jñānasya ca svarūpaṃ boddhavyam /
analyzed: akarmaṇaḥ ca karma bhinnasya jñānasya ca svarūpam boddhavyam
translated: And the nature of inaction, which is different from action, and of knowledge, should be known.

original: tattatsvarūpavidbhiḥ sārdhaṃ vicāryam ity arthaḥ /
translated: The meaning is that it should be discussed with those who know the nature of each of those.

original: karmaṇo 'karmaṇaś ca gatir gahanā durgamā /
analyzed: karmaṇaḥ karmaṇaḥ ca gatiḥ gahanā durgamā
translated: The course of action and inaction is deep and difficult to understand.

original: ataḥ kavayo 'pi tatra mohitāḥ ////
analyzed: atas kavayaḥ pi tatra mohitāḥ
translated: Therefore, even the wise are deluded there.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: (Bhagavad Gita 4.16)

original: karmaṇy akarma yaḥ paśyed akarmaṇi ca karma yaḥ /
analyzed: karmaṇi a karma yaḥ paśyet a karmaṇi ca karma yaḥ
translated: One who sees inaction in action and action in inaction,🔽he is the knower of yoga among men, he is the doer of all actions.

original: sa buddhimān manuṣyeṣu sa yuktaḥ kṛtsnakarmakṛt ////
analyzed: sa buddhimān manuṣyeṣu sa yuktaḥ kṛtsna karma kṛt
translated: (Bhagavad Gita 4.18)

original: śrīdharaḥ / tad evaṃ karmādīnāṃ durvijñeyatvaṃ darśayann āha karmaṇīti /
translated: Thus, showing the difficulty of understanding action etc., he says in action etc.

original: parameśvarārādhanalakṣaṇe karmaṇi karmaviṣaye akarma karmedaṃ na bhavatīti yaḥ paśyet /
analyzed: parameśvara ārādhana lakṣaṇe karmaṇi karma viṣaye akarma karma idam na bhavati iti yaḥ paśyet
translated: One who sees inaction, that this action is not an action, in action, in the sphere of action, which consists of worshipping the Supreme Lord.

original: tasya jñānahetutvena bandhakatvābhāvāt /
analyzed: tasya jñāna hetu tvena bandhaka tva abhāvāt
translated: Because it is not a cause of bondage, being a cause of knowledge.

original: akarmaṇi ca vihitākaraṇe karma yaḥ paśyet pratyavāyotpādakatvena bandhahetutvāt /
analyzed: akarmaṇi ca vihita a karaṇe karma yaḥ paśyet pratyavāya utpādaka tvena bandha hetu tvāt
translated: And one who sees action, as a cause of bondage, as producing a negative consequence, in inaction, in not performing what is enjoined.

original: manuṣyeṣu karma kurvāṇeṣu sa buddhimān vyavasāyātmakabuddhimattvāc chreṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: manuṣyeṣu karma kurvāṇeṣu sa buddhimān vyavasāya ātmaka buddhimat tvāt śreṣṭhaḥ
translated: Among men who perform actions, he is the wisest, because he has the wisdom of determination.

original: taṃ stauti sa yukto yogī /
analyzed: tam stauti sa yuktaḥ yogī
translated: He praises him: He is the yogi, the one who is in union.

original: tena karmaṇā jñānayogāvāpteḥ /
analyzed: tena karmaṇā jñāna yoga avāpteḥ
translated: Because knowledge and yoga are attained through that action.

original: sa eva kṛtsnakarmakartā ca /
analyzed: saḥ eva kṛtsna karma kartā ca
translated: He alone is the doer of all actions.

original: sarvataḥ samplutodakasthānīye ca tasmin karmaṇi sarvakarmaphalānām antarbhāvāt🔽tad evam ārurukṣoḥ karmayogādhikārāvasthāyāṃ na karmaṇām anārambhād ity ādinokta
analyzed: sarvatas sampluta udaka sthānīye ca tasmin karmaṇi sarva karma phalānām antarbhāvāt  tat evam ārurukṣoḥ karmayoga adhikāra avasthāyām na karmaṇām anārambhāt iti ādinā ukta
translated: And in that rite which is like the water everywhere overflowing, all the fruits of action are included.

original: eva karmayogaḥ spaṣṭīkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: eva karmayogaḥ spaṣṭīkṛtaḥ
translated: Thus, in the state of being qualified for the yoga of action of one who is desirous of ascending, the yoga of action which was stated earlier, beginning with not by mere non-performance of action,🔽has been clarified.

original: tatprapañcarūpatvāc cāsya prakaraṇasya na paunaruktyadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: tad prapañca rūpa tvāt ca asya prakaraṇasya na paunaruktya doṣaḥ
translated: And because this chapter is an elaboration of that, there is no fault of repetition.

original: anenaiva yogārūḍhāvasthāyāṃ
analyzed: anena eva yoga ārūḍha avasthāyām
translated: And by this alone, in the state of being established in yoga,

original: yas tv ātmaratir eva syād ity ādinā yaḥ karmānupayoga uktas tasyāpy arthāt prapañcaḥ kṛto veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu ātma ratiḥ eva syāt iti ādinā yaḥ karma anupayogaḥ uktaḥ tasya api arthāt prapañcaḥ kṛtaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: it should be understood that the elaboration of the statement of the uselessness of action by but he who would be delighted in the Self alone, etc., has also been made implicitly.

original: yad ārurukṣor api karma bandhakaṃ na bhavati tadārūḍhasya kuto bandhakaṃ syāt ity atrāpi śloko yujyate /
analyzed: yat ārurukṣoḥ api karma bandhakam na bhavati tad ārūḍhasya kutas bandhakam syāt iti atra api ślokaḥ yujyate
translated: And this verse is also appropriate here, that even for one who is desirous of ascending, action does not become binding, so how could it be binding for one who has ascended?

original: yad vā / karmaṇi dehendriyādivyāpāre vartamāne 'py ātmano dehādivyatirekānubhavena
analyzed: yat vā karmaṇi deha indriya ādi vyāpāre vartamāne pi ātmanaḥ deha ādi vyatireka anubhavena
translated: Or, when action, the operation of the body, senses, etc., is going on, by the experience of the Self as distinct from the body, etc.,

original: akarma svābhāvikaṃ niaṣkarmyam eva yaḥ paśyet tathā akarmaṇi ca jñānarahite duḥkhabuddhyā
analyzed: akarma svābhāvikam niaṣkarmyam eva yaḥ paśyet tathā akarmaṇi ca jñāna rahite duḥkha buddhyā
translated: he who would see non-action, natural inactivity itself, and likewise, in non-action, devoid of knowledge, by the notion of it as misery,

original: karmaṇāṃ tyāge karma yaḥ paśyet tasya prayatnasādhyatvena mithyācāratvāt /
analyzed: karmaṇām tyāge karma yaḥ paśyet tasya prayatna sādhya tvena mithyā ācāra tvāt
translated: He who sees action in the renunciation of actions, is a hypocrite, because that is to be accomplished by effort.

original: tad uktaṃ karmendriyāṇi saṃyamyety ādinā /
analyzed: tat uktam karmendriyāṇi saṃyamya iti ādinā
translated: This has been stated by the words 'restraining the organs of action' etc.

original: ya evambhūtaḥ sa tu sarveṣu manuṣyeṣu buddhimān paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ evambhūtaḥ sa tu sarveṣu manuṣyeṣu buddhimān paṇḍitaḥ
translated: He who is such is the most intelligent, the most learned, among all men.

original: tatra hetuḥ yataḥ kṛtsnāni sarvāṇi yadṛcchayā prāptāny āhārādīni karmāṇi kurvann api sa yukta eva akartrātmajñānena samādhistha evety arthaḥ
analyzed: tatra hetuḥ yatas kṛtsnāni sarvāṇi yadṛcchayā prāptāni āhāra ādīni karmāṇi kurvan api sa yuktaḥ eva akartrā ātma jñānena samādhi sthaḥ eva iti arthaḥ
translated: The reason for that is: because he, while performing all the actions such as eating etc. obtained by chance, is still engaged, i.e. is in meditation by the knowledge of the Self as non-agent.

original: anenanaiva jñāninaḥ svabhāvād āpannaṃ kalañjabhakṣaṇādikaṃ na doṣāya /
analyzed: anenanā eva jñāninaḥ svabhāvāt āpannam kalañja bhakṣaṇa ādikam na doṣāya
translated: By this alone, the eating of forbidden food etc. obtained by the nature of the knower is not a fault.

original: ajñasya tu rāgataḥ kṛtaṃ doṣāya iti vikarmaṇo 'pi tattvaṃ nirūpitaṃ draṣṭavyam ////
analyzed: ajñasya tu rāgataḥ kṛtam doṣāya iti tattvam nirūpitam draṣṭavyam
translated: But for the ignorant, doing it out of attachment is a fault. Thus the truth of forbidden actions should be seen.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: kīdṛśaṃ tarhi karmādīnāṃ tattvam iti tad āha karmaṇīti /
analyzed: kīdṛśam tarhi karma ādīnām tattvam iti tat āha karmaṇi iti
translated: What then is the truth of actions etc.? That is said by 'in action' etc.

original: karmaṇi dehendriyādivyāpāre vihite pratiṣiddhe cāhaṃ karomīti dharmyadhyāsenātmany āropit /
analyzed: karmaṇi deha indriya ādi vyāpāre vihite pratiṣiddhe ca aham karomi iti dharmi adhyāsena ātmani
translated: In the performance of actions such as the functions of the body and senses, which are enjoined and prohibited, the superimposition of the Self on the Self by the idea 'I am doing' is action.

original: nausthenācalatsu taṭasthavṛkṣādiṣu samāropite calana ivākartātmasvarūpālocanena vastutaḥ karmābhāvaṃ taṭasthavṛkṣādiṣv iva yaḥ paśyet paśyati
analyzed: nausthena a calatsu taṭa stha vṛkṣa ādiṣu samāropite calane iva akartā ātma svarūpa ālocanena vastutas karma abhāvam taṭa stha vṛkṣa ādiṣu iva yaḥ paśyet paśyati
translated: Just as when a man in a boat sees the trees on the bank as moving, though they are not moving, in the same way, he who sees the non-existence of action in reality by the contemplation of the nature of the non-agent, as in the case of the trees on the bank,

original: tathā dehendriyādiṣu triguṇamāyāpariṇāmatvena sarvadā savyāpāreṣu nirvyāpāras tūṣṇīṃ
analyzed: tathā deha indriya ādiṣu triguṇa māyā pariṇāma tvena sarvadā sa vyāpāreṣu nirvyāpāraḥ tūṣṇīm
translated: in the same way, in the body, senses, etc., which are always active due to being transformations of the three-fold primordial matter, he who remains inactive, silent,

original: sukham āsa ity abhimānena samāropite 'karmaṇi vyāpāroparame dūrasthacakṣuḥsaṃnikṛṣṭapuruṣeṣu
analyzed: sukham āsa iti abhimānena samāropite karmaṇi vyāpāra uparame dūra stha cakṣuḥ saṃnikṛṣṭa puruṣeṣu
translated: and happy, with the conceit that action is superimposed on the cessation of activity, as in the case of the men standing far away with eyes closed,

original: gacchatsv apy agamana iva sarvadā savyāpāradehendriyādisvarūpaparyālocanena vastugatyā
analyzed: gacchatsu api agamane iva sarvadā sa vyāpāra deha indriya ādi svarūpa paryālocanena vastu gatyā
translated: even though they are moving, by the contemplation of the nature of the body, senses, etc., which are always active,

original: karma nivṛttyākhyaprayatnarūpaṃ vyāpāraṃ yaḥ paśyed udāhṛtapuruṣeṣu gamanam iva /
analyzed: karma nivṛtti ākhya prayatna rūpam vyāpāram yaḥ paśyet udāhṛta puruṣeṣu gamanam iva
translated: he who sees the cessation of action, which is in the form of effort called nivṛtti, as in the case of the men mentioned above, who see the movement,

original: audāsīnyāvasthāyām apy udāsīno 'ham āsa ity
analyzed: audāsīnya avasthāyām api udāsīnaḥ ham āse iti
translated: even in the state of neutrality, the conceit I remained neutral

original: abhimāna eva karma /
analyzed: abhimānaḥ eva karma
translated: is itself action.

original: etādṛśaḥ paramārthadarśī sa buddhimān ity ādinā buddhimattvayogayuktatvasarvakarmakṛttvais tribhir dharmaiḥ stūyate /
analyzed: etādṛśaḥ parama artha darśī sa buddhimān iti ādinā buddhimat tva yoga yukta tva sarva karma kṛt tvaiḥ tribhiḥ dharmaiḥ stūyate
translated: Such a one who sees the highest truth is praised by the three qualities of being intelligent, being endowed with yoga, and being the doer of all actions, as stated by he who is intelligent and so on.

original: atra prathamapādena karmavikarmaṇos tattvaṃ karmaśabdasya vihitapratiṣiddhaparatvāt /
analyzed: atra prathama pādena karma vikarmaṇoḥ tattvam karma śabdasya vihita pratiṣiddha paratvāt
translated: In this (verse), the truth of right action and wrong action is shown by the first half, because the word 'action' refers to what is enjoined and what is prohibited.

original: dvitīyapādena cākarmaṇas tattvaṃ darśitam iti draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: dvitīya pādena ca akarmaṇaḥ tattvam darśitam iti draṣṭavyam
translated: And the truth of inaction should be understood to be shown by the second half.

original: tatra yat tvaṃ manyase karmaṇo bandhahetutvāt tūṣṇīm eva mayā sukhena sthātavyam iti tan mṛṣā /
analyzed: tatra yat tvam manyase karmaṇaḥ bandha hetu tvāt tūṣṇīm eva mayā sukhena sthātavyam iti tat mṛṣā
translated: There, what you think, that I should remain happily silent only because action is the cause of bondage, that is false.

original: asati kartṛtvābhimāne vihitasya pratiṣiddhasya vā karmaṇo bandhahetutvābhāvāt /
analyzed: asati kartṛ tva abhimāne vihitasya pratiṣiddhasya vā karmaṇaḥ bandha hetu tva abhāvāt
translated: Because when there is no sense of doership, an enjoined or prohibited action cannot be the cause of bondage.

original: tathā ca vyākhyātaṃ na māṃ karmāṇi limpanti Gītā / ity ādinā /
analyzed: tathā ca vyākhyātam na mām karmāṇi limpanti gītāḥ iti ādinā
translated: And it is explained in this way in the Gita, Actions do not touch Me.

original: satica kartṛtvābhimāne tūṣṇīm aham āsa ity audāsīnyābhimānātmakaṃ yat karma tad api bandhahetur eva vastutattvāparijñānāt /
analyzed: sati ca kartṛ tva abhimāne tūṣṇīm aham āse iti audāsīnya abhimāna ātmakam yat karma tat api bandha hetuḥ eva vastu tattva aparijñānāt
translated: And when there is a sense of doership, even that action which consists in the sense of neutrality, I remained silent, is indeed the cause of bondage, because of the lack of knowledge of the truth of things.

original: tasmāt karmavikarmākarmaṇāṃ tattvam īdṛśaṃ jñātvā vikarmākarmaṇī parityajya kartṛtvābhimānaphalābhisandhihānena vihitaṃ karmaiva kurv ity
analyzed: tasmāt karma vikarma akarmaṇām tattvam īdṛśam jñātvā vikarma akarmaṇī parityajya kartṛ tva abhimāna phala abhisandhi hānena vihitam karma eva kuru iti
translated: Therefore, having known the truth of right action, wrong action, and inaction to be like this, abandoning wrong action and inaction, perform only the enjoined action, by giving up the sense of doership and the desire for results.

original: abhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: abhiprāyaḥ
translated: This is the intention.

original: aparā vyākhyā karmaṇi jñānakarmaṇi dṛśye jaḍe sadrūpeṇa sphuraṇarūpeṇa cānusyūtaṃ sarvabhramādhiṣṭhānam akarmāvedyaṃ svaprakāśacaitanyaṃ
analyzed: aparā vyākhyā karmaṇi jñāna karmaṇi dṛśye jaḍe sat rūpeṇa sphuraṇa rūpeṇa ca anusyūtam sarva bhrama adhiṣṭhānam a karma a vedyam sva prakāśa caitanyam
translated: Another explanation: In the seen, inert action, which is pervaded by the real form and the form of manifestation, the basis of all illusions, the action that cannot be known, the self-luminous consciousness,

original: paramārthadṛṣṭyā yaḥ paśyet /
analyzed: paramārtha dṛṣṭyā yaḥ paśyet
translated: one who sees with the view of ultimate reality.

original: tathākarmaṇi ca svaprakāśe dṛgvastuni kalpitaṃ karma dṛśyaṃ māyāmayaṃ na paramārthasat /
analyzed: tathā akarmaṇi ca sva prakāśe dṛś vastuni kalpitam karma dṛśyam māyā mayam na paramārtha sat
translated: Similarly, in the self-luminous object of vision, the imagined action is seen, consisting of illusion, not ultimately real.

original: dṛgdṛśyayoḥ sambandhānupapatteḥ
analyzed: dṛś dṛśyayoḥ sambandha anupapatteḥ
translated: Because the relation between the seer and the seen is not possible.

original: yas tu sarvāṇi bhūtāni ātmany evānupaśyati /
analyzed: yaḥ tu sarvāṇi bhūtāni ātmani eva anupaśyati
translated: But he who sees all beings as existing in the self alone,

original: sarvabhūteṣu cātmānaṃ tato na vijugupsate //
analyzed: sarva bhūteṣu ca ātmānam tatas na vijugupsate
translated: and the self in all beings, he does not despise anyone.

original: ĪśaU iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: īśau iti śruteḥ
translated: Thus says the Śruti.

original: evaṃ parasparādhyāse 'pi śuddhaṃ vastu yaḥ paśyati manuṣyeṣu madhye sa eva buddhimān nānyaḥ /
analyzed: evam paraspara adhyāse śuddham vastu yaḥ paśyati manuṣyeṣu madhye saḥ eva buddhimān na anyaḥ
translated: Thus, even in mutual superimposition, he who sees the pure reality among men is the only wise one, not another.

original: asya paramārthadarśitvād anyasya cāparamārthadarśitvāt /
analyzed: asya paramārtha darśi tvāt anyasya ca a paramārtha darśi tvāt
translated: Because he sees the ultimate reality, and the other does not see the ultimate reality.

original: sa ca buddhisādhanayogyayukto 'ntaḥkaraṇaśuddhyaikāgracittaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca buddhi sādhana yogya yuktaḥ ntaḥkaraṇa śuddhyā ekāgra cittaḥ
translated: And he is fit for the means of knowledge, with a pure inner organ and a one-pointed mind.

original: ataḥ sa evāntaḥkaraṇaśuddhisādhanakṛtsnakarmakṛd iti vāstavadharmair eva stūyate /
analyzed: atas saḥ eva antaḥkaraṇa śuddhi sādhana kṛtsna karma kṛt iti vāstava dharmaiḥ eva stūyate
translated: Therefore, he alone is the doer of all actions for the purification of the inner organ. Thus, he is praised with real virtues.

original: yasmād evaṃ tasmāt tvam api paramārthadarśī bhava tāvataiva kṛtsnakarmakāritvopapatter ity abhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt evam tasmāt tvam api paramārtha darśī bhava tāvatā eva kṛtsna karma kāri tva upapatteḥ iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: Since it is so, therefore you also should become a seer of the ultimate truth, since that alone is sufficient for the performance of all actions. This is the idea.

original: ato yad uktaṃ yaj jñātvā mokṣyase 'śubhād iti /
analyzed: atas yat uktam yat jñātvā mokṣyase śubhāt iti
translated: Therefore, what was said: By knowing which you will be freed from evil,

original: yac coktaṃ karmādīnāṃ tattvaṃ boddhavyam astīti sa buddhimān ity ādistutiś ca /
analyzed: yat ca uktam karma ādīnām tattvam boddhavyam asti iti sa buddhimān iti ādi stutiḥ ca
translated: and what was said: The truth of action etc. should be known, and the praise beginning with He is wise -

original: tat sarvaṃ paramārthadarśane saṃgacchate /
analyzed: tat sarvam parama artha darśane saṃgacchate
translated: all that is consistent with the vision of the ultimate truth.

original: anyajñānād aśubhāt saṃsārān mokṣānupapatteḥ /
analyzed: anya jñānāt aśubhāt saṃsārāt mokṣa anupapatteḥ
translated: Because liberation from evil, i.e. from worldly existence, is not possible by knowing anything else.

original: atattvaṃ cānyan na boddhavyaṃ na vā yajjñāne buddhimattvam iti yuktaiva paramārthadarśināṃ vyākhyā /
analyzed: atattvam ca anyat na boddhavyam na vā yat jñāne buddhimat tvam iti yuktā eva parama artha darśinām vyākhyā
translated: And it is proper to explain that what is not the truth, i.e. what is other than that, should not be known, nor is there wisdom in knowing it.

original: yat tu vyākhyānaṃ karmaṇi nitye parameśvarārthe 'nuṣṭhīyamāne bandhahetutvābhāvād akarmedam iti yaḥ paśyet /
analyzed: yat tu vyākhyānam karmaṇi nitye parameśvara arthe nuṣṭhīyamāne bandha hetu tva abhāvāt akarma idam iti yaḥ paśyet
translated: But the explanation that when an eternal action is performed for the supreme Lord, it is seen as not being an action because it does not cause bondage,

original: tathākarmaṇi ca nityakarmākaraṇe pratyavāyahetutvena karmedam iti yaḥ paśyet sa buddhimān ity ādi tad asaṅgatam eva /
analyzed: tathā akarmaṇi ca nitya karma akaraṇe pratyavāya hetu tvena karma idam iti yaḥ paśyet sa buddhimān iti ādi tat asaṅgatam eva
translated: and similarly, when an eternal action is not performed, it is seen as an action because it causes an obstacle. He who sees thus is wise, etc. - that is indeed irrelevant.

original: nityakarmaṇy akarmedam iti jñānasyāśubhamokṣahetutvābhāvāt /
analyzed: nityakarmaṇi akarma idam iti jñānasya aśubha mokṣa hetu tva abhāvāt
translated: Because the knowledge that this is not an action in regard to obligatory rites is not a cause of the destruction of evil.

original: mithyājñānatvena tasyivāśubhatvāc ca /
analyzed: mithyā jñāna tvena tasya iva aśubha tvāt ca
translated: And because it is evil, like that, because it is false knowledge.

original: na caitādṛśaṃ mithyājñānaṃ boddhavyaṃ tattvaṃ nāpy etādṛśajñāne buddhimattvādistutyupapattir bhrāntitvāt /
analyzed: na ca etādṛśam mithyājñānam boddhavyam tattvam nā api etādṛśa jñāne buddhimat tva ādi stuti upapattiḥ bhrānti tvāt
translated: And such false knowledge is not to be known as reality, nor is the praise of intelligence, etc. possible in such knowledge, because it is erroneous.

original: nityakarmānuṣṭhānaṃ hi svarūpato 'ntaḥkaraṇaśuddhidvāropayujyate na tatrākarmabuddhiḥ kutrāpy upayujyate śāstreṇa nāmādiṣu brahmadṛṣṭivad
analyzed: nityakarma anuṣṭhānam hi svarūpataḥ ntaḥkaraṇa śuddhi dvārā upayujyate na tatra akarma buddhiḥ kutra api upayujyate śāstreṇa nāma ādiṣu brahma dṛṣṭi vat
translated: For the performance of obligatory rites is useful in its own form through the purification of the internal organ, not anywhere is the idea of non-action useful in that, like the view of Brahman in names, etc., in the scriptures.

original: avihitatvāt /
analyzed: a vihita tvāt
translated: Because it is not enjoined.

original: nāpīdam eva vākyaṃ tadvidhāyakam upakramādivirodhasyokteḥ /
analyzed: nā api idam eva vākyam tad vidhāyakam upakrama ādi virodhasya ukteḥ
translated: Nor does this very sentence enjoin it, because of the contradiction with the introductory passage, etc., as stated.

original: evaṃ nityakarmākaraṇam api svarūpato nityakarmaviruddhakarmalakṣakatayopayujyate na tu
analyzed: evam nitya karma akaraṇam api svarūpataḥ nitya karma viruddha karma lakṣaka tayā upayujyate na tu
translated: Thus, the non-performance of obligatory rites is also useful in its own form as indicating the rite that is contrary to the obligatory rite, but not

original: tatra karmadṛṣṭiḥ kvāpy upayujyate /
analyzed: tatra karma dṛṣṭiḥ kvāpi upayujyate
translated: anywhere is the view of action in that useful.

original: nāpi nityakarmākaraṇāt pratyavāyaḥ /
analyzed: na api nitya karma akaraṇāt pratyavāyaḥ
translated: Nor is there a legal flaw from the non-performance of obligatory rites.

original: abhāvād bhāvotpattyayogāt /
analyzed: abhāvāt bhāva utpatti ayogāt
translated: Because of the impossibility of the origination of an existent from a non-existent.

original: anyathā tadaviśeṣeṇa sarvadā kāryotpattiprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: anyathā tad aviśeṣeṇa sarvadā kārya utpatti prasaṅgāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be the consequence of the origination of the effect at all times without distinction.

original: bhāvārthāḥ karmaśabdās tebhyaḥ kriyā pratīyetaiṣa hy artho vidhīyata iti nyāyena bhāvārthasyaivāpūrvajanakatvāt /
analyzed: bhāva arthāḥ karma śabdāḥ tebhyaḥ kriyā pratīyeta eṣa hi arthaḥ vidhīyate iti nyāyena bhāva arthasya eva apūrva janaka tvāt
translated: The words denoting action refer to the existent, and from them the action is understood, because it is the existent alone that produces the unseen effect, according to the principle that this is what is enjoined.

original: atirātre ṣoḍaśinaṃ na gṛhṇāti ity ādāv api saṅkalpaviśeṣasyaivāpūrvajanakatvābhyupagamāt /
analyzed: atirātre ṣoḍaśinam na gṛhṇāti iti ādau api saṅkalpa viśeṣasya eva apūrva janaka tva abhyupagamāt
translated: Even in cases like He does not take the ṣoḍaśin cup at the atirātra, the specific intention alone is accepted as producing the unseen effect.

original: nekṣetodyantam ādityam ity ādiprajāpativratavat /
analyzed: na īkṣeta udyantam ādityam iti ādi prajāpativrata vat
translated: Like the vow of Prajāpati beginning with One should not look at the rising sun.

original: ato nityakarmānuṣṭhānārhe kāle tadviruddhatayā yadupaveśanādi karma tad eva nityakarmākaraṇopalakṣitaṃ pratyavāyahetur iti vaidikānāṃ
analyzed: atas nitya karma anuṣṭhāna arhe kāle tad viruddha tayā yat upaveśana ādi karma tat eva nitya karma akaraṇa upalakṣitam pratyavāya hetuḥ iti vaidikānām
translated: Therefore, at the time suitable for the performance of obligatory rites, the act of sitting down etc. which is contrary to that is itself the cause of the undesirable consequence, as indicated by the non-performance of the obligatory rites, according to the followers of the Vedas.

original: ataevākurvan vihitaṃ karmety atra lakṣaṇārthe śatā vyākhyātaḥ /
analyzed: ataeva akurvan vihitam karma iti atra lakṣaṇa arthe śatā vyākhyātaḥ
translated: And for this very reason, the word akurvan (not performing) is explained in the sense of lakṣaṇa (indicating) in the sentence akurvan vidhi-kṛtaṃ karma (one who does not perform the enjoined rite).

original: lakṣaṇahetvoḥ kriyāyā ity aviśeṣasmaraṇe 'py atra hetutvānupapatteḥ /
analyzed: lakṣaṇa hetvoḥ kriyāyāḥ iti a viśeṣa smaraṇe pi atra hetu tva anupapatteḥ
translated: Even though there is a general rule that lakṣaṇa (indicating) and hetu (cause) are used interchangeably, here hetu (cause) is not appropriate.

original: tasmān mithyādarśanāpanode prastute mithyādarśanavyākhyānaṃ
analyzed: tasmāt mithyādarśana apanode prastute mithyādarśana vyākhyānam
translated: Therefore, when the removal of false views is being discussed, the explanation of false views

original: na śobhatetarām /
analyzed: na śobhatetarām
translated: does not shine forth.

original: nāpi nityānuṣṭhānaparam evaitad vākyaṃ nityāni kuryād ity arthe karmaṇy akarma yaḥ
analyzed: nā api nitya anuṣṭhāna param eva etat vākyam nityāni kuryāt iti arthe karmaṇi akarma yaḥ
translated: Nor is this sentence solely concerned with the performance of obligatory rites, as it means one should perform the obligatory rites, in the sense of karmaṇy akarma yogaḥ (yoga is non-attachment to action).

original: paśyed ity ādi tadabodhakaraṃ vākyaṃ prayuñjānasya bhagavataḥ pratārakatvāpatter
analyzed: paśyet iti ādi tad abodha karam vākyam prayuñjānasya bhagavataḥ pratāraka tva āpatteḥ
translated: The Lord, who employs the sentence beginning with one should see to convey that, would be guilty of deception.

original: ity ādi bhāṣya eva vistareṇa vyākhyātam ity uparamyate // //
analyzed: iti ādi bhāṣye eva vistareṇa vyākhyātam iti uparamyate
translated: This has been explained in detail in the Bhāṣya beginning with iti. Therefore, I desist.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Viśvanātha.

original: tatra karmākarmaṇos tattvabodham āha karmaṇīti /
analyzed: tatra karma akarmaṇoḥ tattva bodham āha karmaṇi iti
translated: There, he states the knowledge of the truth of action and inaction with the words karmaṇi....

original: śuddhāntaḥkaraṇasya jñānavattve 'pi janakāder ivākṛtasannyāsasya karmaṇy anuṣṭhīyamāne niṣkāmakarmayoge akarma /
analyzed: śuddha antaḥkaraṇasya jñānavat tve pi janaka ādeḥ iva akṛta sannyāsasya karmaṇi anuṣṭhīyamāne niṣkāma karmayoge akarma
translated: Even for one with a pure inner organ who possesses knowledge, like Janaka and others, who have not renounced actions, in the performance of actionless action, i.e., action without desire for results, one should see inaction.

original: karmedaṃ na bhavatīti yaḥ paśyet tatkarmaṇo bandhakatvābhāvāt iti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: karma idam na bhavati iti yaḥ paśyet tad karmaṇaḥ bandhaka tva abhāvāt iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that this action does not lead to bondage.

original: tathāśuddhāntaḥkaraṇasya jñānābhāve 'pi śāstrajñatvāt jñānavāvadūkasya sannyāsino 'karmaṇi karmākaraṇe karma paśyet durgatiprāpakaṃ karmabandham
analyzed: tathā śuddha antaḥkaraṇasya jñāna abhāve pi śāstra jña tvāt jñāna vāvadūkasya sannyāsinaḥ karmaṇi karma akaraṇe karma paśyet durgati prāpakam karma bandham
translated: Similarly, even for one without a pure inner organ who lacks knowledge, but who is a renouncer who speaks of knowledge because of knowing the scriptures, one should see action in inaction, i.e., the non-performance of action, as leading to a bad state, as bondage of action leading to rebirth.

original: evopalabhate /
analyzed: eva upalabhate
translated: One perceives it as such.

original: sa eva buddhimān /
analyzed: saḥ eva buddhimān
translated: He alone is wise.

original: sa tu kṛtsnakarmāṇy eva karoti /
analyzed: sa tu kṛtsna karmāṇi eva karoti
translated: But he performs all actions.

original: na tu tasya jñānavāvadūkasya jñānimāninaḥ saṅgenāpi tadvacasāpi sannyāsaṃ na karotīti bhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na tu tasya jñāna vāvadūkasya jñāni māninaḥ saṅgena api tad vacasā api sannyāsam na karoti iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The idea is that he does not renounce even through association with or the words of that one who speaks of knowledge but is proud of being a knower of Brahman.

original: tathā ca bhagavadvākyam
analyzed: tathā ca bhagavat vākyam
translated: And thus is the statement of the Blessed Lord:

original: yas tv asaṃyataṣaḍvargaḥ pracaṇḍendriyasārathiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu asaṃyata ṣaḍvargaḥ pracaṇḍa indriya sārathiḥ
translated: But he who has not controlled the six senses, whose charioteer is the turbulent senses,

original: jñānavairāgyarahitas tridaṇḍam upajīvati //
analyzed: jñāna vairāgya rahitaḥ tridaṇḍam upajīvati
translated: who is devoid of knowledge and detachment, and who lives on the three staffs (i.e. is a mendicant),

original: surān ātmānam ātmasthaṃ nihnute māṃ ca dharmahā /
analyzed: surān ātmānam ātma stham nihnute mām ca dharma hā
translated: he denies the gods, the Self, and the Self-abiding Me, and is a destroyer of Dharma.

original: avipakvakaṣāyo 'smād amuṣmāc ca vihīyate // BhP / / iti ////
analyzed: a vipakva kaṣāyaḥ smāt amuṣmāt ca vihīyate bhp iti
translated: Because his impurities are not ripe, he falls from this and the next world.

original: baladevaḥ / karmākarmaṇor boddhavyaṃ svarūpam āha karmaṇīti /🔽anuṣṭhīyamāne niṣkāme karmaṇi yo 'karma prastutatvāt karmaṇy ātmajñānaṃ paśyet /
analyzed: baladevaḥ karma akarmaṇoḥ boddhavyam svarūpam āha karmaṇi iti  anuṣṭhīyamāne niṣkāme karmaṇi karma prastuta tvāt karmaṇi ātma jñānam paśyet
translated: Balarama. He states the nature of action and inaction as follows: One should know the nature of action and inaction.🔽One should see inaction in action, O son of Kunti, and see action in inaction.

original: akarmaṇy ātmajñāne yaḥ karma paśyet /
analyzed: akarmaṇi ātma jñāne yaḥ karma paśyet
translated: One should see action in inaction, O son of Kunti, and see inaction in action.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati yo mumukṣur hṛdviśuddhaye kriyamāṇaṃ karmātmajñānānusandhigarbhatvāj jñānākāraṃ /
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati yaḥ mumukṣuḥ hṛd viśuddhaye kriyamāṇam karma ātma jñāna anusandhi garbha tvāt jñāna ākāram
translated: This is what is meant: The seeker of liberation should see the action being performed for the purification of the heart as having the form of knowledge, because it is filled with the continuity of knowledge of the Self.

original: tac ca jñānaṃ karmadvārakatvāt karmākāraṃ paśyet /
analyzed: tat ca jñānam karma dvāraka tvāt karma ākāram paśyet
translated: And that knowledge, because it is attained through the door of action, should be seen as having the form of action.

original: ubhayor ekātmoddeśyatvād ubhayam ekaṃ vidyād ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: ubhayoḥ eka ātma uddeśya tvāt ubhayam ekam vidyāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that one should know both as one, because they have the same Self as their object.

original: evam eva vakṣyate sāṅkhyayogau pṛthag bālāḥ ity ādineti /
analyzed: evam eva vakṣyate sāṅkhya yogau pṛthak bālāḥ iti ādinā iti
translated: This is exactly what will be said by The foolish ones practice Sankhya and Yoga separately and so on.

original: evam anuṣṭhīyamāne karmaṇi ātmayāthātmyaṃ yo 'nusandhatte sa manuṣyeṣu buddhimān paṇḍitaḥ /
analyzed: evam anuṣṭhīyamāne karmaṇi ātma yāthātmyam yaḥ anusandhatte sa manuṣyeṣu buddhimān paṇḍitaḥ
translated: He who, when this performance of action is being done, understands the truth about the Self, he is the wise one among men.

original: yukto mokṣayogyaḥ /
analyzed: yuktaḥ mokṣa yogyaḥ
translated: He is fit for liberation.

original: kṛtsnakarmakṛt sarveṣāṃ karmaphalānām ātmajñānasukhāntarbhūtatvāt ////
analyzed: kṛtsna karma kṛt sarveṣām karma phalānām ātma jñāna sukha antarbhūta tvāt
translated: He is the doer of all actions, because all the results of actions are included in the bliss of the knowledge of the Self.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: (Bhagavadgita 4.19)

original: yasya sarve samārambhāḥ kāmasaṃkalpavarjitāḥ /
analyzed: yasya sarve samārambhāḥ kāma saṃkalpa varjitāḥ
translated: He whose undertakings are all free from desire and wishful thinking,

original: jñānāgnidagdhakarmāṇaṃ tam āhuḥ paṇḍitaṃ budhāḥ ////
analyzed: jñāna agni dagdha karmāṇam tam āhuḥ paṇḍitam budhāḥ
translated: The wise call him a learned man, whose actions have been burnt by the fire of knowledge.🔽(Bhagavadgita 4.20)

original: śrīdharaḥ / karmaṇy akarma yaḥ paśyed ity anena śrutyarthārthāpattibhyāṃ yad uktam arthadvandvaṃ tad eva spaṣṭayati yasyeti pañcabhiḥ /
analyzed: eva            eva               eva                                  eva
translated: Sridhar: By the verse One who sees inaction in action... he has stated the two meanings inferred from the meaning of the Upanishad. He clarifies that very pair of meanings with the five verses beginning with Yasyah (whose).

original: samyag ārabhyanta iti samārambhāḥ karmāṇi /
analyzed: samyak ārabhyante iti samārambhāḥ karmāṇi
translated: Samarabhyanta means are undertaken. The undertakings are actions.

original: kāmyata iti kāmaḥ phalam /
analyzed: kāmyate iti kāmaḥ phalam
translated: Kama means desired, the result.

original: tatsaṅkalpena varjitā yasya bhavanti taṃ paṇḍitam āhuḥ /
analyzed: tad saṅkalpena varjitāḥ yasya bhavanti tam paṇḍitam āhuḥ
translated: They say he is a learned man whose undertakings are free from that wishful thinking.

original: tatra hetur yatas taiḥ samārambhaiḥ śuddhe citte sati jātena jñānāgninā dagdhāny akarmatāṃ nītāni karmāṇi yasya tam /
analyzed: tatra hetuḥ yatas taiḥ samārambhaiḥ śuddhe citte sati jātena jñāna agninā dagdhāni akarma tām nītāni karmāṇi yasya tam
translated: The reason for that is: Yatas, because, when the mind is purified by those undertakings, the actions of him whose actions have been burnt by the fire of knowledge that has arisen and have been made into non-action, him.

original: ārūḍhāvasthāyāṃ tu kāmaḥ phalahetuviṣayaḥ /
analyzed: ārūḍha avasthāyām tu kāmaḥ phala hetu viṣayaḥ
translated: But in the state of being engaged, desire is the cause of the result.

original: tadartham idaṃ kartavyam iti kartavyaviṣayaḥ saṅkalpaḥ /
analyzed: tad artham idam kartavyam iti kartavya viṣayaḥ saṅkalpaḥ
translated: The resolve is about the duty, thinking, This should be done for that purpose.

original: tābhyāṃ varjitāḥ /
analyzed: tābhyām varjitāḥ
translated: They are free from those two.

original: śeṣaṃ spaṣṭam ////
analyzed: śeṣam spaṣṭam
translated: The rest is clear.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: tad etat paramārthadarśinaḥ kartṛtvābhimānābhāvena karmāliptatvaṃ prapañcyate yasya sarva ity ādi brahmakarmasamādhinety antena /
analyzed: tat etat paramārtha darśinaḥ kartṛ tva abhimāna abhāvena karma ālipta tvam prapañcyate yasya sarve iti ādi brahma karma samādhinā iti antena
translated: This is being elaborated on the unstainedness of the one who sees the supreme truth by the absence of the conceit of being the agent, from for whom all up to by the concentration on Brahman and action.

original: yasya pūrvoktaparamārthadarśinaḥ sarve yāvanto vaidikā laukikā vā samārambhāḥ samārabhyanta
analyzed: yasya pūrva ukta parama artha darśinaḥ sarve yāvantaḥ vaidikāḥ laukikāḥ vā samārambhāḥ samārabhyanta
translated: For whom, the one who sees the supreme truth as described above, all the undertakings, as many as there are, whether Vedic or worldly, are undertaken.

original: iti vyutpattyā karmāṇi kāmasaṅkalpavarjitāḥ kāmaḥ phalatṛṣṇā saṅkalpo 'haṃ karomīti
analyzed: iti vyutpattyā karmāṇi kāma saṅkalpa varjitāḥ kāmaḥ phala tṛṣṇā saṅkalpaḥ ham karomi iti
translated: By the derivation of the word samārambha as samārabhyante (are undertaken), the actions are free from desire and resolve. Desire is the craving for results. Resolve is the conceit of being the agent, thinking I am doing this.

original: kartṛtvābhimānas tābhyāṃ varjitāḥ /
analyzed: kartṛ tva abhimānaḥ tābhyām varjitāḥ
translated: They are free from those two.

original: lokasaṅgrahāthaṃ vā jīvanamātrārthaṃ vā prārabdhakarmavegād vṛthāceṣṭārūpā bhavanti /
analyzed: loka saṅgraha atham vā jīvana mātra artham vā prārabdha karma vegāt vṛthā ceṣṭā rūpāḥ bhavanti
translated: They become mere purposeless activities due to the momentum of the previously performed actions, either for the sake of maintaining the world or for the sake of mere sustenance.

original: taṃ karmādāv akarmādidarśanaṃ jñānaṃ tad evāgnis tena dagdhāni śubhāśubhalakṣaṇāni
analyzed: tam karma ādau a karma ādi darśanam jñānam tat eva agniḥ tena dagdhāni śubha aśubha lakṣaṇāni
translated: That knowledge, which is the seeing of non-action etc. in action etc., is itself the fire. By that, the auspicious and inauspicious signs are burned.

original: karmāṇi yasya tadadhigama uttarapūrvārdhayor aśleṣavināśau tadvyapadeśāt Vs🔽iti nyāyāt /
analyzed: karmāṇi yasya tad adhigamaḥ uttara pūrva ardhayoḥ aśleṣa vināśau tad vyapadeśāt  iti nyāyāt
translated: The actions of him who has attained that are the non-adhesion and destruction in the latter half and the eastern half, because of the designation of that, according to the rule.🔽🔽

original: jñānāgnidagdhakarmāṇaṃ taṃ budhā brahmavidaḥ paramārthataḥ paṇḍitam āhuḥ
analyzed: jñāna agni dagdha karmāṇam tam budhāḥ brahma vidaḥ paramārthataḥ paṇḍitam āhuḥ
translated: Whose actions are burned by the fire of knowledge, him the wise, the knowers of Brahman, call truly wise.

original: samyagdarśī hi paṇḍita ucyate na tu bhrānta ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: samyak darśī hi paṇḍitaḥ ucyate na tu bhrāntaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: For one who has right insight is called wise, not one who is deluded, is the meaning.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: uktam arthaṃ vivṛṇoti yasyeti pañcabhiḥ /
analyzed: uktam artham vivṛṇoti yasya iti pañcabhiḥ
translated: He explains the stated meaning with five verses beginning with whose.

original: samyag ārabhyanta iti samārambhāḥ karmāṇi /
analyzed: samyak ārabhyante iti samārambhāḥ karmāṇi
translated: Actions are called to be begun because they are begun properly.

original: kāmaḥ phalaṃ /
analyzed: kāmaḥ phalam
translated: Desire is the result.

original: tatsaṅkalpena varjitāḥ /
analyzed: tad saṅkalpena varjitāḥ
translated: They are devoid of that intention.

original: jñānam evāgnis tena dagdhāni karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni vihitāni niṣiddhāni ca yasya saḥ /
analyzed: jñānam eva agniḥ tena dagdhāni karmāṇi kriyamāṇāni vihitāni niṣiddhāni ca yasya saḥ
translated: He whose actions, whether enjoined or prohibited, are being burned by the fire of knowledge itself, by that.

original: etena vikarmaṇaś ca boddhavyam ity api vivṛtam /
analyzed: etena vikarmaṇaḥ ca boddhavyam iti api vivṛtam
translated: By this, and also of wrong action is explained.

original: etādṛśādhikāriṇi karma yathā akarma paśyet /
analyzed: etādṛśa adhikāriṇi karma yathā akarma paśyet
translated: In such an authorized person, action should be seen as inaction.

original: tathaiva vikarmāpy akarmaiva paśyed iti pūrvaślokasyaiva saṅgatiḥ /
analyzed: tathā eva vikarma api akarma eva paśyet iti pūrva ślokasya eva saṅgatiḥ
translated: In the same way, wrong action also should be seen as inaction only. This is the connection with the previous verse.

original: yad agre vakṣyate
analyzed: yat agre vakṣyate
translated: What will be said later:

original: api ced asi pāpebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pāpakṛttamaḥ /
analyzed: api ced asi pāpebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pāpa kṛttamaḥ
translated: Even if you are the worst of all sinners,

original: sarvaṃ jñānaplavenaiva vṛjinaṃ santariṣyasi //
analyzed: sarvam jñāna plavena eva vṛjinam santariṣyasi
translated: You will cross over all difficulties by the raft of knowledge alone.

original: yathaidhāṃsi samiddho 'gnir bhasmasāt kurute 'rjuna /
analyzed: yathā edhāṃsi samiddhaḥ gniḥ bhasmasāt kurute rjuna
translated: Just as a fire well ablaze reduces wood to ashes, O Arjuna,

original: jñānāgniḥ sarvakarmāṇi bhasmasāt kurute tathā // Gītā / iti ////
analyzed: jñāna agniḥ sarva karmāṇi bhasmasāt kurute tathā gītā iti
translated: so does the fire of knowledge reduce all actions to ashes.

original: baladevaḥ / karmaṇo jñānākāram āha yasyeti pañcabhiḥ /
analyzed: baladevaḥ karmaṇaḥ jñāna ākāram āha yasya iti pañcabhiḥ
translated: Balarama: He speaks of action in the form of knowledge with five verses beginning with yasya.

original: samārambhāḥ karmāṇi kāmyanta iti kāmāḥ phalāni tatsaṅkalpena varjitāḥ śūnyā yasya karmabhir ātmoddeśino bhavanti /
analyzed: samārambhāḥ karmāṇi kāmyante iti kāmāḥ phalāni tad saṅkalpena varjitāḥ śūnyāḥ yasya karmabhiḥ ātma uddeśinaḥ bhavanti
translated: Those whose actions are devoid of the desire for results, which are the fruits of actions, due to the intention for that, are empty and are dedicated to the Self.

original: taṃ budhāḥ paṇḍitam ātmajñam āhuḥ /
analyzed: tam budhāḥ paṇḍitam ātma jñam āhuḥ
translated: The wise call him a wise man who knows the Self.

original: tatra hetuḥ jñāneti /
analyzed: tatra hetuḥ jñāna iti
translated: The reason for that is stated in jnanena.

original: taiḥ samārambhair hṛdviśuddhau satyām āvirbhūtenātmajñānāgninā dagdhāni saṃcitāni karmāṇi yasya tam ////
analyzed: taiḥ samārambhaiḥ hṛd viśuddhau satyām āvirbhūtena ātma jñāna agninā dagdhāni saṃcitāni karmāṇi yasya tam
translated: He whose accumulated actions are burned by the fire of knowledge of the Self, which has manifested due to the purity of the heart through those undertakings, him...

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: tyaktvā karmaphalāsaṅgaṃ nityatṛpto nirāśrayaḥ /
analyzed: tyaktvā karma phala āsaṅgam nitya tṛptaḥ nirāśrayaḥ
translated: Having renounced attachment to the fruits of action, always satisfied, without support,

original: karmaṇy abhipravṛtto 'pi naiva kiṃcit karoti saḥ ////
analyzed: karmaṇi na eva kiṃcid karoti saḥ
translated: even though engaged in action, he does not do anything at all.

original: śrīdharaḥ / kiṃ ca tyaktveti /
analyzed: ca
translated: Sridhar: And what? Having renounced etc.

original: karmaṇi tatphale cāsaktiṃ tyaktvā nityena nijānandena tṛptaḥ /
analyzed: karmaṇi tad phale ca āsaktim tyaktvā nityena nija ānandena tṛptaḥ
translated: Having renounced attachment to action and its fruits, satisfied with one's own bliss,

original: ataeva yogakṣemārtham āśrayaṇīyarahitaḥ /
analyzed: ataeva yogakṣema artham āśrayaṇīya rahitaḥ
translated: And therefore, he is without a support for the sake of yoga and kshema.

original: evambhūto yaḥ svābhāvike vihite vā karmaṇy abhitaḥ pravṛtto 'pi kiṃcid eva naiva karoti /
analyzed: evambhūtaḥ yaḥ svābhāvike vihite vā karmaṇi abhitas pravṛttaḥ u pi kiṃcid eva nā eva karoti
translated: Such a one, even though engaged in natural or enjoined actions, does not do anything at all.

original: tasya karmākarmatām āpadyata ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: tasya karma akarma tām āpadyate iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that his actions become non-actions.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: bhavatu jñānāgninā prāktanānām aprārabdhakarmaṇāṃ dāha āgāmināṃ cānutpattiḥ /
analyzed: bhavatu jñāna agninā prāktanānām aprārabdha karmaṇām dāhaḥ āgāminām ca anutpattiḥ
translated: Let there be the burning of past unexecuted actions by the fire of knowledge and the non-arising of future ones.

original: jñānotpattikāle kriyamāṇaṃ tu pūrvottarayor anantarbhāvāt phalāya bhaved iti bhavet kasyacid āśaṅkā tām apanudaty āha tyaktveti /
analyzed: jñāna utpatti kāle kriyamāṇam tu pūrva uttarayoḥ anantarbhāvāt phalāya bhavet iti bhavet kasyacid āśaṅkā tām apanudati āha tyaktvā iti
translated: But there may be some doubt that the action being done at the time of the arising of knowledge would lead to results because it is not included in the past and future. To dispel that, he says by renouncing etc.

original: karmaṇi phale cāsaṅgaṃ kartṛtvābhimānaṃ bhogābhilāṣaṃ ca tyaktvākartrabhoktrātmasamyagdarśanena bādhitvā nityatṛptaḥ paramānandasvarūpalābhena
analyzed: karmaṇi phale ca asaṅgam kartṛ tva abhimānam bhoga abhilāṣam ca tyaktvā a kartṛ a bhoktṛ ātma samyak darśanena bādhitvā nitya tṛptaḥ paramānanda sva rūpa lābhena
translated: Having renounced attachment to action and results, the sense of being the doer, and the desire to enjoy, having negated them by the correct knowledge of the self as neither the doer nor the enjoyer, being ever-contented, having attained the nature of supreme bliss,

original: sarvatra nirākāṅkṣaḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra nirākāṅkṣaḥ
translated: being desireless everywhere,

original: nirāśraya āśrayo dehendriyādir advaitadarśanena nirgato yasmāt sa nirāśrayo dehendriyādyabhimānaśūnyaḥ /
analyzed: nirāśrayaḥ āśrayaḥ deha indriya ādiḥ advaita darśanena nirgataḥ yasmāt sa nirāśrayaḥ deha indriya ādi abhimāna śūnyaḥ
translated: being without a support, having gone beyond the body, senses, etc. by the vision of non-duality, he who is without a support, devoid of the sense of identification with the body, senses, etc.,

original: phalakāmanāyāḥ kartṛtvābhimānasya ca nivṛttau hetugarbhaṃ krameṇa viśeṣaṇadvayam /
analyzed: phala kāmanāyāḥ kartṛ tva abhimānasya ca nivṛttau hetu garbham krameṇa viśeṣaṇa dvayam
translated: The two qualifications, which contain the reason, are stated in order to bring about the cessation of the desire for results and the sense of being the doer.🔽Such a one, who is liberated while living, even when engaged in Vedic or worldly actions during the waking state, due to the power of past karma,

original: evambhūto jīvanmukto vyutthānadaśāyāṃ karmaṇi vaidike laukike vābhipravṛtto 'pi prārabdhakarmavaśāl lokadṛṣṭyābhitaḥ sāṅgopāṅgānuṣṭhānāya
analyzed: evambhūtaḥ jīvanmuktaḥ vyutthāna daśāyām karmaṇi vaidike laukike vā abhipravṛttaḥ pi prārabdha karma vaśāt loka dṛṣṭyā abhitas sa aṅga upāṅga anuṣṭhānāya
translated: appears to be engaged in the performance of actions along with their auxiliaries from the worldly point of view.

original: pravṛtto 'pi svadṛṣṭyā naiva kiṃcit karoti sa niṣkriyātmadarśanena bādhitatvād ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: pravṛttaḥ sva dṛṣṭyā nā eva kiṃcid karoti sa niṣkriya ātma darśanena bādhita tvāt iti arthaḥ
translated: But from his own point of view, he does not do anything at all, because that is negated by the vision of the inactive Self.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: nityatṛpto nityaṃ nijānandaena tṛptaḥ /
translated: Ever-contented: always satisfied with one's own bliss.

original: nirāśrayaḥ svayogakṣemārthaṃ na kam apy āśrayate ////
analyzed: nirāśrayaḥ sva yogakṣema artham na kam api āśrayate
translated: Without support: does not depend on anyone for one's own welfare.

original: baladevaḥ / uktam arthaṃ viśadayati tyaktveti /
translated: Baladeva: To clarify the meaning stated, he says having renounced etc.

original: karmaphale saṅgaṃ tyaktvā nityenātmanānubhūtena tṛpto nirāśrayo yogakṣemaārtahm apy āśrayarahita īdṛśo yo 'dhikārī sa karmaṇy abhitaḥ pravṛtto
analyzed: karma phale saṅgam tyaktvā nityena ātmanā anubhūtena tṛptaḥ nirāśrayaḥ api āśraya rahitaḥ īdṛśaḥ yaḥ dhikārī sa karmaṇi abhitas
translated: One who is qualified as such, who has renounced attachment to the fruits of action, who is satisfied with the experience of the eternal Self, who is without support, who is free from dependence even for one's own welfare, who is engaged in action from all sides,

original: 'pi naiva kiṃcit karoti /
analyzed: pi na eva kiṃcid karoti
translated: does not do anything at all.

original: karmānuṣṭhānāpadeśena jñānaniṣṭhām eva sampādayatīty ārurukṣor daśeyam /
analyzed: karma anuṣṭhāna apadeśena jñāna niṣṭhām eva sampādayati iti ārurukṣoḥ daśā iyam
translated: This stage is for one who is desirous of ascending to the stage of knowledge by means of the pretext of performing rites.

original: etena vikarmaṇaḥ svarūpaṃ bandhakatvaṃ boddhavyam ity uktaṃ bhavati ////
analyzed: etena vikarmaṇaḥ svarūpam bandhaka tvam boddhavyam iti uktam bhavati
translated: By this it is said that the nature of wrong action and its bondage should be understood.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: (Bhagavad Gita 4.14)

original: nirāśīr yatacittātmā tyaktasarvaparigrahaḥ /
analyzed: nirāśīḥ yata citta ātmā tyakta sarva parigrahaḥ
translated: Without desire, with mind and self controlled, renouncing all undertakings,🔽Performing only the bodily actions, he does not incur sin.

original: śārīraṃ kevalaṃ karma kurvan nāpnoti kilbiṣam ////
analyzed: śārīram kevalam karma kurvan na āpnoti kilbiṣam
translated: (Bhagavad Gita 4.15)

original: śrīdharaḥ / kiṃ ca nirāśīr iti /
analyzed: ca
translated: And (the Lord) says, Without desire, with mind and self controlled, renouncing all undertakings, etc.

original: nirgatā āśiṣaḥ kāmanā yasmāt /
analyzed: nirgatāḥ āśiṣaḥ kāmanāḥ yasmāt
translated: One from whom desires, wishes, have gone out.

original: yataṃ niyataṃ cittam ātmā śarīraṃ ca yasya /
analyzed: yatam niyatam cittam ātmā śarīram ca yasya
translated: One whose mind is restrained, controlled, and whose self, body, is also so.

original: tyaktāḥ sarve parigraho yena /
analyzed: tyaktāḥ sarve parigrahaḥ yena
translated: One who has renounced all possessions.

original: sa śarīraṃ śarīramātranirvartyaṃ kartṛtvābhiniveśarahitaṃ kurvann api kilbiṣam bandhanaṃ na prāpnoti /
analyzed: sa śarīram śarīra mātra nirvartyam kartṛ tva abhiniveśa rahitam kurvan api kilbiṣam bandhanam na prāpnoti
translated: He, even while performing bodily actions, which are to be done only by the body, and which are devoid of the attachment to the idea of being the doer, does not incur sin, bondage.

original: yogārūḍhapakṣe śārīranirvāhamātropayogi svābhāvikaṃ bhikṣāṭanādi kurvann api kilbiṣaṃ vihitākaraṇanimittadoṣaṃ na prāpnoti ////🔽madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: yoga ārūḍha pakṣe śārīra nirvāha mātra upayogi svābhāvikam bhikṣā aṭana ādi kurvan api kilbiṣam vihita akaraṇa nimitta doṣam na prāpnoti 🔽madhusūdanaḥ
translated: In the case of one who has ascended to Yoga, even while performing the natural bodily actions like begging for alms, which are useful only for the maintenance of the body, he does not incur sin, the fault arising from not doing what is enjoined.

original: yadātyantavikṣepahetor api jyotiṣṭomādeḥ samyagjñānavaśān na tatphalajanakatvaṃ
analyzed: yadā atyanta vikṣepa hetoḥ api jyotiṣṭoma ādeḥ samyak jñāna vaśāt na tad phala janaka tvam
translated: When even the Jyotiṣṭoma, etc., which are the cause of extreme distraction, do not produce their results due to perfect knowledge,

original: tadā śarīrasthitimātrahetor avikṣepakasya bhikṣāṭanāder nāsty eva bandhahetutvam
analyzed: tadā śarīra sthiti mātra hetoḥ avikṣepakasya bhikṣā aṭana ādeḥ nā asti eva bandha hetu tvam
translated: then for one who begs for alms, etc., which are not distracting and are merely for the sake of maintaining the body, there is no cause of bondage at all.

original: iti kaimutyanyāyenāha nirāśīr iti /
analyzed: iti kaimutya nyāyena āha nirāśīḥ iti
translated: Thus, by the rule of reductio ad absurdum, he says without desire and so on.

original: nirāśīr gatatṛṣṇo yatacittātmā cittam antaḥkaraṇam ātmā bāhyendriyasahito dehas tau saṃyatau pratyāhāreṇa nigṛhītau yena saḥ /
analyzed: nirāśīḥ gata tṛṣṇaḥ yata citta ātmā cittam antaḥkaraṇam ātmā bāhya indriya sahitaḥ dehaḥ tau saṃyatau pratyāhāreṇa nigṛhītau yena saḥ
