original: kumbhakena prāṇāpānagatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāmaparāyaṇāḥ santaḥ prāṇān indriyāṇi prāṇeṣu juhvati /
analyzed: kumbhakena prāṇa apāna gatīḥ ruddhvā prāṇāyāma parāyaṇāḥ santaḥ prāṇān indriyāṇi prāṇeṣu juhvati
translated: By means of Kumbhaka, having stopped the course of Prana and Apana, being devoted to Pranayama, they offer the senses into the Prana.

original: kumbhake hi sarve prāṇā ekībhavantīti tatraiva layamāneṣv indriyeṣu homaṃ bhāvayantīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: kumbhake hi sarve prāṇāḥ ekībhavanti iti tatra eva layamāneṣu indriyeṣu homam bhāvayanti iti arthaḥ
translated: For in Kumbhaka all the Prana breaths become one. The meaning is that they contemplate the offering when the senses are merged there itself.

original: tad uktaṃ yogaśāstre
analyzed: tat uktam yogaśāstre
translated: That is said in the Yoga Shastra:

original: yathā yathā sadābhyāsān manasaḥ sthiratā bhavet /
analyzed: yathā yathā sadā abhyāsāt manasaḥ sthira tā bhavet
translated: As the mind becomes steady by constant practice,

original: vāyuvākkāyadṛṣṭīnāṃ sthiratā ca tathā tathā // iti ////
analyzed: vāyu vāc kāya dṛṣṭīnām sthira tā ca tathā tathā iti
translated: so do the breath, speech, body and vision become steady.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: apāne juhvati prāṇaṃ prāṇe 'pānaṃ tathāpare prāṇāpānagatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāmaparāyaṇāḥ ////
analyzed: apāne juhvati prāṇam prāṇe pānam tathā apare prāṇa apāna gatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāma parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Others offer the Prana into the Apana and the Apana into the Prana, having stopped the course of Prana and Apana, being devoted to Pranayama.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: apare prāṇāyāmaniṣṭhāḥ apāne 'dhovṛttau prāṇam ūrdhvavṛttaṃ juhvati pūrakakāle prāṇam apānenaikīkurvanti /
analyzed: apare prāṇāyāma niṣṭhāḥ apāne dhaḥ vṛttau prāṇam ūrdhva vṛttam juhvati pūraka kāle prāṇam apānena ekīkurvanti
translated: Others who are devoted to Pranayama offer the upward-moving Prana into the downward-moving Apana during the Puraka stage, they unify the Prana with the Apana.

original: tathā recakakāle 'pānaṃ prāṇe juhvati /
analyzed: tathā recaka kāle pānam prāṇe juhvati
translated: Similarly, during the Rechaka stage, they offer the Apana into the Prana.

original: kumbhakakāle prāṇāpānayor gatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāmaparāyaṇā bhavanti /
analyzed: kumbhaka kāle prāṇa apānayoḥ gatī ruddhvā prāṇāyāma parāyaṇāḥ bhavanti
translated: During the Kumbhaka stage, having stopped the course of Prana and Apana, they become devoted to Pranayama.

original: apare indriyajayakāmāḥ /
analyzed: apare indriya jaya kāmāḥ
translated: Others who desire to conquer the senses.

original: niyatāhārā alpāhārāḥ prāṇeṣv āhārasaṅkocanenaiva jīvyamāneṣu prāṇān indriyāṇi juhvati /
analyzed: niyata āhārāḥ alpa āhārāḥ prāṇeṣu āhāra saṅkocanena eva jīvyamāneṣu prāṇān indriyāṇi juhvati
translated: They who are restrained in food, who eat little, who live by reducing the food of the vital airs alone, offer the vital airs into the vital airs.

original: indriyāṇāṃ prāṇādhīnavṛttitvāt prāṇadaurbalye sati svayam eva svasvaviṣayagrahaṇāsamarthānīndriyāṇi prāṇeṣv evālpīyanta ity arthaḥ ////🔽baladevaḥ / kiṃ cāpāne iti /
analyzed: indriyāṇām prāṇa adhīna vṛtti tvāt prāṇa daurbalye sati svayam eva sva sva viṣaya grahaṇa asamarthāni indriyāṇi prāṇeṣu eva alpīyante iti arthaḥ  baladevaḥ kim ca apāne iti
translated: The meaning is that when the vital airs are weak, the senses, being unable to grasp their respective objects by themselves, merge into the vital airs, because the functioning of the senses depends on the vital airs.

original: tathāpare prāṇāyāma parāyaṇās te tridhā adhovṛttāv apāne prāṇam ūrdhvavṛttiṃ juhvati /
analyzed: tathā apare prāṇāyāma parāyaṇāḥ te tridhā adhas vṛttau apāne prāṇam ūrdhva vṛttim juhvati
translated: And others, who are devoted to breath control, offer the upward-moving vital air into the downward-moving vital air in the three ways of downward movement.

original: pūrakeṇa prāṇam apānena sahaikīkurvanti /🔽tathā prāṇe 'pānaṃ juhvati recakenāpānaṃ prāṇena sahaikīkṛtya bahir nirgamayanti /
analyzed: pūrakeṇa prāṇam apānena saha ekīkurvanti  tathā prāṇe pānam juhvati recakena apānam prāṇena saha ekīkṛtya bahis nirgamayanti
translated: By means of inhalation, they unite the upward-moving vital air with the downward-moving vital air.🔽Similarly, they offer the downward-moving vital air into the upward-moving vital air. By means of exhalation, they unite the downward-moving vital air with the upward-moving vital air and expel it outside.

original: yathā prāṇāpānayor gatī śvāsapraśvāsau kumbhakena ruddhvā vartanta iti /🔽āntarasya vāyor nāsāsyena bahir nirgamaḥ śvāsaḥ prāṇasya gatiḥ /
analyzed: yathā prāṇa apānayoḥ gatī śvāsa praśvāsau kumbhakena ruddhvā vartante iti  āntarasya vāyoḥ nāsā āsyena bahis nirgamaḥ śvāsaḥ prāṇasya gatiḥ
translated: As the movements of the upward-moving and downward-moving vital airs, which are exhalation and inhalation, are blocked by means of breath retention, they continue.🔽The outward movement of the internal air through the nose and mouth is exhalation, the movement of the upward-moving vital air.

original: vinirgatasya tasyāntaḥpraveśaḥ praśvāso 'pānasya gatiḥ /
analyzed: vinirgatasya tasya antar praveśaḥ praśvāsaḥ pānasya gatiḥ
translated: The inward entry of that which has gone out is inhalation, the movement of the downward-moving vital air.

original: tayor nirodhaḥ kumbhakaḥ sa dvividhaḥ vāyum āpūrya śvāsapraśvāsayor nirodho 'ntaḥkumbhakaḥ /
analyzed: tayoḥ nirodhaḥ kumbhakaḥ sa dvividhaḥ vāyum āpūrya śvāsa praśvāsayoḥ nirodhaḥ ntaḥkumbhakaḥ
translated: The stoppage of those two is Kumbhaka. It is of two kinds: Filling the body with air, the stoppage of inhalation and exhalation is Anta-Kumbhaka.

original: vāyuṃ virecya tayor nirodho bhaiḥ kumbhakaḥ /
analyzed: vāyum virecya tayoḥ nirodhaḥ kumbhakaḥ
translated: Exhaling the air, the stoppage of those two is Bahiḥ Kumbhaka.

original: apare nityatāhārāḥ bhojanasaṅkocaam abhyasyantaḥ prāṇān indriyāṇi prāṇeṣu juhvati /🔽teṣv alpāhāreṇa jīryamāṇeṣu tadāyattavṛttikāni tāni viṣayagrahaṇākṣamāṇi
analyzed: apare nityatā āhārāḥ bhojana saṅkocaam abhyasyantaḥ prāṇān indriyāṇi prāṇeṣu juhvati  teṣu alpa āhāreṇa jīryamāṇeṣu tad āyatta vṛttikāni tāni viṣaya grahaṇa akṣamāṇi
translated: Others, who are regular in their food, by practicing the reduction of food, offer the senses into the vital airs.🔽When those (senses) are being digested by little food, they, which are capable of grasping objects,

original: taptāyoniṣiktodabinduvat teṣv eva vilīyante ////
analyzed: tapta ayaḥ niṣikta uda bindu vat teṣu eva vilīyante
translated: dissolve into them (vital airs) like drops of water sprinkled on an heated (piece of) iron.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: apare niyatāhārāḥ prāṇān prāṇeṣu juhvati /
analyzed: apare niyata āhārāḥ prāṇān prāṇeṣu juhvati
translated: Others, who are regular in their food, offer the vital airs into the vital airs.

original: sarve 'py ete yajñavido yajñakṣapitakalmaṣāḥ ////
analyzed: sarve pi ete yajña vidaḥ yajña kṣapita kalmaṣāḥ
translated: All these knowers of sacrifice, their sins destroyed by sacrifice,

original: śrīdharaḥ / tad evam uktānāṃ dvādaśānāṃ yajñavidāṃ phalam āha sarve 'pīti /
analyzed: āha
translated: Shridhar: Thus, he says the result of the twelve knowers of sacrifice mentioned thus: All, etc.

original: yajñān vindanti labhanta iti yajñavidaḥ /
analyzed: yajñān vindanti labhante iti yajña vidaḥ
translated: They find, i.e., attain, sacrifices, thus they are knowers of sacrifice.

original: yajñajñā iti vā /
analyzed: yajña jñāḥ iti vā
translated: Or, they are knowers of sacrifice.

original: yajñaiḥ kṣayitaṃ nāśitaṃ kalmaṣaṃ yais te ////
analyzed: yajñaiḥ kṣayitam nāśitam kalmaṣam yaiḥ te
translated: Those by whom sins are destroyed, i.e., annihilated, by sacrifices, they are so.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: tad evam uktānāṃ dvādaśadhā yajñavidāṃ phalam āha sarve 'pīti /
analyzed: tat evam uktānām dvādaśadhā yajña vidām phalam āha sarve
translated: Thus, he says the result of the twelve kinds of knowers of sacrifice mentioned thus: All, etc.

original: yajñān vidanti jānanti vindanti labhante veti yajñavido yajñānāṃ jñātāraḥ kartāraś ca /🔽yajñaiḥ pūrvoktaiḥ kṣapitaṃ nāśitaṃ kalmaṣaṃ pāpaṃ yeṣāṃ te yajñakṣapitakalmaṣāḥ /
analyzed: yajñān vidanti jānanti vindanti labhante vā iti yajña vidaḥ yajñānām jñātāraḥ kartāraḥ ca  yajñaiḥ pūrva uktaiḥ kṣapitam nāśitam kalmaṣam pāpam yeṣām te yajña kṣapita kalmaṣāḥ
translated: Yajna-vidah, the knowers of sacrifices, who know, understand, obtain, perform sacrifices.🔽Yajna-kshitakalma-sah, those whose sins are destroyed by sacrifices, by whom sins are destroyed by the above-mentioned sacrifices.

original: yajñān kṛtvāvaśiṣṭe kāle 'nnam amṛtaśabdavācyaṃ bhuñjata iti yajñaśiṣṭāmṛtabhujaḥ /
analyzed: yajñān kṛtvā avaśiṣṭe kāle nnam amṛta śabda vācyam bhuñjate iti yajña śiṣṭa amṛta bhujaḥ
translated: Yajna-shistamritabhujah, who enjoy the nectar that remains after the performance of sacrifices.

original: te sarve 'pi sattvaśuddhijñānaprāptidvāreṇa yānti brahma sanātanaṃ nityaṃ saṃsārān mucyanta ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: te sarve sattva śuddhi jñāna prāpti dvāreṇa yānti brahma sanātanam nityam saṃsārāt mucyante iti arthaḥ
translated: They all go to the eternal Brahman by the door of purification of the heart and attainment of knowledge. The meaning is that they are liberated from the world.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: sarve 'py ete yajñavida uktalakṣaṇān yajñān vindamānāḥ santo jñānadvārā brahma yānti /
analyzed: sarve pi ete yajña vidaḥ ukta lakṣaṇān yajñān vindamānāḥ santaḥ jñāna dvārā brahma yānti
translated: All these knowers of sacrifices, who are obtaining the sacrifices described above, go to Brahman by the path of knowledge.

original: atrānanusaṃhitaṃ phalam āha yajñaśiṣṭaṃ yajñāvaśiṣṭaṃ yad amṛtaṃ bhogaiśvaryasiddhyādikaṃ tad bhuñjata iti ////
analyzed: atra ananusaṃhitam phalam āha yajña śiṣṭam yajña avaśiṣṭam yat amṛtam bhoga aiśvarya siddhi ādikam tat bhuñjate iti
translated: Here, the result not connected with that is stated: They enjoy the nectar that remains after the performance of sacrifices, which is the attainment of enjoyments, lordship, perfection, etc.

original: baladevaḥ / ete khalv indiryavijayakāmāḥ sarve 'pīti yajñavidaḥ /
analyzed: baladevaḥ ete khalu indirya vijaya kāmāḥ sarve yajña vidaḥ
translated: Baladeva: All these, desiring to conquer the senses, are knowers of sacrifices.

original: pūrvoktān devādiyajñān vindamānā tair eva yajñaiḥ kṣapitakalmaṣāḥ ////
analyzed: pūrva uktān deva ādi yajñān vindamānā taiḥ eva yajñaiḥ kṣapita kalmaṣāḥ
translated: Having obtained the sacrifices to gods etc. mentioned before, they go to the eternal Brahman by the path of knowledge, their sins being destroyed by those very sacrifices.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: yajñaśiṣṭāmṛtabhujo yānti brahma sanātanam /
analyzed: yajña śiṣṭa amṛta bhujaḥ yānti brahma sanātanam
translated: Those who partake of the nectar left over from sacrifices go to the eternal Brahman.

original: nāyaṃ loko 'sty ayajñasya kuto 'nyaḥ kurusattama ////
analyzed: na ayam asti ayajñasya kutas kurusattama
translated: This world does not exist for one who does not sacrifice, O best of the Kurus, how much less another (world)?

original: śrīdharaḥ / yajñaśiṣṭāmṛtabhuja iti /
translated: Śrīdhara: Those who partake of the nectar left over from sacrifices.

original: yajñān kṛtvā avaśiṣṭe kāle 'niṣiddham annam amṛtarūpaṃ bhuñjata iti tathā /
analyzed: yajñān kṛtvā avaśiṣṭe kāle niṣiddham annam amṛta rūpam bhuñjate iti tathā
translated: They eat the food that is not prohibited, which is like nectar, at the time left over after performing sacrifices.

original: te sanātanaṃ nityaṃ brahma jñānadvāreṇa prāpnuvanti /
analyzed: te sanātanam nityam brahma jñāna dvāreṇa prāpnuvanti
translated: They attain the eternal, i.e. the eternal Brahman, by the path of knowledge.

original: tadakaraṇe doṣam āha nāyam iti /
analyzed: tad akaraṇe doṣam āha na ayam iti
translated: He states the fault in not doing that: This.

original: ayam alpasukho 'pi manuṣyaloko 'yajñasya yajñānuṣṭhānarahitasya nāsti /
analyzed: ayam alpa sukhaḥ manuṣya lokaḥ yajñasya yajña anuṣṭhāna rahitasya na asti
translated: This human world, which is of little happiness, does not exist for one who does not sacrifice, who is devoid of performing sacrifices.

original: kuto 'nyo bahusukhaḥ paralokaḥ /
analyzed: kutas nyaḥ bahu sukhaḥ para lokaḥ
translated: How much less another (world) of much happiness?

original: ato yajñāḥ sarvathā kartavyā ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: atas yajñāḥ sarvathā kartavyāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, sacrifices should be performed in every way - this is the meaning.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: evam anvaye guṇam uktvā vyatireke doṣam āha yejñety ardhena /
analyzed: evam anvaye guṇam uktvā vyatireke doṣam āha ardhena
translated: Having stated the benefit in the case of positive concomitance, he states the fault in the case of negative concomitance by half a verse: Those who do not sacrifice.

original: uktānāṃ yajñānāṃ madhye 'nyatamo 'pi yajño yasya nāsti so 'yajñas tasyāyam alpasukho 'pi manuṣyaloko nāsti sarvanindyatvāt /
analyzed: uktānām yajñānām madhye nyatamaḥ pi yajñaḥ yasya na asti saḥ yajñaḥ tasya ayam alpa sukhaḥ pi manuṣya lokaḥ na asti sarva nindya tvāt
translated: He who does not have any one of the sacrifices mentioned, for him there is no human world, which is of little happiness, because it is censured by all.

original: kuto 'nyo viśiṣṭasādhanasādhyaḥ paraloko he kurusattama ////
analyzed: kutas viśiṣṭa sādhana sādhyaḥ para lokaḥ he kurusattama
translated: Where then is the other world, which is to be attained by a special means, O best of the Kurus?

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: tathānusaṃhitaṃ phalam āha brahma yāntīti /
analyzed: tathā anusaṃhitam phalam āha brahma yānti iti
translated: The result of the connection is stated thus: They go to Brahman.

original: tadakaraṇe pratyavāyam āha nāyam iti /
analyzed: tad akaraṇe pratyavāyam āha na ayam iti
translated: The disadvantage of not doing it is stated thus: This is not.

original: ayam alpasukho manuṣaloko 'pi nāsti /
analyzed: ayam alpa sukhaḥ na asti
translated: This human world, which is of little happiness, does not exist.

original: kuto 'nyo devādilokas tena prāptavya ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: kutas nyaḥ deva ādi lokaḥ tena prāptavyaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Where then is the other world, which is to be attained by him, such as the world of gods etc.? This is the meaning.

original: baladevaḥ / ananusaṃhitaṃ phalam āha yajñaśiṣṭeti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ ananusaṃhitam phalam āha yajña śiṣṭa iti
translated: Balarama: The result of non-connection is stated thus: The remnants of sacrifice.

original: yajñaśiṣṭaṃ yad amṛtam annādi bhogaiśvaryasiddhyādi ca tadbhuñjānāḥ /
analyzed: yajña śiṣṭam yat amṛtam anna ādi bhoga aiśvarya siddhi ādi ca tat bhuñjānāḥ
translated: They enjoy the nectar, food etc., and the prosperity of enjoyment etc. that is the remnants of sacrifice.

original: anusaṃhitaṃ phalam āha yāntīti /
analyzed: anusaṃhitam phalam āha yānti iti
translated: The result of connection is stated thus: They go.

original: tatsādhyena jñānena brahmeti prāgvat ////🔽BhG /
analyzed: tad sādhyena jñānena brahma iti prāgvat  bhg
translated: By that, by the knowledge which is its result, to Brahman, as before.

original: evaṃ bahuvidhā yajñā vitatā brahmaṇo mukhe /
analyzed: evam bahuvidhāḥ yajñāḥ vitatāḥ brahmaṇaḥ mukhe
translated: Thus, the sacrifices are manifold and extensive at the mouth of Brahman.

original: karmajān viddhi tān sarvān evaṃ jñātvā vimokṣyase ////
analyzed: karma jān viddhi tān sarvān evam jñātvā vimokṣyase
translated: Know them all to be born of action. Knowing thus, you will be liberated.

original: śrīdharaḥ / jñānayajñaṃ stotum uktān yajñān upasaṃharati evaṃ bahuvidhā iti /
translated: Sridhara: In order to praise the sacrifice of knowledge, he concludes the sacrifices mentioned: Thus, these are the many kinds of sacrifices.

original: brahmaṇo vedasya mukhe vitatāḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ vedasya mukhe vitatāḥ
translated: They are spread out at the mouth of the Veda.

original: vedena sākṣādvihitā ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: vedena sākṣāt vihitāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they are directly enjoined by the Veda.

original: tathāpi tān sarvān vāṅmanaḥkāyakarmajanitān ātmasvarūpasaṃsparśarahitān viddhi jānīhi /
analyzed: tathā api tān sarvān vāc manaḥ kāya karma janitān ātma svarūpa saṃsparśa rahitān viddhi jānīhi
translated: Nevertheless, know that all of them, produced by actions of speech, mind, and body, are devoid of contact with the nature of the self.

original: ātmanaḥ karmāgocaratvāt /
analyzed: ātmanaḥ karma agocara tvāt
translated: Because the self is not the domain of action.

original: evaṃ jñātvā jñānaniṣṭhaḥ san saṃsārād vimukto bhaviṣyasi ////
analyzed: evam jñātvā jñāna niṣṭhaḥ san saṃsārāt vimuktaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: Knowing this thus, being devoted to knowledge, you will become liberated from the world.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: kiṃ tvayā svotprekṣāmātreṇaivam ucyate na hi veda evātra pramāṇam ity āha evam iti /
analyzed: kim tvayā sva utprekṣā mātreṇa evam ucyate na hi vedaḥ eva atra pramāṇam iti āha evam iti
translated: But is this being said by you merely out of your own imagination? The Veda itself is the authority here, he says Thus.

original: evaṃ yathoktā bahuvidhā bahuprakārā yajñāḥ sarvavaidikaśreyaḥsādhanarūpā vitatā vistṛtā brahmaṇo vedasya mukhe dvāre vedadvāreṇaivaite 🔽'vagatā ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: evam yathā uktāḥ bahuvidhāḥ bahu prakārāḥ yajñāḥ sarva vaidika śreyaḥ sādhana rūpāḥ vitatāḥ vistṛtāḥ brahmaṇaḥ vedasya mukhe dvāre veda dvāreṇa eva ete  vagatāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Thus, these many kinds of sacrifices, which are the means of attaining all the spiritual goals of the Vedas, are spread out, extended, at the mouth, the door, of the Veda. The meaning is that they are understood only through the door of the Veda.

original: vedavākyāni tu pratyekaṃ vistarabhayān nodāhriyante /
analyzed: veda vākyāni tu pratyekam vistara bhayāt na udāhriyante
translated: But the Vedic sentences are not quoted individually for fear of prolixity.

original: karmajān kāyikavācikamānasakarmodbhavān viddhi jānīhi tān sarvān yajñān nātmajān /
analyzed: karma jān kāyika vācika mānasa karma udbhavān viddhi jānīhi tān sarvān yajñān na ātmajān
translated: Know, O Arjuna, all those sacrifices to be born of action, born of bodily, verbal and mental actions, and not born of the Self.

original: nirvyāpāro hy ātmā na tadvyāpārā ete kintu nirvyāpāro 'ham udāsīna ity evaṃ jñātvā vimokṣyase 'smāt saṃsārabandhanād iti śeṣaḥ ////
analyzed: nirvyāpāraḥ hi ātmā na tad vyāpārāḥ ete kintu nirvyāpāraḥ ham udāsīnaḥ iti evam jñātvā vimokṣyase smāt saṃsāra bandhanāt iti śeṣaḥ
translated: For the Self is inactive; these are not His actions. But knowing thus, 'I am inactive, indifferent,' you will be liberated from this bondage of worldly existence, is the remainder.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: brahmaṇo vedasya mukhena vedena svamukhenaiva spaṣṭam uktā ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ vedasya mukhena vedena sva mukhena eva spaṣṭam uktāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they are clearly stated by the Veda, the mouth of Brahman, by its own mouth.

original: karmajān vāṅmanaḥkāyakarmajanitān ////
analyzed: karma jān vāc manaḥ kāya karma janitān
translated: Born of action, produced by verbal, mental and bodily actions.

original: baladevaḥ / evam iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam iti
translated: Balarama: Thus.

original: brahmaṇo vedasya mukhe vitatāḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ vedasya mukhe vitatāḥ
translated: They are spread out at the mouth of the Veda, the Brahman.

original: viviktātmaprāptyupāyatayā svamukhenaiva tena sphuṭam uktāḥ /
analyzed: vivikta ātma prāpti upāya tayā sva mukhena eva tena sphuṭam uktāḥ
translated: Clearly stated by it, by its own mouth, as the means of attaining the distinct Self.

original: karmajān vāṅmanaḥkāyakarmajanitān ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: karma jān vāc manaḥ kāya karma janitān iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that they are born of action, produced by verbal, mental and bodily actions.

original: evaṃ jñātvā tadupāyatayā tenoktān tān avabudhyānuṣṭhāya tadutpannavijñānenāvalokitātmadvayaḥ saṃsārād vimokṣyase ////
analyzed: evam jñātvā tad upāya tayā tena uktān tān avabudhya anuṣṭhāya tad utpanna vijñānena avalokita ātma dvayaḥ saṃsārāt vimokṣyase
translated: Knowing thus, understanding them as stated by it as the means to that, performing them, and beholding the two selves produced by that knowledge, you will be liberated from worldly existence.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: śreyān dravyamayād yajñāj jñānayajñaḥ parantapa /
analyzed: śreyān dravya mayāt yajñāt jñāna yajñaḥ parantapa
translated: Better than the sacrifice consisting of material things is the sacrifice consisting of knowledge, O scorcher of the foe.

original: sarvaṃ karmākhilaṃ pārtha jñāne parisamāpyate ////
analyzed: sarvam karma akhilam pārtha jñāne parisamāpyate
translated: All action, O son of Prtha, is merged in Knowledge.

original: śrīdharaḥ / karmayajñāj jñānayajñas tu śreṣṭha ity āha śreyān iti /
analyzed: tu   iti āha   iti
translated: Shridhar: It is said that the knowledge-sacrifice is superior to the action-sacrifice.

original: dravyamayād anātmavyāpārajanyād daivādiyajñāj jñānayajñaḥ śreyān śreṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: dravya mayāt anātma vyāpāra janyāt daiva ādi yajñāt jñāna yajñaḥ śreyān śreṣṭhaḥ
translated: The knowledge-sacrifice is superior, best, to the material sacrifice, which is produced by the activity of the non-Self, such as sacrifices to the gods, etc.

original: yadyapi jñānayajñasyāpi manovyāpārādhīnatvam asty eva tathāpy ātmasvarūpasya jñānasya manaḥpariṇāme 'bhivyaktimātram /
analyzed: yadi api jñāna yajñasya api manaḥ vyāpāra adhīna tvam asti eva tathā api ātma svarūpasya jñānasya manaḥ pariṇāme abhivyakti mātram
translated: Although the knowledge-sacrifice is also dependent on the activity of the mind, still, the knowledge of the nature of the Self is merely manifested in the transformation of the mind.

original: na tajjanyatvam iti dravyamayād viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: na tad janya tvam iti dravya mayāt viśeṣaḥ
translated: It is not produced by that, so it is different from the material sacrifice.

original: śreṣṭhatve hetuḥ sarvaṃ karmākhilaṃ phalasahitaṃ jñāne parisamāpyate /
analyzed: śreṣṭha tve hetuḥ sarvam karma akhilam phala sahitam jñāne parisamāpyate
translated: The reason for its superiority is that all action, along with its fruits, is merged in Knowledge.

original: antarbhavatīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: antarbhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is included.

original: sarvaṃ tad abhisameti yat kiṃ ca prajāḥ sādhu kurvantīti śruteḥ ////
analyzed: sarvam tat abhisameti yat kim ca prajāḥ sādhu kurvanti iti śruteḥ
translated: As it is said in the scriptures: Whatever good deeds the people perform, all that merges into that.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: sarveṣāṃ tulyavan nirdeśātmakarmajñānayoḥ sāmyaprāptāv āha śreyān iti /
analyzed: sarveṣām tulya vat nirdeśa ātma karma jñānayoḥ sāmya prāptau āha śreyān iti
translated: In response to the question of equality between action and knowledge, which are mentioned as equal, it is said that the knowledge-sacrifice is superior.

original: śreyān praśasyataraḥ sākṣān mokṣaphalatvāt /
analyzed: śreyān praśasyataraḥ sākṣāt mokṣa phala tvāt
translated: It is superior, more praiseworthy, because it is directly the means to liberation.

original: dravyamayāt tadupalakṣitāj jñānaśūnyāt sarvasmād api yajñāt saṃsāraphalāj jñānayajña eka eva /
analyzed: dravya mayāt tad upalakṣitāt jñāna śūnyāt sarvasmāt api yajñāt saṃsāra phalāt jñāna yajñaḥ ekaḥ eva
translated: Of all sacrifices, even of the sacrifice consisting of gifts, which is indicated by the word 'dravya' (substance), and of the sacrifice consisting of knowledge, which is indicated by the word 'jñāna', the sacrifice consisting of knowledge alone is the best.

original: he parantapa /
analyzed: he parantapa
translated: O scorcher of foes!

original: kasmād evam /
analyzed: kasmāt evam
translated: Why is it so?

original: yasmāt sarvaṃ karmeṣṭipaśusomacayanarūpaṃ śrautam akhilaṃ niravaśeṣaṃ smārtam
analyzed: yasmāt sarvam karma iṣṭi paśu soma cayana rūpam śrautam akhilam niravaśeṣam smārtam
translated: Because all the Vedic rites in the form of Ishti, animal sacrifice, Soma sacrifice, and all the Smriti rites without exception,

original: upāsanādirūpaṃ ca yat karma tajjñāne brahmātmaikyasākṣātkāre samāpyate pratibandhakṣayadvāreṇa paryavasyati /
analyzed: upāsana ādi rūpam ca yat karma tat jñāne brahma ātma aikya sākṣātkāre samāpyate pratibandha kṣaya dvāreṇa paryavasyati
translated: and all the rites in the form of meditation etc., are completed in knowledge, i.e., in the realization of the identity of Brahman and the self, by the removal of obstacles.

original: tam etaṃ vedānuvacanena brāhmaṇā vividiṣanti yajñena dāne tapasānāśakena iti dharmena pāpam apanudati iti ca śruteḥ /
analyzed: tam etam veda anuvacanena brāhmaṇāḥ vividiṣanti yajñena dāne tapasā anāśakena iti dharmena pāpam apanudati iti ca śruteḥ
translated: This is because of the Vedic text: The Brahmins seek to know Him through the study of the Vedas, through sacrifice, through gifts, through austerities that are not destructive, and By Dharma, one removes sin.

original: sarvāpekṣā ca yajñādiśruter aśvavat Vs / / / iti nyāyāc cety arthaḥ ////
analyzed: sarva apekṣā ca yajña ādi śruteḥ aśva vat iti nyāyāt ca iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the Vedic texts about sacrifice etc. require all these, like the word 'horse' requires the other words in the compound 'ashva-ratha' (horse-chariot).

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: teṣāṃ madhye brahmārpaṇaṃ brahmahavir iti lakṣaṇād api dravyamayād yajñād brahmāgnāv ity anenokto jñānayajñaḥ śreyān /
analyzed: teṣām madhye brahma arpaṇam brahma haviḥ iti lakṣaṇāt api dravya mayāt yajñāt brahma agnau iti anena uktaḥ jñāna yajñaḥ śreyān
translated: Among them, the sacrifice consisting of knowledge, which is mentioned by the words 'in the fire of Brahman' in the text 'Brahmarpana, Brahmahavi', is better than the sacrifice consisting of substances, even though it has the definition 'Brahmarpana, Brahmahavi'.

original: kutaḥ / jñāne sati sarvaṃ karmākhilam avyarthaṃ sat parisamāpyate samāptībhavati /
analyzed: kutas jñāne sati sarvam karma akhilam avyartham sat parisamāpyate samāptībhavati
translated: Why? When there is knowledge, all the entire work becomes fruitful, comes to an end.

original: jñānānantaraṃ karma na tiṣṭhatīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: jñāna anantaram karma na tiṣṭhati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that after knowledge, work does not remain.

original: baladevaḥ / uktāḥ karmayogā viviktātmānusandhigarbhatvād araṇyād iva ubhayarūpās teṣu jñānarūpaṃ saṃstauti śreyān iti /
analyzed: baladevaḥ uktāḥ karmayogāḥ vivikta ātma anusandhi garbha tvāt araṇyāt iva ubhaya rūpāḥ teṣu jñāna rūpam saṃstauti śreyān iti
translated: Balarama. The Karma-yogas have been described as having the essence of the meditation on the distinct Self, like a forest, and are of two kinds. Among them, he praises the knowledge-aspect with Shreyah etc.

original: dvirūpe karmaṇi karmadravyabhayād aṃśāj jñānamayo 'ṃśaḥ śreyān praśastaraḥ /
analyzed: dvirūpe karmaṇi karma dravya bhayāt aṃśāt jñāna mayaḥ ṃśaḥ śreyān praśastaraḥ
translated: In the two-fold work, the aspect consisting of knowledge is better, more praiseworthy, than the aspect consisting of the material.

original: dravyamayād ity upalakṣaṇām indiryasaṃyamādīnāṃ teṣāṃ tadupāyatvāt /
analyzed: dravya mayāt iti upalakṣaṇām indirya saṃyama ādīnām teṣām tad upāya tvāt
translated: Than the material is a synecdoche for the control of the senses and so on, because they are the means to that.

original: etad vivṛṇoti he pārtha /
analyzed: etat vivṛṇoti he pārtha
translated: He explains this, O Partha.

original: jñāne sati sarvaṃ karmākhilaṃ sāṅgaṃ parisamāpyate nivṛttim eti phale jāte sādhananivṛtter darśanāt ////
analyzed: jñāne sati sarvam karma akhilam sa aṅgam parisamāpyate nivṛttim eti phale jāte sādhana nivṛtteḥ darśanāt
translated: When there is knowledge, all the entire work with its auxiliaries comes to an end, ceases, because it is seen that when the result is produced, the means ceases.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: tad viddhi praṇipātena paripraśnena sevayā /
analyzed: tat viddhi praṇipātena paripraśnena sevayā
translated: Know that through prostration, inquiry, and service,

original: upadekṣyanti te jñānaṃ jñāninas tattvadarśinaḥ ////
analyzed: upadekṣyanti te jñānam jñāninaḥ tattva darśinaḥ
translated: the knowers, the seers of truth, will teach you the knowledge.

original: śrīdharaḥ / evambhūtātmajñāne sādhanam āha tad iti /
analyzed: āha   iti
translated: Shridhar. He says Tat etc. about the means of knowing the Self in this way.

original: tad taj jñānaṃ viddhi jānīhi prāpnuhīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: tat tat jñānam viddhi jānīhi prāpnuhi iti arthaḥ
translated: Know that knowledge to be that. The meaning is: understand it, attain it.

original: jñānināṃ praṇipātena daṇḍavannamaskāreṇa /
analyzed: jñāninām praṇipātena daṇḍa vat namaskāreṇa
translated: By the bowing down of the wise, by prostrating like a staff.

original: tataḥ paripraśnena /
analyzed: tatas paripraśnena
translated: Then by questioning.

original: kuto 'yaṃ me saṃsāraḥ /
analyzed: kutas yam me saṃsāraḥ
translated: From where does this worldly existence of mine arise?

original: kathaṃ vā nivarteta /
analyzed: katham vā nivarteta
translated: Or how can it be stopped?

original: iti paripraśnena /
analyzed: iti paripraśnena
translated: In this way, by questioning.

original: sevayā guruśuśrūṣayā ca /
analyzed: sevayā guru śuśrūṣayā ca
translated: By service, by attending to the teacher.

original: jñāninaḥ śāstrajñāḥ /
analyzed: jñāninaḥ śāstra jñāḥ
translated: The wise are those who know the scriptures.

original: tattvadarśino 'parokṣānubhavasampannāś ca /
analyzed: tattva darśinaḥ parokṣa anubhava sampannāḥ ca
translated: And the seers of truth are those who are endowed with the experience of the non-manifest.

original: te tubhyaṃ jñānam upadeśena sampādayiṣyanti ////
analyzed: te tubhyam jñānam upadeśena sampādayiṣyanti
translated: They will accomplish that knowledge for you by teaching.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: etādṛśajñānaprāptau ko 'tipratyāsanna upāya ity ucyate tad viddhīti /
analyzed: etādṛśa jñāna prāptau upāyaḥ iti ucyate tat viddhi iti
translated: When such knowledge is attained, what is the most proximate means? It is said: know that.

original: tatsarvakarmaphalabhūtaṃ jñānaṃ viddhi labhasva ācāryānabhigamya teṣāṃ praṇipātena🔽prakarṣeṇa nīcaiḥ patanaṃ praṇipāto dīrghanamaskāras tena ko 'haṃ kathaṃ baddho
analyzed: tat sarva karma phala bhūtam jñānam viddhi labhasva ācāryān abhigamya teṣām praṇipātena  prakarṣeṇa nīcaiḥ patanam praṇipātaḥ dīrgha namaskāraḥ tena kaḥ ham katham baddhaḥ
translated: That knowledge, which is the fruit of all actions, should be obtained by approaching the teachers, by bowing down to them,🔽by bowing down very low, by prostrating fully, by questioning with many topics, such as: Who am I? How am I bound?

original: 'smi kenopāyena mucyeyam ity ādi paripraśnena bahuviṣayeṇa praśnena /
analyzed: smi kena upāyena mucyeyam iti ādi paripraśnena bahu viṣayeṇa praśnena
translated: By what means can I be liberated?

original: sevayā sarvabhāvena tadanukūlakāritayā /
analyzed: sevayā sarva bhāvena tad anukūla kāri tayā
translated: By service, by acting in accordance with them in every way.

original: evaṃ bhaktiśraddhātiśayapūrvakeṇāvanativiśeṣeṇābhimukhāḥ santa upadekṣyanty upadeśena
analyzed: evam bhakti śraddhā atiśaya pūrvakeṇa avanati viśeṣeṇa abhimukhāḥ santaḥ upadekṣyanti upadeśena
translated: Thus, being inclined by a special salutation preceded by excess of devotion and faith, they will teach by instruction.

original: sampādayiṣyanti te tubhyaṃ jñānaṃ paramātmaviṣayaṃ sākṣān mokṣaphalaṃ jñāninaḥ
analyzed: sampādayiṣyanti te tubhyam jñānam paramātma viṣayam sākṣāt mokṣa phalam jñāninaḥ
translated: Thus, being inclined by a special salutation preceded by excess of devotion and faith, they will teach you the knowledge of the Supreme Self, which is directly conducive to liberation, to the knowers of Brahman.

original: padavākyanyāyādimānanipuṇās tattvadarśinaḥ kṛtasākṣātkārāḥ /🔽sākṣātkāravadbhir upadiṣṭam eva jñānaṃ phalaparyavasāyi na tu tadrahitaiḥ padavākyanyāyādimānanipuṇair apīti bhagavato
analyzed: pada vākya nyāya ādi māna nipuṇāḥ tattva darśinaḥ kṛta sākṣātkārāḥ  sākṣātkāravadbhiḥ upadiṣṭam eva jñānam phala paryavasāyi na tu tad rahitaiḥ pada vākya nyāya ādi māna nipuṇaiḥ api iti
translated: They are skilled in grammar, logic, etc., are seers of truth, and have realized Brahman.

original: matam / tad vijñānārthaṃ sa gurum evābhigacchet samitpāṇiḥ śrotriyaṃ brahmaniṣṭham iti śrutisaṃvādi /
analyzed: matam tat vijñāna artham sa gurum eva abhigacchet samidh pāṇiḥ śrotriyam brahma niṣṭham iti śruti saṃvādi
translated: The Lord's opinion is that the knowledge taught only by those who have realized Brahman is conducive to the goal, not by those devoid of that, even if they are skilled in grammar, logic, etc. This is in agreement with the Vedic text: For the sake of knowing that, he should approach the teacher himself with fuel in hand, who is learned in the Veda, and is devoted to Brahman.

original: tatrāpi śrotriyam adhītavedaṃ brahmaniṣṭhaṃ kṛtabrahmasākṣātkāram iti vyākhyānāt /
analyzed: tatra api śrotriyam adhīta vedam brahma niṣṭham kṛta brahma sākṣātkāram iti vyākhyānāt
translated: There also, because of the explanation that learned in the Veda means who has studied the Veda, and devoted to Brahman means who has realized Brahman.

original: bahuvacanaṃ cedam ācāryaviṣayam ekasminn api gauravātiśayārthaṃ na tu bahutvavivakṣayā /
analyzed: bahuvacanam ca idam ācārya viṣayam ekasmin api gaurava atiśaya artham na tu bahutva vivakṣayā
translated: And this plural is used in reference to the teacher, even in the case of one, for the purpose of showing great respect, but not with the intention of expressing plurality.

original: ekasmād eva tattvasākṣātkāravata ācāryāt tattvajñānodaye satyācāryāntaragamanasya tadartham ayogād iti draṣṭavyam ////
analyzed: ekasmāt eva tattva sākṣātkāravataḥ ācāryāt tattva jñāna udaye sati ācārya antara gamanasya tad artham ayogāt iti draṣṭavyam
translated: It should be seen that when the knowledge of reality arises from the teacher who has realized reality himself, there is no need to go to another teacher for that purpose.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: tajjñānaprāptaye prakāram āha tad iti /
translated: He says the means of attaining that knowledge with the word tat.

original: praṇipātena jñānopadeṣṭari gurau daṇḍavannamaskāreṇa /
analyzed: praṇipātena jñāna upadeṣṭari gurau daṇḍa vat namaskāreṇa
translated: By prostration, by bowing down like a staff to the teacher who imparts knowledge.

original: bhagavan /
analyzed: bhagavan
translated: O Lord.

original: kuto 'yaṃ me saṃsāraḥ /
analyzed: kutas yam me saṃsāraḥ
translated: From where does this worldly existence of mine come?

original: kathaṃ nivartiṣyate /
analyzed: katham nivartiṣyate
translated: How will it cease?

original: iti paripraśnena ca /
analyzed: iti paripraśnena ca
translated: By asking such questions.

original: sevayā tatparicaryayā ca /
analyzed: sevayā tad paricaryayā ca
translated: By serving, by attending to him.

original: tad vijñānārthaṃ sa gurum evābhigacchet samitpāṇiḥ śrotriyaṃ brahmaniṣṭham iti śruteḥ ////
analyzed: tat vijñāna artham sa gurum eva abhigacchet samidh pāṇiḥ śrotriyam brahma niṣṭham iti śruteḥ
translated: For the sake of that knowledge, he should approach the teacher himself with fuel in his hand, a learned Brahmin devoted to Brahman. This is the Vedic injunction.

original: baladevaḥ / evaṃ jīvasvarūpajñānaṃ tatsādhanaṃ ca sāṅgam upadiśya parasvarūpopāsanajñānam upadśan satprasaṅgalabhyatvaṃ tasyāha tad
analyzed: baladevaḥ evam jīva sva rūpa jñānam tad sādhanam ca sa aṅgam upadiśya para sva rūpa upāsana jñānam sat prasaṅga labhya tvam tasya āha tat
translated: Balarama. Having thus taught the nature of the individual soul and the means of realizing it along with its auxiliaries, he now teaches the knowledge of the meditation on the Supreme Self, saying that it is obtained incidentally with that.

original: yad arthaṃ tad ubhayaṃ mayā tavopadiṣṭaṃ avināśi tu tad viddhi Gītā / ity ādinā
analyzed: yat artham tat ubhayam mayā tava upadiṣṭam avināśi tu tat viddhi gītāḥ iti ādinā
translated: For the sake of which both of them have been taught by me to you, with the words But know that to be indestructible etc.

original: tat parātmasambandhijñānaṃ praṇipātādibhiḥ prasāditebhyo jñānibhyaḥ sadbhyas tvam
analyzed: tat parātma sambandhi jñānam praṇipāta ādibhiḥ prasāditebhyaḥ jñānibhyaḥ sadbhyaḥ tvam
translated: That knowledge of the supreme Self, you should acquire from the good and wise men who have been propitiated by prostrations etc.

original: avagatasvasvarūpo viddhi prāpnuhi /
analyzed: avagata sva svarūpaḥ viddhi prāpnuhi
translated: Having understood your own nature, you should know, i.e. attain.

original: tatra praṇipāto daṇḍavatpraṇatiḥ /
analyzed: tatra praṇipātaḥ daṇḍa vat praṇatiḥ
translated: There, prostration is bowing down like a staff.

original: sevā bhṛtyavat teṣāṃ paricaryā /
analyzed: sevā bhṛtya vat teṣām paricaryā
translated: Service is attending on them like a servant.

original: paripraśnaḥ tatsvarūpatadguṇatadvibhūtiviṣayako vividhaḥ praśnaḥ /
translated: Inquiring is asking various questions about their nature, qualities and glory.

original: nanūdāsīnās te na vakṣyantīti cet tatrāha upeti /🔽te jñānino 'dhigatasvarūpātmānaḥ praṇipātādinā tajjijñāsutām ālakṣya te tubhyaṃ
analyzed: nanu udāsīnāḥ te na vakṣyanti iti ced tatra āha upa iti  te jñāninaḥ dhi gata sva rūpa ātmānaḥ praṇipāta ādinā tad jijñāsu tām ālakṣya te tubhyam
translated: If it is asked, They are indifferent, they will not speak, then it is said they.🔽Those wise men, whose Self has been realized, seeing your desire to know that through prostration etc.,

original: tādṛśāya tatsambandhi jñānam upadekṣyanti tattvadarśinas tajjñānapracārakāḥ kāruṇikā iti yāvat /
analyzed: tādṛśāya tad sambandhi jñānam upadekṣyanti tattva darśinaḥ tad jñāna pracārakāḥ kāruṇikāḥ iti yāvat
translated: they, being such, will impart to you that knowledge which is related to that. They are the seers of truth, the propagators of that knowledge, and are compassionate.

original: nanv atra tad iti jīvajñānaṃ vācyaṃ prakṛtatvād iti cen / na /
analyzed: nanu atra tat iti jīva jñānam vācyam prakṛta tvāt iti ced na
translated: If it is asked, Here, the knowledge of the individual Self should be mentioned, as it is the subject matter, it is not so.

original: na tv evāhaṃ jātu nāsaṃ Gītā / /
analyzed: na tu eva aham jātu na āsam gītā
translated: I never was not; nor were you, nor these all the others.

original: yukta āsīta matparaḥ Gītā / /
analyzed: yuktaḥ āsīta mad paraḥ gītā
translated: One should sit, being devoted to Me.🔽Though unborn, and the Imperishable, the Self of all.

original: ajo 'pi sann avyayātmā Gītā / ity ādinā parātmano 'py aprākṛtatvāt /
analyzed: ajaḥ pi san avyaya ātmā gītā iti ādinā parātmanaḥ pi aprākṛta tvāt
translated: Thus, because the supreme Self also is not natural.

original: evam āha sūtrakāraḥ anyārthaś ca parāmarśaḥ Vs / / / iti /
analyzed: evam āha sūtra kāraḥ anya arthaḥ ca parāmarśaḥ iti
translated: Thus says the author of the Vrtti: The reference is for another purpose.

original: anyathā śrutisūtrārthasaṃvādino 'grimasya jñānamahimno virodhaḥ syād uktam eva suṣṭhu ////
analyzed: anyathā śruti sūtra artha saṃvādinaḥ grimasya jñāna mahimnaḥ virodhaḥ syāt uktam eva suṣṭhu
translated: Otherwise, there would be a contradiction with the greatness of knowledge that is to come, which is in agreement with the meaning of the Vedic text and the sutra. What has been said is very good indeed.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita.

original: yaj jñātvā na punar moham evaṃ yāsyasi pāṇḍava /
analyzed: yat jñātvā na punar moham evam yāsyasi pāṇḍava
translated: Knowing which, O son of Pandu, one does not again come to delusion in this way,

original: yena bhūtāny aśeṣeṇa drakṣyasy ātmany atho mayi ////
analyzed: yena bhūtāni aśeṣeṇa drakṣyasi ātmani atha u mayi
translated: By which one sees all beings in the Self and also in Me.

original: śrīdharaḥ / jñānaphalam āha yaj jñātveti sārdhais tribhiḥ /
translated: Sridhar: The result of knowledge is stated with three and a half verses beginning with Knowing which.

original: yaj jñānaṃ jñātvā prāpya punar bandhuvadhādinimittaṃ moham na prāpsyasi /
analyzed: yat jñānam jñātvā prāpya punar bandhu vadha ādi nimittam moham na prāpsyasi
translated: Knowing which knowledge, having attained it, one does not again come to delusion due to the killing of relatives and so on.

original: tatra hetuḥ yena jñānena bhūtāni pitāputrādīni svāvidyāvijṛmbhitāni svātmany evābhedena drakṣyasi /
analyzed: tatra hetuḥ yena jñānena bhūtāni pitā putra ādīni sva avidyā vijṛmbhitāni sva ātmani eva abhedena drakṣyasi
translated: The reason for that is: by that knowledge, one sees all beings, such as father, son, and so on, as non-different in one's own Self.

original: atho anantaram ātmānaṃ mayi paramātmany abhedena drakṣyasīty arthaḥ ////
analyzed: atha u anantaram ātmānam mayi paramātmani abhedena drakṣyasi iti arthaḥ
translated: And then, the meaning is that one sees the Self as non-different in Me, the Supreme Self.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: evam atinirbandhena jñānotpādane kiṃsyāt ata āha yaj jñātveti /
analyzed: evam ati nirbandhena jñāna utpādane kim syāt atas āha yat jñātvā iti
translated: What is the use of producing knowledge by such intense effort? To this he says Knowing which.

original: yat pūrvoktaṃ jñānam ācāryair upadiṣṭaṃ jñātvā prāpya /
analyzed: yat pūrva uktam jñānam ācāryaiḥ upadiṣṭam jñātvā prāpya
translated: Having attained, having obtained, the knowledge that was previously stated and taught by the teachers.

original: odanapākaṃ pacatītivat tasyaiva dhātoḥ /
analyzed: odana pākam pacati iti vat tasya eva dhātoḥ
translated: As in the case of 'he cooks the rice', it is of the same root.

original: sāmānyavivakṣayā prayogaḥ /
analyzed: sāmānya vivakṣayā prayogaḥ
translated: The usage is with the intention of expressing the general.

original: na punar moham evaṃ bandhuvadhādinimittaṃ bhramaṃ yāsyasi /
analyzed: na punar moham evam bandhu vadha ādi nimittam bhramam yāsyasi
translated: And do not again go astray in this way, out of delusion, due to the killing of relatives and so on.

original: he parantapa /
analyzed: he parantapa
translated: O scorcher of enemies.

original: kasmād evaṃ yasmād eva jñānena bhūtāni pitṛputrādīni aśeṣeṇa brahmādistambaparyantāni
analyzed: kasmāt evam yasmāt eva jñānena bhūtāni pitṛ putra ādīni aśeṣeṇa brahma ādi stamba paryantāni
translated: Why is it so? Because you will see all beings, fathers, sons, etc., without exception, from Brahma down to a blade of grass,

original: svāvidyāvijṛmbhitāni ātmani tvayi tvaṃpadārthe 'tho api mayi bhagavati vāsudeve
analyzed: sva avidyā vijṛmbhitāni ātmani tvayi tvaṃpadārthe api mayi bhagavati vāsudeve
translated: which are the manifestations of your own ignorance, in yourself, in the meaning of the word 'you', and also in me, the Lord Vāsudeva,

original: tatpadārthe paramārthato bhedarahite 'dhiṣṭhānabhūte drakṣyasy abhedenaiva /
analyzed: tad padārthe paramārthataḥ bheda rahite dhiṣṭhāna bhūte drakṣyasi abhedena eva
translated: in the meaning of the word 'that', which are ultimately devoid of difference, in the underlying basis.

original: adhiṣṭhānātirekeṇa kalpitasyābhāvāt /
analyzed: adhiṣṭhāna atirekeṇa kalpitasya abhāvāt
translated: Because what is imagined does not exist apart from the underlying basis.

original: māṃ bhagavantaṃ vāsudevam ātmatvena sākṣātkṛtya sarvājñānanāśe tatkāryāṇi bhūtāni na sthāsyantīti bhāvaḥ ////
analyzed: mām bhagavantam vāsudevam ātma tvena sākṣātkṛtya sarva ajñāna nāśe tad kāryāṇi bhūtāni na sthāsyanti iti bhāvaḥ
translated: The meaning is that when you realize me, the Lord Vāsudeva, as the Self, all beings, which are the effects of ignorance, will not exist, when ignorance is destroyed.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Viṣṇudatta.

original: jñānasya phalam āha yaj jñātveti sārdhais tribhiḥ /
analyzed: jñānasya phalam āha yat jñātvā iti sa ardhaiḥ tribhiḥ
translated: The result of knowledge is stated by the Lord with the next three and a half verses, beginning with 'Knowing which'.

original: yaj jñānaṃ dehād atiikta evātmeti lakṣaṇaṃ jñātvaivaṃ moham antaḥkaraṇadharmaṃ na prāpsyasi /
analyzed: yat jñānam dehāt atiiktaḥ eva ātmā iti lakṣaṇam jñātvā evam moham antaḥkaraṇa dharmam na prāpsyasi
translated: Knowing the knowledge characterized as 'the Self is indeed different from the body', you will not attain delusion, which is a property of the internal organ.

original: yena ca mohavigamena svābhāvikanityasiddhātmajñānalābhād aśeṣāṇi bhūtāni manuṣyatiryagādīny ātmani jīvātmany upādhitvena sthitāni pṛthag
analyzed: yena ca moha vigamena svābhāvika nitya siddha ātma jñāna lābhāt aśeṣāṇi bhūtāni manuṣya tiryak ādīni ātmani jīvātmani upādhi tvena sthitāni pṛthak
translated: And by that removal of delusion, by attaining the knowledge of the Self which is naturally eternally established, you will see all beings, human, animal, etc., as separate, existing within the Self, the individual soul, as limiting adjuncts.

original: drakṣyasi /
analyzed: drakṣyasi
translated: You will see them.

original: atho mayi paramakāraṇe ca kāryatvena sthitāni drakṣyasi ////
analyzed: atho mayi parama kāraṇe ca kārya tvena sthitāni drakṣyasi
translated: And you will see them existing as effects in Me, the supreme cause.

original: baladevaḥ / uktajñānaphalam āha yad iti /
translated: Balarama. The result of the knowledge stated is said by yad (that).

original: yajjīvajñānapūrvakaṃ paramātmasambandhijñānaṃ jñātvopalabhya punar evaṃ bandhuvadhādihetukaṃ mohaṃ na yāsyasi /
analyzed: yat jīva jñāna pūrvakam paramātma sambandhi jñānam jñātvā upalabhya punar evam bandhu vadha ādi hetukam moham na yāsyasi
translated: Having known, having perceived, the knowledge of the supreme Self which is preceded by the knowledge of the individual soul, you will not again go to delusion caused by the killing of relatives, etc.

original: kathaṃ na yāsyāmītiy atrāha yeneti /🔽yena jñānena bhūtāni devamānavādiśarīrāṇi aśeṣeṇa sāmastyena sarvāṇīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: katham na yāsyāmi iti atra āha yena iti  yena jñānena bhūtāni deva mānava ādi śarīrāṇi aśeṣeṇa sāmastyena sarvāṇi iti arthaḥ
translated: How will I not go? In this regard it is said yena (by which).

original: ātmani svasvarūpe upādhitvena sthitāni tāni pṛthag drakṣyasi /
analyzed: ātmani sva svarūpe upādhi tvena sthitāni tāni pṛthak drakṣyasi
translated: By that knowledge, all the bodies of gods, humans, etc., are seen as separate, existing within the Self, one's own nature, as limiting adjuncts.

original: atho mayi sarveśvare sarvahetau kāryatvena sthitāni tāni drakṣyasīti /
analyzed: atho mayi sarveśvare sarva hetau kārya tvena sthitāni tāni drakṣyasi iti
translated: And you will see them existing as effects in Me, the supreme Lord, the cause of all.

original: etad uktaṃ bhavati dehadvayaviviktā jīvātmānas teṣāṃ harivimukhānāṃ harimāyayaiva deheṣu daihikteṣu ca mamatvāni racitāni /
analyzed: etat uktam bhavati deha dvaya viviktāḥ jīvātmānaḥ teṣām hari vimukhānām hari māyayā eva deheṣu daihikteṣu ca mamatvāni racitāni
translated: This is what is said: The individual souls, distinct from the two bodies, of those averse to Hari, by Hari's Māyā alone, are made to have a sense of possession towards the bodies and their contents.

original: hantṛhantavyabhāvāvabhāsaś ca tayaiva /
analyzed: hantṛ hantavya bhāva avabhāsaḥ ca tayā eva
translated: And the appearance of the relation of killer and killed is also by that [Māyā].

original: śuddhasvarūpāṇāṃ na tattatsambaddhaḥ /
analyzed: śuddha svarūpāṇām na tad tad sambaddhaḥ
translated: For those of pure nature, there is no connection with those [bodies, etc.].

original: paramātmā khalu sarveśvaraḥ svāśritānāṃ jīvānāṃ tattatkarmānuguṇatayā tattaddehendriyāṇi tattaddehayātrāṃ lokāntareṣu
analyzed: paramātmā khalu sarva īśvaraḥ sva āśritānām jīvānām tad tad karma anuguṇa tayā tad tad deha indriyāṇi tad tad deha yātrām loka antareṣu
translated: The Supreme Self, indeed, the Lord of all, when worshipped, provides the individual souls that depend on Him with those bodies, sense organs, and the journeys in those bodies to different worlds,

original: tattatsukhabhogāṃś ca sampādayaty upāsitas tu muktim ity eva jñānino na mohāvakāśa iti ////
analyzed: tad tad sukha bhogān ca sampādayati upāsitaḥ tu muktim iti eva jñāninaḥ na moha avakāśaḥ iti
translated: and the enjoyments of those pleasures, in accordance with their respective actions. But for the wise, there is no scope for delusion, that He grants liberation.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: BhG.

original: api ced asi pāpebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pāpakṛttamaḥ /
analyzed: api ced asi pāpebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pāpa kṛttamaḥ
translated: Even if you are the worst of all sinners,

original: sarvaṃ jñānaplavenaiva vṛjinaṃ santariṣyasi ////
analyzed: sarvam jñāna plavena eva vṛjinam santariṣyasi
translated: you will cross over all that mire by the raft of knowledge alone.

original: śrīdharaḥ / kiṃ ca api ced iti /🔽sarvebhyaḥ pāpakāribhyo yadyapy atiśayena pāpakārī tvam asi /
analyzed: ca        sarvebhyaḥ pāpa kāribhyaḥ yadi api atiśayena pāpa kārī tvam asi
translated: Śrīdhara: And what is more, even if you are the worst of all sinners,

original: tathāpi sarvaṃ pāpasamudraṃ jñānaplavenaiva jñānapotenaiva samyaganāyāsena tariṣyasi ////
analyzed: tathā api sarvam pāpa samudram jñāna plavena eva jñāna potena eva samyak anāyāsena tariṣyasi
translated: if you are the worst of all sinners, even then, you will cross over the entire ocean of sin by the raft of knowledge alone, by the boat of knowledge, without any difficulty.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: kiṃ ca śṛṇu jñānasya māhātmyam api ced iti /
analyzed: kim ca śṛṇu jñānasya māhātmyam api ced iti
translated: Moreover, listen to the greatness of knowledge also, even if, etc.

original: api ced ity asambhāvitābhyupagamapradarśanārthau nipātau /
analyzed: api ced iti asambhāvita abhyupagama pradarśana arthau nipātau
translated: The words even if are used to show the acceptance of what is not possible.

original: yadyapy ayam artho na sambhavaty eva /
analyzed: yadi api ayam arthaḥ na sambhavati eva
translated: Even though this meaning is not possible at all,

original: tathāpi jñānaphalakathanāyābhyupetyocyate /
analyzed: tathā api jñāna phala kathanāya abhyupetya ucyate
translated: nevertheless, it is said by accepting it in order to describe the fruit of knowledge.

original: yadyapi tvaṃ pāpakāribhyaḥ sarvebhyo 'py atiśayena pāpakārī pāpakṛttamaḥ syās
analyzed: yadi api tvam pāpa kāribhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ pi atiśayena pāpa kārī pāpa kṛttamaḥ syāḥ
translated: Even if you are the greatest sinner of all sinners,

original: tathāpi sarvaṃ vṛjinaṃ pāpam atidustaratvenārṇavasadṛśaṃ jñānaplavenaiva nānyena
analyzed: tathā api sarvam vṛjinam pāpam ati dustara tvena arṇava sadṛśam jñāna plavena eva na anyena
translated: even then, all evil, which is like an ocean due to being extremely difficult to cross, can only be crossed by the raft of knowledge, not by anything else.

original: jñānam eva plavaṃ potaṃ kṛtvā santariṣyasi samyag anāyāsena punar āvṛttivarjitatvena
analyzed: jñānam eva plavam potam kṛtvā santariṣyasi samyak anāyāsena punar āvṛtti varjita tvena
translated: Making knowledge itself the raft, the boat, you will cross, i.e. completely and effortlessly, and also without returning again,

original: ca tariṣyasi atikramiṣyasi /
analyzed: ca tariṣyasi atikramiṣyasi
translated: you will cross, i.e. go beyond.

original: vṛjinaśabdenātra dharmādharmarūpaṃ karma saṃsāraphalam abhipretaṃ mumukṣoḥ pāpavat puṇyasyāpy aniṣṭatvāt ////
analyzed: vṛjina śabdena atra dharma adharma rūpam karma saṃsāra phalam abhipretam mumukṣoḥ pāpa vat puṇyasya api aniṣṭa tvāt
translated: Here, the word evil refers to karma in the form of dharma and adharma, which is the fruit of worldly existence, because even merit is undesirable for one who seeks liberation, like sin.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha.

original: jñānasya māhātmyam āha api ced iti /
analyzed: jñānasya māhātmyam āha api ced iti
translated: He says about the greatness of knowledge, even if, etc.

original: pāpibhyaḥ pāpakṛdbhyo 'pi sakāśād yadyapy atiśayena pāpakārī tvam asi /
analyzed: pāpibhyaḥ pāpa kṛdbhyaḥ sakāśāt yadi api atiśayena pāpa kārī tvam asi
translated: Even if you are the greatest sinner among sinners,

original: tathāpi atraitāvat pāpasattve katham antaḥkaraṇaśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: tathā api atra etāvat pāpa sattve katham antaḥkaraṇa śuddhiḥ
translated: Still, how can there be purification of the internal organ in the presence of such sin?

original: tadabhāve ca kathaṃ jñānotpattiḥ /
analyzed: tad abhāve ca katham jñāna utpattiḥ
translated: And in its absence, how can knowledge arise?

original: nāpy utpannajñānasyaitad durācāratvaṃ sambhaved ato 'tra vyākhyā śrīmadhusūdanasarasvatīpādānām api ced ity asambhāvitābhyupagamapradarśanārthau 🔽nipātau /
analyzed: nā api utpanna jñānasya etat durācāra tvam sambhavet vyākhyā śrī madhusūdana sarasvatī pādānām api ced iti asambhāvita abhyupagama pradarśana arthau  nipātau
translated: Nor can it be possible that one whose knowledge has arisen should be guilty of such evil conduct. Therefore, in this matter, the explanation of the venerable Madhusudana Sarasvati is also that the words 'api ca' (even if) are used to show an improbable admission.🔽The word 'api' (even) is used to show that the admission is improbable.

original: yadyapy ayam artho na sambhavaty eva /
analyzed: yadi api ayam arthaḥ na sambhavati eva
translated: Even though this meaning is not possible at all,

original: tathāpi jñānaphalakathanāyābhyupetyocyate ity eṣā ////
analyzed: tathā api jñāna phala kathanāya abhyupetya ucyate iti eṣā
translated: still, it is said by assuming it for the sake of stating the result of knowledge. This is the explanation.

original: baladevaḥ / jñānaprabhāvam āha api ced iti /
translated: Balarama. He states the power of knowledge with the words 'api ca' (even if).

original: yadyapi sarvebhyaḥ pāpakartṛbhyas tvam atiśayena pāpakṛd asi /
analyzed: yadi api sarvebhyaḥ pāpa kartṛbhyaḥ tvam atiśayena pāpa kṛt asi
translated: Even though you are the most sinful of all sinful doers,

original: tathāpi sarvaṃ vṛjinaṃ nikhilaṃ pāpaṃ dustaratvenārṇavatulyam uktalakṣaṇajñānaplavena santariṣyasi ////
analyzed: tathā api sarvam vṛjinam nikhilam pāpam dustara tvena arṇava tulyam ukta lakṣaṇa jñāna plavena santariṣyasi
translated: still, you will cross over all evil, all sin, which is said to be difficult to cross like the ocean, by the raft of the knowledge described above.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: yathaidhāṃsi samiddho 'gnir bhasmasāt kurute 'rjuna /
analyzed: yathā edhāṃsi samiddhaḥ gniḥ bhasmasāt kurute rjuna
translated: As a fire well-kindled reduces wood to ash, O Arjuna,

original: jñānāgniḥ sarvakarmāṇi bhasmasāt kurute tathā ////
analyzed: jñāna agniḥ sarva karmāṇi bhasmasāt kurute tathā
translated: so does the fire of knowledge reduce all actions to ash.

original: śrīdharaḥ / samudravat sthitasyaiva pāpasyātilaṅghanamātraṃ /
translated: Sridhara: The mere crossing over of sin which remains like the ocean,

original: na tu pāpasya nāśaḥ /
analyzed: na tu pāpasya nāśaḥ
translated: but not the destruction of sin.

original: iti bhrāntiṃ dṛṣṭāntena vārayann āha yathaidhāṃsīti /
analyzed: iti bhrāntim dṛṣṭāntena vārayan āha yathā edhāṃsi iti
translated: To remove this misconception by an example, he says, As fuel...

original: edhāṃsi kāṣṭhāni pradīpto 'gnir yathā bhasmībhāvaṃ nayati tathātmajñānam āpanno mumukṣuḥ kālena mahatātmani vindati labhata ity arthaḥ ////
analyzed: edhāṃsi kāṣṭhāni pradīptaḥ gniḥ yathā bhasmībhāvam nayati tathā ātma jñānam āpannaḥ mumukṣuḥ kālena mahatā ātmani vindati labhate iti arthaḥ
translated: Just as a blazing fire reduces fuel to ashes, so the seeker of liberation, who has attained self-knowledge, finds, i.e., obtains, the Self after a long time.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: nanu samudravat taraṇe karmaṇāṃ nāśo na syād ity āśaṅkya dṛṣṭāntaram āha yathaidhāṃsīti /
analyzed: nanu samudra vat taraṇe karmaṇām nāśaḥ na syāt iti āśaṅkya dṛṣṭāntaram āha yathā edhāṃsi iti
translated: Now, fearing that if one crosses over like the ocean, the karma would not be destroyed, he gives another example: As fuel...

original: yathaidhāṃsi kāṣṭhāni samiddhaḥ prajvalito 'gnir bhasmasāt kurute bhasmībhāvaṃ nayati
analyzed: yathā edhāṃsi kāṣṭhāni samiddhaḥ prajvalitaḥ agniḥ bhasmasāt kurute bhasmībhāvam nayati
translated: Just as a blazing fire reduces fuel to ashes, i.e., brings it to the state of ashes,

original: he 'rjuna jñānāgniḥ sarvakarmāṇi pāpāni puṇyāni cāviśeṣeṇa prārabdhaphalabhinnāni
analyzed: he rjuna jñāna agniḥ sarva karmāṇi pāpāni puṇyāni ca aviśeṣeṇa prārabdha phala bhinnāni
translated: O Arjuna, the fire of knowledge reduces all actions, whether sinful or meritorious, except those that have begun to bear fruit,

original: bhasmasāt kurute tathā tatkāraṇājñānavināśena vināśayatīty arthaḥ /
analyzed: bhasmasāt kurute tathā tad kāraṇa ajñāna vināśena vināśayati iti arthaḥ
translated: to ashes, i.e., destroys them by the destruction of the ignorance that is their cause.

original: tathā ca śrutiḥ
analyzed: tathā ca śrutiḥ
translated: And thus the scripture says:

original: bhidyate hṛdayagranthiś chidyante sarvasaṃśayāḥ /
analyzed: bhidyate hṛdaya granthiḥ chidyante sarva saṃśayāḥ
translated: The knot of the heart is split, all doubts are destroyed,

original: kṣīyante cāsya karmāṇi tasmin dṛṣṭe parāvare // MuṇḍU / / iti /
analyzed: kṣīyante ca asya karmāṇi tasmin dṛṣṭe parāvare muṇḍu iti
translated: And his actions are destroyed when he has seen the highest and the lowest.

original: tadadhigama uttarapūrvārdhayor aśleṣavināśau tadvyapadeśāt /
analyzed: tad adhigame uttara pūrva ardhayoḥ aśleṣa vināśau tad vyapadeśāt
translated: The non-adhesion and destruction of that [knowledge] in the latter half and the eastern half are declared by that [scripture].

original: itarasyāpy evam asaṃśleṣaḥ pāte tu Vs / / / iti ca sūtre /
analyzed: itarasya api evam asaṃśleṣaḥ pāte tu iti ca sūtre
translated: In another scripture also, it is said: In the same way, there is no adhesion [of the soul to the body], but at death...

original: anārabdhe puṇyapāpe naśyata evety atra sūtram anārabdhakārya eva tu pūrve tadavadheḥ Vs / / / iti /
analyzed: anārabdhe puṇya pāpe naśyataḥ eva iti atra sūtram anārabdha kārye eva tu pūrve tad avadheḥ iti
translated: But when merit and demerit have not begun to operate, they are destroyed. Here is the scripture: But only those whose effects have not begun to operate, because of the declaration of that [scripture].

original: jñānotpādakadehārambhakāṇāṃ tu taddehānta eva vināśaḥ /
analyzed: jñāna utpādaka deha ārambhakāṇām tu tad deha ante eva vināśaḥ
translated: But those that produce the body that gives rise to knowledge are destroyed only at the end of that body.

original: tasya tāvad eva ciraṃ yāvan na vimokṣye ChāndU / / iti śruteḥ /
analyzed: tasya tāvat eva ciram yāvat na vimokṣye chāndu iti śruteḥ
translated: For the scripture says: It remains only so long as it is not liberated.

original: bhogena tv itare kṣapayitvā sampadyate Vs / / / iti sūtrāc ca /
analyzed: bhogena tu itare kṣapayitvā sampadyate iti sūtrāt ca
translated: And from the scripture: But by enjoyment, having destroyed the other [bodies], he attains union.

original: ādhikārikāṇāṃ tu yāny eva jñānotpādakadehārambhakāṇi tāny eva dehāntarārambhakāṇy api /
analyzed: ādhikārikāṇām tu yāni eva jñāna utpādaka deha ārambhakāṇi tāni eva deha antara ārambhakāṇi api
translated: But those that produce the body that gives rise to knowledge are also those that produce another body for those who are entitled.

original: yathā vasiṣṭāpāntaratamaḥprabhṛtīnām /
analyzed: yathā vasiṣṭa apāntaratamaḥ prabhṛtīnām
translated: Like those of Vasiṣṭha, Apāntaratama, and others.

original: tathā ca sūtraṃ yāvadadhikāram avasthitir ādhikārikāṇām Vs / / / iti /
analyzed: tathā ca sūtram yāvadadhikāram avasthitiḥ ādhikārikāṇām iti
translated: And so the scripture says: The state of those who are entitled lasts as long as their entitlement.

original: adhikāro 'nekadehārambhakaṃ balavatprārabdhaphalaṃ karma /
analyzed: adhikāraḥ neka deha ārambhakam balavat prārabdha phalam karma
translated: Adhikāra is powerful prārabdha-phala karma, which causes the birth of many bodies.

original: tac copāsakānām eva nānyeṣāṃ /
analyzed: tat ca upāsakānām eva na anyeṣām
translated: And that is only for the devotees, not for others.

original: anārabdhaphalāni naśyanti ārabdhaphalāni tu
analyzed: anārabdha phalāni naśyanti ārabdha phalāni tu
translated: Those that have not begun to bear fruit perish, but those that have begun to bear fruit

original: yāvadbhogasamāpti tiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: yāvadbhogasamāpti tiṣṭhanti
translated: remain until the end of their enjoyment.

original: bhogaś caikena dehenānekena veti na viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: bhogaḥ ca ekena dehena anekena vā iti na viśeṣaḥ
translated: And there is no difference whether the enjoyment is with one body or many.

original: vistaras tv ākara draṣṭavyaḥ ////
analyzed: vistaraḥ tu ākara draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The details should be seen in the Ākara.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Viśvanātha.

original: śuddhāntaḥkaraṇasyotpannaṃ tu prārabdhabhinnaṃ karmamātraṃ vināśayatīti sadṛṣṭāntam āha yatheti /🔽samiddhaḥ prajvalitaḥ ////
analyzed: śuddha antaḥkaraṇasya utpannam tu prārabdha bhinnam karma mātram vināśayati iti sa dṛṣṭāntam āha yathā iti  samiddhaḥ prajvalitaḥ
translated: But it destroys only the karma that has arisen from a pure mind, except for the prārabdha karma. With an example, he says: Yatha, as; samiddhaḥ, the well-kindled; agniḥ, fire; kurute, reduces to ashes; edhāṃsi, the fuel, the logs.🔽Similarly, jñānāgniḥ, the fire of knowledge, the fire of the experience of one's own and the Supreme Self; kurute, reduces to ashes; sarvāṇi, all; karmāṇi, actions, both meritorious and sinful; prārabdhāny etarāṇi ca, whether they have begun to bear fruit or not.

original: baladevaḥ / brahmavidyayā pāpakarmāṇi naśyantīty uktam /
analyzed: baladevaḥ brahma vidyayā pāpa karmāṇi naśyanti iti uktam
translated: Baladeva. It has been said that sins are destroyed by the knowledge of Brahman.

original: idānīṃ puṇyakarmāṇy api naśyantīty āha yatheti /
analyzed: idānīm puṇya karmāṇi api naśyanti iti āha yathā iti
translated: Now, he says that even meritorious actions are destroyed, with the word yathā, as.

original: edhāṃsi kāṣṭhāni samiddhaḥ prajvalito 'gnir yathā bhasmasāt kurute /
analyzed: edhāṃsi kāṣṭhāni samiddhaḥ prajvalitaḥ gniḥ yathā bhasmasāt kurute
translated: As a well-kindled, blazing fire reduces logs to ashes,

original: tathā jñānāgniḥ svaparātmānubhavavahniḥ sarvāṇi karmāṇi puṇyāni pāpāni ca prārabdhetarāṇi bhasmasāt kurute /
analyzed: tathā jñāna agniḥ sva para ātma anubhava vahniḥ sarvāṇi karmāṇi puṇyāni pāpāni ca prārabdha itarāṇi bhasmasāt kurute
translated: so the fire of knowledge, the fire of the experience of one's own and the Supreme Self, reduces all actions, both meritorious and sinful, whether they have begun to bear fruit or not, to ashes.

original: tatra sañcitāni prārabdhetarāṇīpīkatulavan nirdahati kriyamāṇāni padmapatrāmbubinduvad
analyzed: tatra sañcitāni prārabdha itarāṇi pīka tula vat nirdahati kriyamāṇāni padma patra ambu bindu vat
translated: There, the accumulated [karmas] that have not yet begun to give results, like a heap of cotton, He burns. Those being performed, like a drop of water on a lotus leaf,

original: viśeṣayati prārabdhāni tu tatprabhāvenātijīrṇāny api satpathapracārārthayā harer
analyzed: viśeṣayati prārabdhāni tu tad prabhāvena ati jīrṇāni api sat patha pracāra arthayā hareḥ
translated: He distinguishes. But those that have begun to give results, even if very old by His power, He establishes for the purpose of practicing the good path,

original: icchayaivātmānubhaviny avasthāpayatīti /
analyzed: icchayā eva ātmā anubhavini avasthāpayati iti
translated: by the will of Hari, the experiencer of the Self.

original: śrutiś ca ubhe uhaivaiṣa ete taraty amṛtaḥ sādhvasādhunī iti /
analyzed: śrutiḥ ca ubhe uha eva eṣa ete tarati amṛtaḥ sādhu asādhunī iti
translated: And the Śruti says: By both of these, he who is immortal crosses over good and evil.

original: eṣa brahmānubhavī ubhe saṃcitya kriyamāṇe ete sādhvasādhunī puṇyapāpe karmaṇī tarati krāmatīty arthaḥ /🔽evam āha sūtrakāraḥ tadadhigama uttarapūrvārdhayor aśleṣavināśau tadvyapadeśāt
analyzed: eṣa brahma anubhavī ubhe saṃcitya kriyamāṇe ete sādhu asādhunī puṇya pāpe karmaṇī tarati krāmati iti arthaḥ  evam āha sūtrakāraḥ tad adhigamaḥ uttara pūrva ardhayoḥ aśleṣa vināśau tad vyapadeśāt
translated: This one who experiences Brahman, by both of these, the accumulated and the being performed, he crosses over these good and evil, meritorious and sinful actions. The meaning is: he goes beyond them.🔽Thus the author of the aphorisms says: The attainment of that [Brahman] is the non-adhesion and destruction of the latter half and the former half, because of the declaration of that [Brahman].

original: Vs / / / ity ādibhiḥ ////
analyzed: iti ādibhiḥ
translated: And so on with V.S. etc.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: Bhagavad Gita

original: na hi jñānena sadṛśaṃ pavitram iha vidyate /
analyzed: na hi jñānena sadṛśam pavitram iha vidyate
translated: For there is nothing pure in this world that is equal to Knowledge.

original: tat svayaṃ yogasaṃsiddhaḥ kālenātmani vindati ////
analyzed: tat svayam yoga saṃsiddhaḥ kālena ātmani vindati
translated: By Yoga perfected, one attains it in one's own Self by time.

original: śrīdharaḥ / tatra hetum āha na hīti /
translated: Shridhar: There, He states the reason with For there is nothing pure...

original: pavitraṃ śuddhikaram /
analyzed: pavitram śuddhi karam
translated: Pure means that which causes purification.

original: iha tapoyogādiṣu madhye jñānatulyaṃ nāsty eva /
analyzed: iha tapaḥ yoga ādiṣu madhye jñāna tulyam na asti eva
translated: Among austerities, Yoga, etc., nothing is equal to Knowledge.

original: tarhi sarve 'pi kim ity ātmajñānam eva nābhyasanta iti /
analyzed: tarhi sarve pi kim iti ātma jñānam eva na abhyasantaḥ iti
translated: Then why don't all people practice only the knowledge of the Self?

original: ata āha tat svayam iti sārdhena /
analyzed: atas āha tat svayam iti sārdhena
translated: To this he says with the next half verse: That knowledge of the Self, he attains by himself in time, through the perfection of yoga.

original: tad ātmani viṣaye jñānaṃ kālena mahatā karmayogena saṃsiddho yogyatāṃ prāptaḥ san svayam evānāyāsena labhate /
analyzed: tat ātmani viṣaye jñānam kālena mahatā karmayogena saṃsiddhaḥ yogyatām prāptaḥ san svayam eva anāyāsena labhate
translated: That knowledge of the Self as the object, he attains by himself without effort, in time, when he has attained fitness through the perfection of yoga.

original: na tu karmayogaṃ vinety arthaḥ ////
analyzed: na tu karma yogam vinā iti arthaḥ
translated: But not without the yoga of action, is the meaning.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana.

original: yasmād evaṃ tasmāt na hīti /
analyzed: yasmāt evam tasmāt na hi iti
translated: Since it is so, therefore, it is said: For there is nothing...

original: na hi jñānena sadṛśaṃ pavitram pāvanaṃ śuddhikaram anyad iha vede lokavyavahāre vā vidyate /
analyzed: na hi jñānena sadṛśam pavitram pāvanam śuddhi karam anyat iha vede lokavyavahāre vā vidyate
translated: For there is nothing in this world or in worldly transactions that is as purifying, as cleansing, as making pure, as knowledge.

original: jñānabhinnasya ajñānānivartakatvena samūlapāpanivartakatvābhāvāt kāraṇasadbhāvena punaḥ pāpodayāc ca /
analyzed: jñāna bhinnasya ajñāna anivartaka tvena samūla pāpa nivartaka tva abhāvāt kāraṇa sadbhāvena punar pāpa udayāt ca
translated: Because what is different from knowledge does not remove ignorance and does not remove sin along with its roots, and because sin arises again due to the presence of its cause.

original: jñānena tv ajñānanivṛttyā samūlapāpanivṛttir iti tatsamam anyac ca vidyate /
analyzed: jñānena tu ajñāna nivṛttyā sa mūla pāpa nivṛttiḥ iti tad samam anyat ca vidyate
translated: But by knowledge, there is the removal of ignorance and the removal of sin along with its roots. Therefore, there is nothing equal to it.

original: tad ātmaviṣayaṃ jñānaṃ sarveṣāṃ kim iti jhaṭiti notpadyate /
analyzed: tat ātma viṣayam jñānam sarveṣām kim iti jhaṭiti nā utpadyate
translated: Then why does that knowledge of the Self not arise immediately for all?

original: tatrāha taj jñānaṃ kālena mahatā yogasaṃsiddho yogena pūrvoktakarmayogena saṃsiddhaḥ
analyzed: tatra āha tat jñānam kālena mahatā yoga saṃsiddhaḥ yogena pūrva ukta karma yogena saṃsiddhaḥ
translated: To this he says: That knowledge, he attains by himself in time, through the perfection of yoga. He who is perfected through yoga, through the yoga of action mentioned earlier,

original: saṃskṛto yogyatām āpannaḥ svayam ātmany antaḥkaraṇe vindati labhate na tu yogayatām
analyzed: saṃskṛtaḥ yogyatām āpannaḥ svayam ātmani antaḥkaraṇe vindati labhate na tu yogayatām
translated: One who is purified, who has attained fitness, finds, obtains, in his own self, in his own internal organ, but not fitness attained.

original: āpanno 'nyadattaṃ svaniṣṭhatayā na vā paraniṣṭhaṃ svīyatayā vindatīty arthaḥ // //
analyzed: āpannaḥ nyadattam sva niṣṭha tayā na vā para niṣṭham svīya tayā vindati iti arthaḥ
translated: One who has attained fitness does not find what is given by another as his own, nor what is his own as belonging to another. This is the meaning.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
translated: Visvanatha:

original: iha tapoyogādiyukteṣu madhye jñānena sadṛśaṃ pavitraṃ kim api nāsti /
analyzed: iha tapaḥ yoga ādi yukteṣu madhye jñānena sadṛśam pavitram kim api nā asti
translated: Here, among those endowed with austerities, yoga, etc., there is nothing equal to knowledge as a purifier.

original: taj jñānaṃ na sarvasulabham /
analyzed: tat jñānam na sarva sulabham
translated: That knowledge is not easily available to all.

original: kintu yogena niṣkāmakarmayogena samyak siddha eva /
analyzed: kintu yogena niṣkāma karmayogena samyak siddhaḥ eva
translated: But only one who is well accomplished through yoga, through action without desire for results,

original: na tv aparipakvaḥ /
analyzed: na tu a paripakvaḥ
translated: and not one who is not fully ripe.

original: so 'pi kālenaiva /
analyzed: saḥ pi kālena eva
translated: And that too only through time,

original: na tu sadyaḥ /
analyzed: na tu sadyas
translated: not immediately.

original: ātmani svasmin svayaṃ prāptaṃ vindati /
analyzed: ātmani svasmin svayam prāptam vindati
translated: One finds, obtains, in one's own self, what is attained by oneself.

original: na tu sannyāsagrahaṇamātreṇaiveti bhāvaḥ ////🔽baladevaḥ / na hīti /
analyzed: na tu sannyāsa grahaṇa mātreṇa eva iti bhāvaḥ  baladevaḥ na hi iti
translated: The idea is that it is not merely by taking up renunciation.

original: hi yato jñānena sadṛśaṃ pavitraṃ śuddhikaraṃ tapas tīrthāṭanādikaṃ nāsti /
analyzed: hi yatas jñānena sadṛśam pavitram śuddhi karam tapaḥ tīrtha aṭana ādikam na asti
translated: Baladeva: Na hi, because; jnanena, by knowledge; na asti, there is nothing; pavitram, purifying, that brings about purification; tapasa, through austerities; tirtha-snana, bathing at holy places, etc.; yat, which is equal to; tat, that knowledge, which destroys all sins.

original: atas tat sarvapāpanāśakaṃ taj jñānaṃ na sarvasulabhaṃ /
analyzed: atas tat sarva pāpa nāśakam tat jñānam na sarva sulabham
translated: Therefore, that knowledge, which destroys all sins, is not easily available to all.

original: kintu yogena niṣkāmakarmaṇā saṃsiddhaḥ paripakva eva kālenaiva /
analyzed: kintu yogena niṣkāma karmaṇā saṃsiddhaḥ paripakvaḥ eva kālena eva
translated: But only one who is well accomplished, fully ripe, through yoga, through action without desire for results, through time,

original: na tu sadyaḥ /
analyzed: na tu sadyas
translated: not immediately.

original: ātmani svasmin svayaṃ labdhaṃ vindati /
analyzed: ātmani svasmin svayam labdham vindati
translated: One finds that which is obtained by oneself in one's own self.

original: na tu pārivrājyagrahaṇamātreṇeti ////
analyzed: na tu pārivrājya grahaṇa mātreṇa iti
translated: But not merely by taking up the life of a wandering mendicant.

original: BhG /
analyzed: bhg
translated: (Bhagavad Gita 4.39)

original: śraddhāvāṃl labhate jñānaṃ tatparaḥ saṃyatendriyaḥ /
analyzed: śraddhāvān labhate jñānam tad paraḥ saṃyata indriyaḥ
translated: One who has faith obtains knowledge, being devoted to that and with senses controlled.🔽Having obtained knowledge, one quickly attains the highest peace.

original: jñānaṃ labdhvā parāṃ śāntim acireṇādhigacchati ////
analyzed: jñānam labdhvā parām śāntim acireṇa adhigacchati
translated: (Bhagavad Gita 4.40)

original: śrīdharaḥ / kiṃ ca śraddhāvān iti /
analyzed: ca
translated: Sridhar: Moreover, it is said, One who has faith...

original: śraddhāvān gurūpadiṣṭe 'rthe āstikyabuddhimān /
analyzed: śraddhāvān guru upadiṣṭe rthe āstikya buddhimān
translated: One who has faith is one who has the conviction that the meaning taught by the guru is true.

original: tatparas tadekaniṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: tad paraḥ tad ekaniṣṭhaḥ
translated: Devoted to that, being solely intent on that.

original: saṃyatendriyaś ca /
analyzed: saṃyata indriyaḥ ca
translated: And with senses controlled.

original: taj jñānaṃ labhate /
analyzed: tat jñānam labhate
translated: He obtains that knowledge.

original: nānyaḥ /
analyzed: na anyaḥ
translated: Not anyone else.

original: ataḥ śraddhādisampattyā jñānalābhāt prāk karmayoga eva śuddhyartham anuṣṭheyaḥ /
analyzed: atas śraddhā ādi sampattyā jñāna lābhāt prāk karmayogaḥ eva śuddhi artham anuṣṭheyaḥ
translated: Therefore, before obtaining knowledge due to the perfection of faith and so on, Karma Yoga alone should be practiced for the sake of purification.

original: jñānalābhānantaraṃ tu na tasya kiṃcit kartavyam ity āha jñānaṃ labdhvā tu mokṣam acireṇa prāpnoti ////
analyzed: jñāna lābha anantaram tu na tasya kiṃcid kartavyam iti āha jñānam labdhvā tu mokṣam acireṇa prāpnoti
translated: But after obtaining knowledge, he has nothing to do. This is said: Having obtained knowledge, one attains liberation quickly.

original: madhusūdanaḥ /
analyzed: madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Madhusudana:

original: yenaikāntena jñānaprāptir bhavati sa upāyaḥ pūrvoktapraṇipātādyapekṣayāpy āsannatara ucyate śraddhāvān iti /
analyzed: yena ekāntena jñāna prāptiḥ bhavati saḥ upāyaḥ pūrva ukta praṇipāta ādi apekṣayā api āsannataraḥ ucyate śraddhāvān iti
translated: The means by which the attainment of knowledge becomes one-sided is said to be even closer than the previously mentioned prostration and so on, which are said to be one who has faith.

original: guruvedāntavākyeṣv idam ittham veti pramārūpāstikyabuddhiḥ śraddhā tadvān puruṣo labhate jñānam /
analyzed: guru vedānta vākyeṣu idam ittham vā iti pramā rūpa āstikya buddhiḥ śraddhā tadvān puruṣaḥ labhate jñānam
translated: One who has faith, i.e., the conviction in the form of valid knowledge that this is so in the words of the teacher's Vedanta, that person obtains knowledge.

original: etādṛśo 'pi kaścid alasaḥ syāt tatrāha tatparaḥ /
analyzed: kaścid alasaḥ syāt tatra āha tatparaḥ
translated: Even such a one may be lazy. To that, he says: devoted to that.

original: gurūpāsanādau jñānopāye 'tyantābhiyuktaḥ /
analyzed: guru upāsana ādau jñāna upāye tyanta abhiyuktaḥ
translated: Extremely diligent in the means of knowledge such as serving the teacher.

original: śraddhāvāṃs tatparo 'pi kaścid ajitendriyaḥ syād ata āha saṃyatendriyaḥ /
analyzed: śraddhāvān tad paraḥ api kaścid ajita indriyaḥ syāt atas āha saṃyata indriyaḥ
translated: One who has faith and is devoted to that may be someone with uncontrolled senses. Therefore, he says: with controlled senses.

original: saṃyatāni viṣayebhyo nivartitānīndriyāṇi yena sa saṃyatendriyaḥ /
analyzed: saṃyatāni viṣayebhyaḥ nivartitāni indriyāṇi yena sa saṃyata indriyaḥ
translated: One in whom the senses have been turned away from the objects is one with controlled senses.

original: ya evaṃ viśeṣaṇatrayayuktaḥ so 'vaśyaṃ jñānaṃ labhate /
analyzed: yaḥ evam viśeṣaṇa traya yuktaḥ saḥ vaśyam jñānam labhate
translated: One who is endowed with these three qualifications certainly obtains knowledge.

original: praṇipātādis tu bāhyo māyāvitvādisambhavād anaikāntiko 'pi /
analyzed: praṇipāta ādiḥ tu bāhyaḥ māyāvi tva ādi sambhavāt anaikāntikaḥ pi
translated: But bowing down etc. are external and inconclusive due to the possibility of deception etc.

original: śraddhāvattvādis tv aikāntika upāya ity arthaḥ /
analyzed: śraddhāvat tva ādiḥ tu aikāntikaḥ upāyaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: But having faith etc. is the sole means. This is the meaning.

original: īdṛśenopāyena jñānaṃ labdhvā parāṃ caramāṃ śāntim avidyātatkāryanivṛttirūpāṃ muktim acireṇa tadavyavadhānenaivādhigacchati labhate /
analyzed: īdṛśena upāyena jñānam labdhvā parām caramām śāntim avidyā tad kārya nivṛtti rūpām muktim acireṇa tad avyavadhānena eva adhigacchati labhate
translated: Having obtained knowledge by this kind of means, one quickly attains the highest, final peace, which is liberation in the form of the cessation of ignorance and its effects, without any obstruction.

original: yathā hi dīpaḥ svotpattimātreṇaivāndhakāranivṛttiṃ karoti na tu kaṃcit sahakāriṇam
analyzed: yathā hi dīpaḥ sva utpatti mātreṇa eva andhakāra nivṛttim karoti na tu kaṃcid sahakāriṇam
translated: Just as a lamp, by its mere arising, removes darkness and does not depend on any auxiliary cause,

original: apekṣate tathā jñānam api svotpattimātreṇaivājñānanivṛttiṃ karoti na tu kiṃcit
analyzed: apekṣate tathā jñānam api sva utpatti mātreṇa evā ajñāna nivṛttim karoti na tu kiṃcid
translated: in the same way, knowledge, by its mere arising, removes ignorance and does not depend on any reflection, etc.

original: prasaṅkhyānādikam apekṣata iti bhāvaḥ // //
analyzed: prasaṅkhyāna ādikam apekṣate iti bhāvaḥ
translated: This is the idea.

original: viśvanāthaḥ /
